translation.ga: Spreagann na cytokines cealla imdhíonachta chun líon mór saorfhréamhacha a scaoileadh atá mar phríomhchúis le ards agus le cliseadh iolrach orgán.

translation.en: Immunosuppression is essential in the treatment of cytokine storms, especially in severe patients.
translation.ga: Tá imdhíon-imdhíonacht riachtanach i gcóireáil stoirmeacha cytokine, go háirithe in othair thromchúiseacha.

translation.en: Corticosteroids and tocilizumab, an anti-il6 monoclonal antibody, have been used to treat cytokine storm.
translation.ga: Baineadh úsáid as corticosteroids agus tocilizumab, antashubstaint monoclonal frith-il6, chun stoirm cytokine a chóireáil.

translation.en: Other immunosuppression treatments for cytokine storm include the modulation of t cell-directed immune response; the blockade of ifn-γ, il-1, and tnf; jak inhibition; blinatumomab; suppressor of cytokine signaling 4; and hdac inhibitors.
translation.ga: I measc na gcóireálacha frith-imdhíonachta eile le haghaidh stoirm cytokine tá modhnú ar fhreagairt imdhíonachta t-chill; imshuí ifn-γ, il-1, agus tnf; toirmeasc jak; blinatumomab; comharthaíocht cytokine 4 a chur faoi chois; agus coscairí hdac.

translation.en: Steroids, as immunosuppressants, were widely used in the treatment of sars to reduce the severity of inflammatory damage.
translation.ga: Baineadh úsáid fhorleathan as stéaróidigh, mar imdhíon-imdhíonóirí, i gcóireáil sars chun déine an damáiste athlastach a laghdú.

translation.en: However, steroids at high dosages were not beneficial to severe lung injury in sars and covid-19 patients.
translation.ga: Mar sin féin, níor thairbhigh stéaróidigh ag dáileoga arda díobháil mhór scamhóg in othair sars agus covid-19.

translation.en: Instead, they may cause severe side effects, especially avascular osteonecrosis, dramatically affecting the prognosis.
translation.ga: Ina áit sin, is féidir leo fo-iarsmaí tromchúiseacha a chur faoi deara, go háirithe osteonecróis soithíoch, a théann i bhfeidhm go mór ar an prognóis.

translation.en: Nevertheless, short courses of corticosteroids at low-to-moderate doses have been recommended to be used prudently for critically ill covid-19 patients.
translation.ga: Mar sin féin, moltar gearrchúrsaí corticosteroidí ag dáileoga measartha íseal a úsáid go stuama d ’ othair covid-19 atá go dona tinn.

translation.en: At the time of writing, no effective antiviral therapy has been confirmed.
translation.ga: Agus é seo á scríobh, níor dearbhaíodh aon teiripe éifeachtach frithvíreas.

translation.en: However, intravenous administration with remdesivir, a nucleotide analog, has been found to be efficacious in an american patient with covid-19.
translation.ga: Fuarthas amach, áfach, go raibh riarachán infhéitheach le remdesivir, analóg núicléitíde, éifeachtach in othar meiriceánach le covid-19.

translation.en: Remdesivir is a novel antiviral drug developed by gilead initially for the treatment of diseases caused by ebola and marlburg viruses.
translation.ga: Is druga frithvíreas nua é remdesivir a d ’ fhorbair gilead ar dtús chun cóireáil a dhéanamh ar ghalair de bharr víris ebola agus marlburg.

translation.en: Later, remdesivir also demonstrated possible inhibition of other single stranded rna viruses including mers and sars viruses.
translation.ga: Níos déanaí, léirigh remdesivir cosc ​ ​ féideartha ar víris rna aon-shnáithe eile lena n-áirítear víris mers agus sars.

translation.en: Based on these, gilead has provided the compound to china to conduct a pair of trials on sars-cov-2-infected individuals, and the results are highly anticipated.
translation.ga: Bunaithe orthu seo, chuir gilead an comhdhúil ar fáil don tsín chun péire trialacha a dhéanamh ar dhaoine aonair atá ionfhabhtaithe le sars-cov-2, agus táthar ag súil go mór leis na torthaí.

translation.en: In addition, baricitinb, interferon-α, lopinavir / ritonavir, and ribavirin have been suggested as potential therapies for patients with acute respiratory symptoms.
translation.ga: Ina theannta sin, moladh baricitinb, interferon-α, lopinavir / ritonavir, agus ribavirin mar theiripí féideartha d ’ othair a bhfuil comharthaí géara riospráide orthu.

translation.en: Diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, liver damage, and other adverse reactions can occur following combined therapy with lopinavir / ritonavir.
translation.ga: Is féidir buinneach, nausea, vomiting, damáiste ae, agus frithghníomhartha díobhálacha eile a tharlú tar éis teiripe teaglaim le lopinavir / ritonavir.

translation.en: The interaction of these treatments with other drugs used in the patients should be monitored carefully.
translation.ga: Ba cheart monatóireacht chúramach a dhéanamh ar idirghníomhaíocht na gcóireálacha seo le drugaí eile a úsáidtear in othair.

translation.en: Plasma from recovered patients and antibody generation
translation.ga: Plasma ó othair aisghafa agus giniúint antashubstaintí

translation.en: The collection of the blood from patients who recovered from a contagious disease to treat other patients suffering from the same disease or to protect healthy individuals from catching the disease has a long history.
translation.ga: Tá stair fhada ann maidir le fuil a bhailiú ó othair a tháinig slán ó ghalar tógálach chun cóir leighis a chur ar othair eile atá ag fulaingt ón ngalar céanna nó chun daoine sláintiúla a chosaint ar ghabháil an ghalair.

translation.en: Indeed, recovered patients often have a relatively high level of antibodies against the pathogen in their blood.
translation.ga: Déanta na fírinne, is minic go mbíonn leibhéal an-ard antashubstaintí ag othair atá ag téarnamh i gcoinne an phataigin ina gcuid fola.

translation.en: Antibodies are an immunoglobulin (ig) produced by b lymphocytes to fight pathogens and other foreign objects and they recognize unique molecules in the pathogens and neutralize them directly.
translation.ga: Táirgeann antasubstaintí inmunoglobulin (ig) ag limficítí b chun pataiginí agus rudaí eachtracha eile a throid agus móilíní uathúla sna pataiginí a aithint agus iad a neodrú go díreach.

translation.en: Based on this, plasma was collected from the blood of a group of patients who recovered from covid-19 and was injected into 10 seriously ill patients.
translation.ga: Bunaithe ar seo, bailíodh plasma ó fhuil ghrúpa othar aisghafa ó covid-19 agus instealladh é i 10 n-othar a bhí go dona tinn.

translation.en: Their symptoms improved within 24 hours, accompanied by reduced inflammation and viral loads and improved oxygen saturation in the blood.
translation.ga: Tháinig feabhas ar a gcuid comharthaí laistigh de 24 uair an chloig, in éineacht le athlasadh laghdaithe agus ualaí víreasacha agus saturation ocsaigine san fhuil a fheabhsú.

translation.en: However, verification and clarification are necessary to propose the method for large-scale use before specific therapies are not yet developed.
translation.ga: Teastaíonn fíorú agus soiléiriú, áfach, chun an modh le haghaidh úsáide ar mhórscála a mholadh sula ndéantar teiripí ar leith a fhorbairt fós.

translation.en: In addition, given the therapeutic effects, some disadvantages associated with the plasma should be considered carefully.
translation.ga: Ina theannta sin, i bhfianaise na n-éifeachtaí teiripeacha, ba cheart roinnt míbhuntáistí a bhaineann le plasma a mheas go cúramach.

translation.en: For example, antibodies can overstimulate the immune response and cause cytokine release syndrome, which is potentially a life-threatening toxicity.
translation.ga: Mar shampla, is féidir le antasubstaintí an freagra imdhíonachta a rómheastachán agus siondróm scaoileadh cytokine a chur faoi deara, rud a d ’ fhéadfadh tocsaineacht atá bagrach don bheatha a bheith mar thoradh air.

translation.en: The concentration of antibodies in the blood is usually low, and the demand for the plasma is large to treat critically ill patients.
translation.ga: Is gnách go mbíonn tiúchan antasubstaintí san fhuil íseal, agus tá an-éileamh ar phlasma chun othair atá go dona tinn a chóireáil.

translation.en: It is difficult to develop and produce specific antibodies rapidly enough to fight against a global epidemic.
translation.ga: Tá sé deacair antasubstaintí sonracha a fhorbairt agus a tháirgeadh go tapa go leor chun eipidéim dhomhanda a throid.

translation.en: Thus, it is more critical and practical to isolate b cells from recovered patients and identify the genetic codes encoding effective antibodies or screen for effective antibodies against essential proteins of the virus.
translation.ga: Dá bhrí sin, tá sé níos criticiúla agus níos praiticiúla cealla b a leithlisiú ó othair a aisghabháil agus na cóid ghéiniteacha a ionchódaíonn antasubstaintí nó scáileán éifeachtach a aithint le haghaidh antasubstaintí éifeachtacha i gcoinne próitéiní riachtanacha an víris.

translation.en: This way, we can readily scale up the production of the antibodies.
translation.ga: Ar an mbealach seo, is féidir linn táirgeadh antasubstaintí a mhéadú go héasca.

translation.en: Tcm has been used to treat a variety of diseases in china for thousands of years.
translation.ga: Baineadh úsáid as tcm chun galair éagsúla sa tsín a chóireáil leis na mílte bliain.

translation.en: However, its effects largely rely on a combination of multiple components in a formula that varies depending on the diagnosis of a disease based on the theories of tcm.
translation.ga: Mar sin féin, tá a éifeachtaí ag brath den chuid is mó ar theaglaim de chomhpháirteanna iomadúla i bhfoirmle a athraíonn ag brath ar dhiagnóisiú galair bunaithe ar theoiricí tcm.

translation.en: Most of the effective components remain unknown or are vague as it is difficult to extract and verify such components or their optimal combinations.
translation.ga: Níl an chuid is mó de na comhpháirteanna éifeachtacha ar eolas nó doiléir toisc go bhfuil sé deacair comhpháirteanna den sórt sin nó na teaglamaí is fearr is féidir a bhaint.

translation.en: Currently, due to the lack of effective and specific therapy for covid-19, tcm has become one of the major alternative treatments for patients with light to moderate symptoms or for those who have recovered from severe stages.
translation.ga: Faoi láthair, mar gheall ar an easpa teiripe éifeachtach agus sonrach do covid-19, tá tcm anois ar cheann de na príomhchóireálacha malartacha d ’ othair a bhfuil comharthaí measartha go éadrom orthu nó dóibh siúd a tháinig slán ó chéimeanna troma.

translation.en: For example, shu feng jie du capsules and lian hua qing wen capsules were found to be effective for covid-19 treatment.
translation.ga: Mar shampla, fuarthas go raibh capsúil shu feng jie du agus capsúil lian hua qing wen éifeachtach le haghaidh cóireála covid-19.

translation.en: Top cure rates in the treatment of covid-19 patients were observed in several provinces in china that used tcm in 87% of their patients, including gansu (63.7%), ningxia (50%), and hunan (50%), whereas hubei province, which used tcm in only approximately 30% of its covid-19 patients, had the lowest cure rate (13%).
translation.ga: Breathnaíodh na rátaí leigheas is fearr i gcóireáil othair covid-19 i roinnt cúigí sa tsín a d ’ úsáid tcm in 87% dá n-othar, lena n-áirítear gansu (63.7%), ningxia (50%), agus hunan (50%), ach bhí ag hubei an ráta leigheas is ísle (13%) de réir cúige, a d ’ úsáid tcm i thart ar 30% dá othair covid-19 amháin.

translation.en: However, this is quite a rough comparison as many other impact factors such as the number and severity of the patients should be included in the evaluation.
translation.ga: Is comparáid gharbh é seo, áfach, mar ba cheart go leor fachtóirí tionchair eile amhail líon agus déine na n-othar a áireamh sa mheastóireacht.

translation.en: On february 18, 2020, boli zhang and coworkers published a study to compare western medicine (wm) treatment alone with combined treatment of wm and tcm.
translation.ga: Ar 18 feabhra, 2020, d ’ fhoilsigh boli zhang agus coworkers staidéar chun cóireáil leigheas an iarthair (wm) a chur i gcomparáid le cóireáil chomhcheangailte ar wm agus tcm.

translation.en: They found that the times needed for body temperature recovery, symptom disappearance, and hospitalization were remarkably shorter in the wm + tcm group than in the wm only group.
translation.ga: Fuair ​ ​ siad amach go raibh na hamanna a theastaíonn le haghaidh aisghabháil teocht an choirp, imeacht na siomptóm, agus an t-ospidéal i bhfad níos giorra sa ghrúpa wm + tcm ná sa ghrúpa wm amháin.

translation.en: Most impressively, the rate for symptomatic worsening (from light to severe) was remarkably lower for the wm + tcm group than for the wm only group (7.4% versus 46.2%) and the mortality was lower in the wm + tcm group than wm only group (8.8% versus 39%).
translation.ga: Go suntasach, bhí an ráta meath siomptómach (ó éadrom go trom) i bhfad níos ísle don ghrúpa wm + tcm ná don ghrúpa wm amháin (7.4% vs. 46.2%) agus bhí an básmhaireacht níos ísle sa ghrúpa wm + tcm ná wm amháin. grúpa (8.8% vs. 39%).

translation.en: Nevertheless, the efficacy and safety of tcm still await more well-controlled trials at larger scales and in more centers.
translation.ga: Mar sin féin, tá éifeachtúlacht agus sábháilteacht tcm fós ag fanacht le níos mó trialacha rialaithe ar scálaí níos mó agus i níos mó ionad.

translation.en: It would also be intriguing to characterize the mechanism of actions and clarify the effective components of tcm treatments or their combinations if possible.
translation.ga: Bheadh ​ ​ sé suimiúil freisin meicníocht na ngníomhartha a thréithriú agus, más féidir, comhpháirteanna éifeachtacha na gcóireálacha tcm nó a gcuid teaglaim a shoiléiriú.

translation.en: Patients with suspected or confirmed covid-19 mostly experience great fear of the highly contagious and even fatal disease, and quarantined people also experience boredom, loneliness, and anger.
translation.ga: Tá eagla ar othair a bhfuil amhras nó deimhniú orthu go bhfuil covid-19 amhras orthu faoin ngalar an-tógálach agus fiú marfach, agus atá coraintínithe ag leadrán, uaigneas agus fearg.

translation.en: Furthermore, symptoms of the infection such as fever, hypoxia, and cough as well as adverse effects of the treatments such as insomnia caused by corticosteroids can lead to more anxiety and mental distress.
translation.ga: Ina theannta sin, d ’ fhéadfadh imní agus anacair mheabhrach a bheith mar thoradh ar airíonna an ionfhabhtaithe cosúil le fiabhras, hypoxia, agus casacht chomh maith le héifeachtaí díobhálacha cóireálacha mar insomnia de bharr corticosteroidí.

translation.en: In the early phase of the sars outbreak, a range of psychiatric morbidities including persistent depression, anxiety, panic attacks, psychomotor excitement, psychotic symptoms, delirium, and even suicidality were reported.
translation.ga: Go luath i ráig sars, tuairiscíodh raon tinnis síciatracha lena n-áirítear dúlagar leanúnach, imní, ionsaithe scaoill, sceitimíní síceamótair, comharthaí síocóideacha, deliriam, agus fiú féinmharú.

translation.en: Mandatory contact tracing and quarantine, as a part of the public health responses to the covid-19 outbreak, can make people more anxious and guilty about the effects of the contagion, quarantine, and stigma on their families and friends.
translation.ga: Féadann rianú teagmhála éigeantach agus coraintín, mar chuid de na freagraí sláinte poiblí ar an ráig covid-19, daoine a dhéanamh níos imníoch agus níos ciontach faoi éifeachtaí gabháltas, coraintín agus stiogma ar a dteaghlach agus a gcairde.

translation.en: Thus, mental health care should be provided to covid-19 patients, suspected individuals, and people in contact with them as well as the general public who are in need.
translation.ga: Dá bhrí sin, ba cheart cúram sláinte meabhrach a sholáthar d ’ othair covid-19, daoine aonair a bhfuil amhras fúthu, agus dóibh siúd atá i dteagmháil chomh maith leis an bpobal i ngátar i gcoitinne.

translation.en: The psychological support should include the establishment of multidisciplinary mental health teams, clear communications with regular and accurate updates about the sars-cov-2 outbreak and treatment plans and the use of professional electronic devices and applications to avoid close contact with each other.
translation.ga: Ba cheart go n-áireofaí le tacaíocht shíceolaíoch foirne ildisciplíneacha meabhairshláinte a bhunú, cumarsáid shoiléir le nuashonruithe rialta agus cruinne faoi ráig sars-cov-2 agus pleananna cóireála agus úsáid gléasanna agus feidhmchlár leictreonach gairmiúil chun dlúth-theagmháil a sheachaint.

translation.en: Effective vaccines are essential for interrupting the chain of transmission from animal reservoirs and infected humans to susceptible hosts and are often complementary to antiviral treatment in the control of epidemics caused by emerging viruses.
translation.ga: Tá vacsaíní éifeachtacha riachtanach chun cur isteach ar an slabhra tarchuir ó thaiscumair ainmhithe agus ó dhaoine ionfhabhtaithe go hóstach so-ghabhálach agus is minic a bhíonn siad comhlántach le cóireáil frithvíreasach chun eipidéimí víris atá ag teacht chun cinn a rialú.

translation.en: Efforts have been made to develop s protein-based vaccines to generate long-term and potent neutralizing antibodies and / or protective immunity against sars-cov.
translation.ga: Rinneadh iarrachtaí vacsaíní s atá bunaithe ar phróitéin a fhorbairt chun antasubstaintí neodraithe fadtéarmacha agus láidre agus / nó díolúine chosanta a ghiniúint i gcoinne sars-cov.

translation.en: Live-attenuated vaccines have been evaluated in animal models for sars.
translation.ga: Rinneadh vacsaíní beo-mhaolaithe a mheas i múnlaí ainmhithe do sars.

translation.en: However, the in vivo efficacy of these vaccine candidates in elderly individuals and lethal-challenge models and their protection against zoonotic virus infection have yet to be determined before a clinical study is initiated.
translation.ga: Mar sin féin, níor socraíodh fós éifeachtúlacht in vivo na n-iarrthóirí vacsaíne seo i múnlaí dúshlán aosta agus marfacha agus a gcosaint ar ionfhabhtú víreas zónóiseach sular cuireadh tús le staidéar cliniciúil.

translation.en: This is probably because sars died down 17 years ago and no new case has been reported since.
translation.ga: Is dócha go bhfuil sé seo toisc go bhfuair sars bás 17 mbliana ó shin agus nár tuairiscíodh aon chásanna nua ó shin.

translation.en: In contrast, sporadic cases and clusters of mers continue to occur in the middle east and spread to other regions owing to the persistence of zoonotic sources in endemic areas.
translation.ga: I gcodarsnacht leis sin, leanann cásanna sporadacha agus braislí mers de bheith ag tarlú sa mheánoirthear agus ag leathadh go réigiúin eile mar gheall ar mharthanacht foinsí zónóiseacha i gceantair endemic.

translation.en: Vaccination strategies have been developed for mers by using inactivated virus, dna plasmids, viral vectors, nanoparticles, virus-like particles and recombinant protein subunits and some have been evaluated in animal models.
translation.ga: Forbraíodh straitéisí vacsaínithe do mers ag baint úsáide as víreas neamhghníomhachtaithe, plasmaidí dna, veicteoirí víreasacha, nanacháithníní, cáithníní cosúil le víreas agus fo-aonaid próitéin athchuingreach agus rinneadh cuid acu a mheas i múnlaí ainmhithe.

translation.en: The development of a safe and effective vaccine against sars-cov-2 for non-immune individuals is an urgent and critical task for controlling the ongoing epidemic.
translation.ga: Is tasc práinneach criticiúil vacsaín sábháilte agus éifeachtach a fhorbairt i gcoinne sars-cov-2 do dhaoine aonair neamh-imdhíonachta chun an eipidéim leanúnach a rialú.

translation.en: However, it is challenging to overcome the difficulty because of the long period of time (averaged 18 months) needed for vaccine development and the dynamic variations of covs.
translation.ga: Is dúshlánach é an deacracht a shárú, áfach, mar gheall ar an tréimhse fhada (18 mí ar an meán) atá riachtanach chun vacsaíní a fhorbairt agus athruithe dinimiciúla ar covanna.

translation.en: As a novel disease, covid-19 has just started to manifest its full clinical course throughout thousands of patients.
translation.ga: Mar ghalar nua, tá covid-19 díreach tar éis a chúrsa cliniciúil iomlán a thaispeáint ar fud na mílte othar.

translation.en: In most cases, patients can recover gradually without sequelae.
translation.ga: I bhformhór na gcásanna, is féidir le hothair téarnamh de réir a chéile gan sequelae.

translation.en: However, similar to sars and mers, covid-19 is also associated with high morbidity and mortality in patients with severe cases.
translation.ga: Mar sin féin, cosúil le sars agus mers, tá baint ag covid-19 freisin le galracht agus básmhaireacht ard in othair a bhfuil cásanna tromchúiseacha acu.

translation.en: Therefore, building a prognosis model for the disease is essential for health-care agencies to prioritize their services, especially in resource-constrained areas.
translation.ga: Dá bhrí sin, tá sé riachtanach go dtugann gníomhaireachtaí cúram sláinte tosaíocht dá gcuid seirbhísí, go háirithe i réimsí atá srianta ó thaobh acmhainní, d ’ fhonn samhail prognóis a thógáil don ghalar.

translation.en: Based on clinical studies reported thus far, the following factors may affect or be associated with the prognosis of covid-19 patients (table ​ (table33):
translation.ga: Bunaithe ar staidéir chliniciúla a tuairiscíodh go dtí seo, d ’ fhéadfadh tionchar a bheith ag na fachtóirí seo a leanas ar prognóis othair covid-19 nó baint a bheith acu leo ​ ​ (tábla (tábla33)):

translation.en: Age: Age was the most important factor for the prognosis of sars, which is also true for covid-19.
translation.ga: Aois: Ba í aois an fachtóir ba thábhachtaí le haghaidh prognóis sars, rud atá fíor freisin maidir le covid-19.

translation.en: Covid-19 mainly happened at the age of 30-65 with 47.7% of those patients being over 50 in a study of 8,866 cases as described above.
translation.ga: Tharla covid-19 den chuid is mó ag aois 30-65 agus 47.7% de na hothair sin os cionn 50 i staidéar ar 8,866 cás mar a thuairiscítear thuas.

translation.en: Patients who required intensive care were more likely to have underlying comorbidities and complications and were significantly older than those who did not (at the median age of 66 versus 51), suggesting age as a prognostic factor for the outcome of covid-19 patients.
translation.ga: Ba dhóichí go mbeadh comorbidities agus deacrachtaí bunúsacha ag othair a raibh dianchúram ag teastáil uathu agus bhí siad i bhfad níos sine ná iad siúd nach raibh (ag aois airmheánach 66 vs 51), rud a thugann le tuiscint go bhfuil aois ina fachtóir prognóiseach do thoradh othar covid-19.

translation.en: Sex: Sars-cov-2 has infected more men than women (0.31 / 100,000 versus 0.27 / 100,000), as described above.
translation.ga: Gnéas: Tá níos mó fear ná mná ionfhabhtaithe le sars-cov-2 (0.31 / 100,000 i gcoinne 0.27 / 100,000), mar a thuairiscítear thuas.

translation.en: Comorbidities and complications: Patients with covid-19 who require intensive care are more likely to suffer from acute cardiac injury and arrhythmia.
translation.ga: Seachghalair agus deacrachtaí: Is dóichí go mbeidh gortú géarmhíochaine cairdiach agus arrhythmia ag othair le covid-19 a dteastaíonn dianchúram uathu.

translation.en: Cardiac events were also the main reason for death in sars patients.
translation.ga: Ba iad imeachtaí cairdiacha príomhchúis an bháis in othair sars.

translation.en: It has been reported that sars-cov-2 can also bind to ace2-positive cholangiocytes, which might lead to liver dysfunctions in covid-19 patients.
translation.ga: Tuairiscíodh go gceanglaíonn sars-cov-2 le cholangiocytes ace2-dearfach, a bhféadfadh mífheidhmeanna ae a bheith mar thoradh orthu in othair covid-19.

translation.en: It is worth noting that age and underlying disease are strongly correlated and might interfere with each other.
translation.ga: Ní féidir a rá go bhfuil comhghaol láidir idir aois agus galar bunúsach agus gur féidir leo cur isteach ar a chéile.

translation.en: Abnormal laboratory findings: The c-reactive protein (crp) level in blood reflects the severity of inflammation or tissue injury and has been proposed to be a potential prognostic factor for disease, response to therapy, and ultimate recovery.
translation.ga: Torthaí neamhghnácha saotharlainne: Léiríonn leibhéal na próitéine c-imoibríoch (crp) san fhuil déine athlasadh nó díobhála fíocháin agus moladh go bhféadfadh sé a bheith ina fhachtóir prognóiseach féideartha le haghaidh galair, freagairt ar theiripe, agus téarnamh sa deireadh.

translation.en: The correlation of crp level to the severity and prognosis of covid-19 has also been proposed.
translation.ga: Moladh comhghaolú leibhéal crp le déine agus prognóis covid-19 freisin.

translation.en: In addition, elevated lactate dehydrogenase (ldh), aspartate aminotransferase (ast), alanine aminotransferase (alt), and creatine kinase (ck) may also help predict the outcome.
translation.ga: Ina theannta sin, d ’ fhéadfadh dehydrogenase lachtaithe ardaithe (ldh), aspartate aminotransferase (ast), alanine aminotransferase (alt), agus creatine kinase (ck) cuidiú leis an toradh a thuar.

translation.en: These enzymes are expressed extensively in multiple organs, especially in the heart and liver, and are released during tissue damage.
translation.ga: Cuirtear na heinsímí seo in iúl go forleathan i go leor orgán, go háirithe sa chroí agus san ae, agus scaoiltear iad le linn damáiste fíocháin.

translation.en: Thus, they are traditional markers for heart or liver dysfunctions.
translation.ga: Dá bhrí sin, is marcóirí traidisiúnta iad le haghaidh mífheidhmeanna croí nó ae.

translation.en: Major clinical symptoms: Chest radiography and temporal progression of clinical symptoms should be considered together with the other issues for the prediction of outcomes and complications of covid-19.
translation.ga: Mór-airíonna cliniciúla: Ba cheart radagrafaíocht cófra agus dul chun cinn ama na n-airíonna cliniciúla a mheas in éineacht leis na saincheisteanna eile chun torthaí agus deacrachtaí covid-19 a thuar.

translation.en: Use of steroids: As described above, steroids are immunosuppressant commonly used as an adjunctive therapy for infectious diseases to reduce the severity of inflammatory damage.
translation.ga: Úsáid stéaróidigh: Mar a thuairiscítear thuas, úsáidtear stéaróidigh frith-imdhíonachta go coitianta mar theiripe aidiúvach do ghalair thógálacha chun déine an damáiste athlastach a laghdú.

translation.en: Since a high dosage of corticosteroids was widely used in severe sars patients, many survivors suffered from avascular osteonecrosis with life-long disability and poor life quality.
translation.ga: Ó úsáideadh dáileoga arda corticosteroidí go forleathan in othair throm sars, d ’ fhulaing go leor marthanóirí ó osteonecróis soithíoch le míchumas ar feadh an tsaoil agus droch-chaighdeán maireachtála.

translation.en: Thus, if needed, steroids should be used at low dosage and for a short time in covid-19 patients.
translation.ga: Dá bhrí sin, más gá, ba cheart stéaróidigh a úsáid ag dáileog íseal agus ar feadh tamaill ghearr in othair covid-19.

translation.en: Mental stress: As described above, during the covid-19 outbreak many patients have suffered from extraordinary stress as they often endured long periods of quarantine and extreme uncertainty and witnessed the death of close family members and fellow patients.
translation.ga: Strus meabhrach: Mar a thuairiscítear thuas, le linn na ráige covid-19 d ’ fhulaing go leor othar ó strus urghnách mar is minic a d ’ fhulaing siad tréimhsí coraintín fada agus neamhshlándáil mhór agus chonaic siad bás dlúthbhaill teaghlaigh agus comh-othair.

translation.en: It is imperative to provide psychological counseling and long-term support to help these patients recover from the stress and return to normal life.
translation.ga: Tá sé riachtanach comhairleoireacht agus tacaíocht shíceolaíoch fhadtéarmach a sholáthar chun cabhrú leis na hothair seo téarnamh ó strus agus filleadh ar an ngnáthshaol.

translation.en: According to demographic studies so far, covid-19 seems to have different epidemiological features from sars.
translation.ga: De réir staidéir dhéimeagrafacha go dtí seo, is cosúil go bhfuil gnéithe eipidéimeolaíocha difriúla ag covid-19 ó sars.

translation.en: In addition to replicating in the lower respiratory tract, sars-cov-2 can efficiently replicate in the upper respiratory tract and causes mild or no symptoms in the early phase of infection, similar to other covs that cause common colds.
translation.ga: Chomh maith le macasamhlú sa chonair riospráide íochtarach, is féidir le sars-cov-2 macasamhlú go héifeachtach sa chonair riospráide uachtarach agus comharthaí éadroma nó gan aon comharthaí a chur faoi deara i gcéim luath an ionfhabhtaithe, cosúil le covanna eile is cúis le slaghdáin choitianta.

translation.en: Therefore, infected patients at the early phase or incubation period can produce a large amount of virus during daily activities, causing great difficulty for the control of the epidemic.
translation.ga: Dá bhrí sin, is féidir le hothair ionfhabhtaithe ag an gcéim luath nó ag an tréimhse goir cuid mhór víris a tháirgeadh le linn gníomhaíochtaí laethúla, agus deacracht mhór acu an eipidéim a rialú.

translation.en: However, the transmission of sars-cov was considered to occur when the patients are severely ill, while most transmission did not happen at the early phase.
translation.ga: Mar sin féin, measadh go dtarlódh tarchur sars-cov nuair a bhíonn othair go dona tinn, cé nár tharla an chuid is mó den tarchur ag an gcéim luath.

translation.en: Thus, the current outbreak of covid-19 is much more severe and difficult to control than the outbreak of sars.
translation.ga: Dá bhrí sin, tá an ráig reatha de covid-19 i bhfad níos déine agus níos deacra a rialú ná an ráig sars.

translation.en: Great efforts are currently underway in china including the lockdown of wuhan and surrounding cities and continuous quarantine of almost the entire population in hopes of interrupting the transmission of sars-cov-2.
translation.ga: Tá iarrachtaí móra ar siúl sa tsín faoi láthair lena n-áirítear wuhan agus na cathracha máguaird a ghlasáil agus coraintín leanúnach beagnach an daonra iomláin le súil go gcuirfear isteach ar tharchur sars-cov-2.

translation.en: Although these actions have been dramatically damaging the economy and other sectors of the country, the number of new patients is declining, indicating the slowdown of the epidemic.
translation.ga: Cé go ndearna na gníomhartha seo dochar mór don gheilleagar agus d ’ earnálacha eile na tíre, tá líon na n-othar nua ag laghdú, rud a léiríonn moilliú an eipidéim.

translation.en: The most optimistic estimate is that the outbreak will end by march and the downswing phase will last for 3-4 months.
translation.ga: Is é an meastachán is dóchasach go dtiocfaidh deireadh leis an ráig faoi mhí an mhárta agus go mairfidh an chéim dheireanach 3-4 mhí.

translation.en: However, some other experts are not that optimistic.
translation.ga: Níl roinnt saineolaithe eile dóchasach, áfach.

translation.en: Paul hunter, et al., estimated that covid-19, which seems substantially more infectious than sars, will not end in 2020.
translation.ga: Mheas paul hunter, et al., nach dtiocfaidh deireadh le covid-19, ar cosúil go bhfuil sé i bhfad níos tógálaí ná sars, in 2020.

translation.en: Ira longini, et al., established a model to predict the outcome of the epidemic and suggested that sars-cov-2 could infect two-thirds of the global population.
translation.ga: Bhunaigh ira longini, et al., múnla chun toradh an eipidéim a thuar agus mhol sí go bhféadfadh sars-cov-2 dhá thrian den daonra domhanda a ionfhabhtú.

translation.en: A canadian group reported that sars-cov-2 was detected in both mid-turbinate and throat swabs of patients who recovered and left the hospital 2 weeks earlier, which indicates that the newly identified virus could become a cyclical episode similar to influenza.
translation.ga: Thuairiscigh grúpa i gceanada gur aimsíodh sars-cov-2 i swabs lár-tuirbín agus scornach na n-othar a bhí tar éis aisghabháil agus a d ’ fhág an t-ospidéal coicís roimhe sin, ag tabhairt le tuiscint go bhféadfadh an víreas nua-aitheanta a bheith in eipeasóid timthriallach cosúil le fliú.

translation.en: However, promising signs have occurred in china based on the declining number of new cases, indicating the current strategies might have been working.
translation.ga: Mar sin féin, tharla comharthaí gealladh fúthu sa tsín bunaithe ar an laghdú ar líon na gcásanna nua, rud a léiríonn go bhféadfadh na straitéisí reatha a bheith ag obair.

translation.en: Ebola was originally predicted to cause up to a million cases with half a million deaths.
translation.ga: Bhíothas ag tuar i dtosach go gcuirfeadh ebola suas le milliún cás le leath mhilliún bás.

translation.en: However, via strict quarantine and isolation, the disease has eventually been put under control.
translation.ga: Mar sin féin, trí choraintín agus aonrú docht, tugadh an galar faoi smacht sa deireadh.

translation.en: It is possible, similar to sars-cov, that sars-cov-2 might become weaker in infectivity and eventually die down or become a less pathogenic virus co-existent with humans.
translation.ga: Is féidir, cosúil le sars-cov, go bhféadfadh sars-cov-2 éirí níos laige san ionfhabhtú agus go bhfaighidh sé bás sa deireadh nó go mbeidh sé ina víreas nach bhfuil chomh pataigineach i ndaoine.

translation.en: A comparison of the epidemic of covid-19 with that of sars and mers is provided below (fig. ​ (fig.55).
translation.ga: Tugtar comparáid thíos idir eipidéim covid-19 agus eipidéim sars agus mers (fíor 55).

translation.en: Sars-cov-2 is highly transmittable through coughing or sneezing, and possibly also through direct contact with materials contaminated by the virus.
translation.ga: Tá sars-cov-2 in-tarchurtha go mór trí chasacht nó sraothartach, agus b ’ fhéidir freisin trí theagmháil dhíreach le hábhair atá éillithe le víreas.

translation.en: The virus was also found in feces, which raises a new possibility of feces-to-mouth transmission.
translation.ga: Fuarthas an víreas i bhfeces freisin, ag ardú féidearthachta nua maidir le tarchur feces-to-mouth.

translation.en: A recent study on 138 cases reported that 41% of the cases were possibly caused by nosocomial infections, including 17 patients with other prior diseases and 40 health-care providers.
translation.ga: Thuairiscigh staidéar le déanaí ar 138 cás gur 41% de na cásanna ba chúis le hionfhabhtuithe nosocomial, lena n-áirítear 17 n-othar le galair roimhe seo agus 40 soláthróir cúram sláinte.

translation.en: Thus, great precaution should be used to protect humans, especially health-care providers, social workers, family members, colleagues, and even bystanders in contact with patients or infected people.
translation.ga: Dá bhrí sin, ba cheart réamhchúram mór a úsáid chun daoine a chosaint, go háirithe soláthraithe cúraim sláinte, oibrithe sóisialta, baill teaghlaigh, comhghleacaithe, agus fiú abhcóidí atá i dteagmháil le hothair nó daoine atá ionfhabhtaithe.

translation.en: The first line of defense that could be used to lower the risk of infection is through wearing face masks; both the use of surgical masks and n95 respirator masks (series # 1860s) helps control the spread of viruses.
translation.ga: Is é an chéad líne chosanta a d ’ fhéadfaí a úsáid chun an riosca ionfhabhtaithe a laghdú ná trí mhaisc aghaidhe a chaitheamh; cuidíonn úsáid maisc máinliachta n95 agus maisc riospráide (sraith # 1860í) le scaipeadh víris a rialú.

translation.en: Surgical face masks prevent liquid droplets from a potentially infected individual from traveling through the air or sticking onto surfaces of materials, where they could be passed on to others.
translation.ga: Cuireann maisc aghaidhe máinliachta cosc ​ ​ ar bhraoiníní leachtacha ó dhuine a d ’ fhéadfadh a bheith ionfhabhtaithe taisteal tríd an aer nó cloí le dromchlaí ábhar, áit a bhféadfaí iad a chur ar aghaidh chuig daoine eile.

translation.en: However, only n95 (series # 1860s) masks can protect against the inhalation of virions as small as 10 to 80 nm, with only 5% of the virions being able to penetrate completely; sars-cov-2 is similar to sars-cov in size and both are approximately 85 nm.
translation.ga: Mar sin féin, ní féidir ach maisc de n95 (sraith # 1860í) cosaint a dhéanamh ar ionanálú virions chomh beag le 10 go 80 nm, agus ní féidir ach 5% de na virions dul isteach go hiomlán; tá sars-cov-2 cosúil le méid le sars-cov agus tá an dá rud thart ar 85 nm.

translation.en: Since particles can penetrate even five surgical masks stacked together, health-care providers in direct contact with patients must wear n95 (series # 1860s) masks but not surgical masks.
translation.ga: Toisc gur féidir le cáithníní dul isteach fiú cúig masc máinliachta atá cruachta le chéile, caithfidh soláthraithe cúram sláinte atá i dteagmháil dhíreach le hothair maisc n95 (sraith # 1860í) a chaitheamh ach ní maisc máinliachta iad.

translation.en: In addition to masks, health-care providers should wear fitted isolation gowns in order to further reduce contact with viruses.
translation.ga: Chomh maith le maisc, ba chóir do sholáthraithe cúram sláinte fallaingeacha aonrúcháin feistithe a chaitheamh d ’ fhonn an teagmháil le víris a laghdú tuilleadh.

translation.en: Viruses can also infect an individual through the eyes.
translation.ga: Is féidir le víris duine a ionfhabhtú trí na súile freisin.

translation.en: On january 22, 2020, a doctor was infected with sars-cov-2 although he wore an n95 mask; the virus might have entered his body through his inflammatory eyes.
translation.ga: Ar 22 eanáir, 2020, bhí dochtúir ionfhabhtaithe le sars-cov-2 agus é ag caitheamh masc n95; b ’ fhéidir go ndeachaigh an víreas isteach ina chorp trína shúile athlastacha.

translation.en: Thus, health-care providers should also wear transparent face shields or goggles while working with patients.
translation.ga: Dá bhrí sin, ba cheart do sholáthraithe cúram sláinte sciath aghaidh trédhearcach nó gloiní cosanta a chaitheamh agus iad ag obair le hothair.

translation.en: For the general public in affected or potentially affected areas, it is highly suggested that everybody wash their hands with disinfectant soaps more often than usual, try to stay indoors for self-quarantine and limit contact with potentially infected individuals.
translation.ga: Maidir leis an bpobal i gcoitinne i gceantair atá buailte nó a bhféadfadh tionchar a bheith orthu, moltar go láidir do gach duine a lámha a ní le gallúnacha díghalraithe níos minice ná mar is gnách, iarracht a dhéanamh fanacht istigh le haghaidh féin-choraintín agus teagmhála. daoine a d ’ fhéadfadh a bheith ionfhabhtaithe a theorannú.

translation.en: Three feet is considered an appropriate distance for people to stay away from a patient.
translation.ga: Meastar go bhfuil trí chos mar achar oiriúnach do dhaoine fanacht amach ó othair.

translation.en: These actions are effective methods to lower the risk of infection as well as prevent the spread of the virus.
translation.ga: Is modhanna éifeachtacha iad na gníomhartha seo chun an riosca ionfhabhtaithe a laghdú chomh maith le scaipeadh an víris a chosc.

translation.en: Although sars-cov-2 came as a new virus to the human world, its high homology to sars-cov as reported on 7 january 2020 should have caused high alert to china based on her deep memory of the sars outbreak in 2003.
translation.ga: Cé gur tháinig sars-cov-2 chun cinn mar víreas nua do shaol an duine, ba cheart go mbeadh a ard-homalógacht do sars-cov mar a tuairiscíodh an 7 eanáir 2020 ina chúis le foláireamh ard don tsín bunaithe ar a cuimhne dhomhain ar ráig sars. i 2003.

translation.en: However, not until 19 january 2020 did the director of the center of disease control of wuhan comfort the citizens by saying that the novel virus has low contagiousness and limited reproductivity from human to human and that it is not a problem to prevent and contain the disease.
translation.ga: Mar sin féin, ní raibh sé go dtí an 19 eanáir 2020 gur thug stiúrthóir an lárionaid um rialú galar i wuhan suaimhneas do shaoránaigh trína rá go bhfuil an víreas núíosach íseal tógálach agus go bhfuil atáirgeadh teoranta idir an duine agus an duine agus nach fadhb é a chosc agus a choinneáil ann.

translation.en: This message remarkably relaxed the alarm of the public, especially when the entire country was preparing for the spring festival, and the critical time was missed to contain the disease at its minimal scale in wuhan.
translation.ga: Rinne an teachtaireacht seo maolú mór ar an aláram poiblí, go háirithe toisc go raibh an tír ar fad ag ullmhú d ’ fhéile an earraigh, agus cailleadh an t-am criticiúil chun an galar a choinneáil chomh híseal agus is féidir i wuhan.

translation.en: The disease control agencies in china may take this hard lesson and make critical improvements in the future.
translation.ga: Is féidir le gníomhaireachtaí rialaithe galar sa tsín an ceacht crua seo a ghlacadh agus feabhsuithe criticiúla a dhéanamh amach anseo.

translation.en: For example, these agencies should be (1) more careful when making public announcements as every word counts to citizens and can change their attitude and decisions; (2) more sensitive and reactive to unusual information from clinics rather than waiting for formal reports from doctors or officials; (3) more restrictive to contain a potential epidemic at its early stage rather than attempting to comfort the public; and (4) more often to issue targeted and effective drills to increase the public's awareness about epidemic diseases and to test and improve the response system of the society periodically.
translation.ga: Mar shampla, ba cheart do na gníomhaireachtaí seo (1) a bheith níos cúramach agus fógraí poiblí á ndéanamh acu mar chomhaireamh síos do shaoránaigh agus is féidir leo a ndearcaí agus a gcinntí a athrú; (2) faisnéis níos íogaire agus níos frithghníomhaí ó chlinicí seachas fanacht le tuarascálacha foirmiúla ó dhochtúirí nó oifigigh; (3) eipidéim ionchasach níos sriantaí go luath seachas iarracht a chur ar a suaimhneas don phobal; agus (4) druileanna spriocdhírithe agus éifeachtacha a eisiúint níos minice chun feasacht an phobail ar ghalair eipidéime a mhéadú agus chun córas freagartha an chomhlachais a thástáil agus a fheabhsú go tréimhsiúil.

translation.en: The outbreak of covid-19 caused by the novel virus sars-cov-2 started in the end of december 2019.
translation.ga: Thosaigh an ráig de covid-19 ba chúis leis an víreas úrscéal sars-cov-2 ag deireadh mhí na nollag 2019.

translation.en: In less than two months, it has spread all over china and near 50 other countries globally at the time of this writing.
translation.ga: I níos lú ná dhá mhí, scaipeadh é ar fud na síne agus gar do 50 tír eile ar domhan tráth na scríbhneoireachta seo.

translation.en: Since the virus is very similar to sars-cov and the symptoms are also similar between covid-19 and sars, the outbreak of covid-19 has created a sense of sars recurring.
translation.ga: Ó tharla go bhfuil an víreas an-chosúil le sars-cov agus go bhfuil na hairíonna cosúil idir covid-19 agus sars, chruthaigh ráig de covid-19 mothú athfhillteach sars.

translation.en: However, there are some remarkable differences between covid-19 and sars, which are essential for containing the epidemic and treating the patients.
translation.ga: Mar sin féin, tá roinnt difríochtaí suntasacha idir covid-19 agus sars, atá riachtanach chun an eipidéim a choinneáil ar bhá agus chun cóir leighis a chur ar na hothair.

translation.en: Covid-19 affects more elderly individuals than youth and more men than women, and the severity and death rate are also higher in elderly individual than in youth.
translation.ga: Bíonn tionchar ag covid-19 ar níos mó daoine scothaosta ná an óige agus níos mó fear ná mná, agus tá an ráta déine agus básmhaireachta níos airde i measc daoine aosta ná san óige.

translation.en: Sars has higher mortality than covid-19 (10.91% versus 1.44%).
translation.ga: Tá básmhaireacht níos airde ag sars ná covid-19 (10.91% vs. 1.44%).

translation.en: Covid-19 patients transmit the virus even when they are symptomless whereas sars patients do so usually when they are severely ill, which causes much greater difficulty to contain the spread of covid-19 than sars.
translation.ga: Tarchuireann othair covid-19 an víreas fiú nuair a bhíonn siad neamhshiomptómach ach is gnách go ndéanann othair sars amhlaidh nuair a bhíonn siad go dona tinn, rud a fhágann go bhfuil sé i bhfad níos deacra tarchur covid-19 a choinneáil ná sars.

translation.en: This partially explains why sars-cov-2 spread much faster and broader than sars-cov.
translation.ga: Míníonn sé seo go páirteach an fáth go scaipeann sars-cov-2 i bhfad níos gasta agus níos leithne ná sars-cov.

translation.en: The regular rna assay for sars-cov-2 can be negative in some covid-19 patients.
translation.ga: Is féidir le measúnacht rna rialta do sars-cov-2 a bheith diúltach i roinnt othar covid-19.

translation.en: On the other hand, cured patients can be positive for the virus again.
translation.ga: Ar an láimh eile, is féidir le hothair leigheasta a bheith dearfach don víreas arís.

translation.en: These findings dramatically increase the risk of virus spreading.
translation.ga: Méadaíonn na torthaí seo go mór an baol go scaipfidh an víreas.

translation.en: Given such rapid progress in research on covid-19, several critical issues remain to be solved, as follows:
translation.ga: I bhfianaise an dul chun cinn gasta seo i dtaighde ar covid-19, tá roinnt saincheisteanna criticiúla fós le réiteach, mar a leanas:

translation.en: Where did sars-cov-2 come from?
translation.ga: Cad as ar tháinig sars-cov-2?

translation.en: Although 96% genetic homolog was found between sars-cov-2 and two bat sars-like covs, we still cannot conclude that sars-cov-2 is from bats.
translation.ga: Cé go bhfuarthas homalóg ghéiniteach 96% idir sars-cov-2 agus dhá cov cosúil le sars, ní féidir linn a thabhairt i gcrích fós gur as sars-cov-2 iad ialtóga.

translation.en: What animal was the intermediate species to transmit the virus from the original host, say bats, to humans?
translation.ga: Cén t-ainmhí a bhí sa speiceas idirmheánach chun an víreas a tharchur ón óstach bunaidh, abair ialtóga, chuig daoine?

translation.en: Without knowing answers to # 1 and 2, we cannot efficiently cut the transmission, and the outbreak can relapse at any time.
translation.ga: Gan freagraí ar # 1 agus 2 a bheith ar eolas againn, ní féidir linn tarchur a ghearradh amach go héifeachtach, agus is féidir leis an ráig athiompú ag am ar bith.

translation.en: Although molecular modeling and biochemical assays have demonstrated that sars-cov-2 binds to ace2, how exactly does the virus enter the airway cells and cause subsequent pathological changes?
translation.ga: Cé gur léirigh samhaltú móilíneach agus measúnuithe bithcheimiceacha go gceanglaíonn sars-cov-2 le ace2, cé chomh díreach agus a théann an víreas isteach i gcealla aerbhealaigh agus ina chúis le hathruithe paiteolaíocha ina dhiaidh sin?

translation.en: Does the virus also bind ace2-expressing cells in other organs?
translation.ga: An gceanglaíonn an víreas cealla a chuireann ace2 in orgáin eile in iúl?

translation.en: Without clear answers to these questions, we cannot achieve fast and accurate diagnosis and effective treatment.
translation.ga: Gan freagraí soiléire ar na ceisteanna seo, ní féidir linn diagnóis thapa agus cheart agus cóireáil éifeachtach a bhaint amach.

translation.en: How long will the epidemic last?
translation.ga: Cá fhad a mhairfidh an eipidéim?

translation.en: How is the virus genetically evolving during transmission among humans?
translation.ga: Conas a fhorbraíonn an víreas go géiniteach le linn tarchuir i ndaoine?

translation.en: Will it become a pandemic worldwide, die down like sars or relapse periodically like the flu?
translation.ga: An paindéim dhomhanda a bheidh ann, an bhfaighidh sé bás mar sars nó an dtarlóidh sé arís agus arís eile cosúil leis an bhfliú?

translation.en: It is essential but may take some time to search for answers to the above and many other questions.
translation.ga: Tá sé riachtanach ach b ’ fhéidir go dtógfaidh sé tamall ort freagraí a fháil ar na ceisteanna thuas agus go leor eile.

translation.en: However, with whatever expense it may demand, we have no other choice but to stop the epidemic as soon as possible and bring our life back to normal.
translation.ga: Mar sin féin, cibé costas a theastóidh uaidh, níl aon rogha againn ach an eipidéim a stopadh a luaithe is féidir agus ár saol a thabhairt ar ais go gnáth.

translation.en: Zoonotic origins of human coronaviruses
translation.ga: Bunús zónóiseach coronaviruses daonna

translation.en: Mutation and adaptation have driven the co-evolution of coronaviruses (covs) and their hosts, including human beings, for thousands of years.
translation.ga: Tá sóchán agus oiriúnú tar éis comh-éabhlóid na coronaviruses (covanna) agus a n-óstach, lena n-áirítear daoine, a thiomáint ar feadh na mílte bliain.

translation.en: Before 2003, two human covs (hcovs) were known to cause mild illness, such as common cold.
translation.ga: Roimh 2003, bhí a fhios go raibh dhá cov daonna (hcovanna) ina gcúis le breoiteacht éadrom, mar fhuacht coitianta.

translation.en: The outbreaks of severe acute respiratory syndrome (sars) and the middle east respiratory syndrome (mers) have flipped the coin to reveal how devastating and life-threatening an hcov infection could be.
translation.ga: Tá ráigeanna de shiondróm riospráide géarmhíochaine (sars) agus siondróm riospráide an mheánoirthir (mers) tar éis an bonn a shleamhnú chun a thaispeáint cé chomh tubaisteach agus a d ’ fhéadfadh a bheith ag bagairt ar ionfhabhtú hcov.

translation.en: The emergence of sars-cov-2 in central china at the end of 2019 has thrusted covs into the spotlight again and surprised us with its high transmissibility but reduced pathogenicity compared to its sister sars-cov.
translation.ga: Tá an teacht chun cinn sars-cov-2 sa tsín lárnach ag deireadh 2019 covs isteach an aire thrusted arís agus iontas orainn lena aistriú sin ard ach pataigineacht laghdaithe i gcomparáid lena dheirfiúr sars-cov.

translation.en: Wuhan
translation.ga: Wuhan

translation.en: Hcov infection is a zoonosis and understanding the zoonotic origins of hcovs would serve us well.
translation.ga: Is zónóis é ionfhabhtú hcov agus is maith a dhéanfadh tuiscint dúinn ar bhunús zónóiseach hcovanna.

translation.en: Most hcovs originated from bats where they are non-pathogenic.
translation.ga: Tháinig an chuid is mó de hcovanna ó ialtóga ina bhfuil siad neamh-phataigineach.

translation.en: The intermediate reservoir hosts of some hcovs are also known.
translation.ga: Is eol freisin óstálaithe taiscumar idirmheánacha roinnt hcovanna.

translation.en: Identifying the animal hosts has direct implications in the prevention of human diseases.
translation.ga: Tá impleachtaí díreacha ag aithint na n-óstach ainmhithe maidir le galair an duine a chosc.

translation.en: Investigating cov-host interactions in animals might also derive important insight on cov pathogenesis in humans.
translation.ga: D ’ fhéadfadh sé go bhfaigheadh ​ ​ imscrúdú ar idirghníomhaíochtaí óstach cov in ainmhithe léargas tábhachtach freisin ar phataiginéime cov i ndaoine.

translation.en: In this review, we present an overview of the existing knowledge about the seven hcovs, with a focus on the history of their discovery as well as their zoonotic origins and interspecies transmission.
translation.ga: San athbhreithniú seo, cuirimid forbhreathnú i láthair ar an eolas atá ann faoi na seacht hcov, le fócas ar stair a bhfionnachtana chomh maith lena mbunús zónóiseach agus a dtarchur idir-speicis.

translation.en: Importantly, we compare and contrast the different hcovs from a perspective of virus evolution and genome recombination.
translation.ga: Rud atá tábhachtach, déanaimid comparáid agus codarsnacht idir na hcovanna éagsúla ó thaobh éabhlóid víris agus athmholadh géanóm.

translation.en: The current cov disease 2019 (covid-19) epidemic is discussed in this context.
translation.ga: Pléitear eipidéim reatha an ghalair cov 2019 (covid-19) sa chomhthéacs seo.

translation.en: In addition, the requirements for successful host switches and the implications of virus evolution on disease severity are also highlighted.
translation.ga: Ina theannta sin, leagtar béim freisin ar na riachtanais maidir le lasca óstacha rathúla agus impleachtaí éabhlóid víris ar dhéine galair.

translation.en: Coronaviruses (covs) belong to the family coronaviridae, which comprises a group of enveloped, positive-sensed, single-stranded rna viruses.
translation.ga: Baineann coronaviruses (covanna) leis an teaghlach coronaviridae, atá comhdhéanta de ghrúpa víris rna aonchiseal cumhdaithe, braite-dearfach, aon-shnáithe.

translation.en: These viruses harbouring the largest genome of 26 to 32 kilobases amongst rna viruses were termed “covs ” because of their crown-like morphology under electron microscope.
translation.ga: Tugadh “covanna ” ar na víris seo a choinníonn an géanóm is mó de 26 go 32 cileaváis i measc víris rna mar gheall ar a moirfeolaíocht cosúil le coróin faoi mhicreascóp leictreon.

translation.en: Structurally, covs have non-segmented genomes that share a similar organization.
translation.ga: Ó thaobh struchtúir de, tá géanóm neamh-deighilte ag covanna a roinneann eagraíocht den chineál céanna.

translation.en: Approximately two thirds of the genome contain two large overlapping open reading frames (orf1a and orf1b), which are translated into the pp1a and pp1ab replicase polyproteins.
translation.ga: Tá thart ar dhá thrian den ghéanóma ina bhfuil dhá fhráma léitheoireachta oscailte mór forluí (orf1a agus orf1b), a aistrítear go polapróitéiní macasamhla pp1a agus pp1ab.

translation.en: The polyproteins are further processed to generate 16 non-structural proteins, designated nsp1 ~ 16.
translation.ga: Déantar na polapróitéiní a phróiseáil tuilleadh chun 16 próitéin neamhstruchtúrtha a ghiniúint, ainmnithe nsp1 ~ 16.

translation.en: The remaining portion of the genome contains orfs for the structural proteins, including spike (s), envelope (e), membrane (m) and nucleoprotein (n).
translation.ga: Sa chuid eile den ghéanóma tá orfanna do na próitéiní struchtúracha, lena n-áirítear spíce (s), clúdach (e), membrane (m) agus núicloprotein (n).

translation.en: A number of lineage-specific accessory proteins are also encoded by different lineages of covs.
translation.ga: Tá roinnt próitéiní cúlpháirtí a bhaineann go sonrach le líneáil ionchódaithe ag líneálacha éagsúla covanna.

translation.en: Based on the difference in protein sequences, covs are classified into four genera (alpha-cov, beta-cov, gamma-cov and delta-cov), among which the beta-cov genera contains most hcovs and is subdivided into four lineages (a, b, c and d).
translation.ga: Bunaithe ar an difríocht i seichimh próitéine, déantar covanna a aicmiú i gceithre ghéine (alfa-cov, béite-cov, gáma-cov agus delta-cov), ina bhfuil an chuid is mó de hcovanna sna géinte béite-cov agus tá siad foroinnte ina gceithre líne (a), b, c agus d).

translation.en: Phylogenetic evidence has shown that bats and rodents serve as the gene source of most alpha-covs and beta-covs, while birds are the main reservoir of gamma-covs and delta-covs.
translation.ga: Taispeánann fianaise phylogenetic go bhfreastalaíonn ialtóga agus creimirí mar fhoinse géine an chuid is mó de alfa-covanna agus béite-covanna, agus gurb iad éin príomh-thaiscumar gáma-covanna agus delta-covanna.

translation.en: For thousands of years, covs have constantly crossed species barriers and some have emerged as important human pathogens.
translation.ga: Ar feadh na mílte bliain, tá covanna tar éis bacainní speiceas a thrasnú i gcónaí agus tá cuid acu tagtha chun cinn mar phaitiginí tábhachtacha daonna.

translation.en: To date, seven human covs (hcovs) are known.
translation.ga: Go dtí seo, is eol seacht cov daonna (hcovanna).

translation.en: Among them hcov-229e and hcov-nl63 are alpha-covs.
translation.ga: Ina measc tá hcov-229e agus hcov-nl63 alfa-covanna.

translation.en: The other five beta-covs include hcov-oc43, hcov-hku1, severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus (sars-cov), middle east respiratory syndrome coronavirus (mers-cov) and sars-cov-2.
translation.ga: I measc na gcúig béite-cov eile tá hcov-oc43, hcov-hku1, coronavirus géarmhíochaine siondróm riospráide géarmhíochaine (sars-cov), coronavirus siondróm riospráide riospráide an mheánoirthir (mers-cov) agus sars-cov-2.

translation.en: Hcov-229e, hcov-oc43, hcov-hku1 and hcov-nl63 usually cause mild symptoms, like common cold and / or diarrhea.
translation.ga: Is gnách go mbíonn comharthaí éadroma mar hcov-229e, hcov-oc43, hcov-hku1 agus hcov-nl63, cosúil le fuar coitianta agus / nó buinneach.

translation.en: In contrast, sars-cov, mers-cov and the newly-identified sars-cov-2 are highly pathogenic, causing severe lower respiratory tract infection in relatively more patients with a higher chance to develop acute respiratory distress syndrome (ards) and extrapulmonary manifestations.
translation.ga: I gcodarsnacht leis sin, tá sars-cov, mers-cov agus an sars-cov-2 nua-aitheanta an-phataigineach, rud a fhágann go bhfuil ionfhabhtú conaire riospráide níos ísle i bhfad níos mó othar a bhfuil seans níos airde acu siondróm anacair riospráide géarmhíochaine (ards) agus léirithe eachtarshuí..

translation.en: The first hcov-229e strain, b814, was isolated from the nasal discharge of patients with common cold in mid-1960s.
translation.ga: Bhí an chéad strain hcov-229e, b814, scoite amach ó urscaoileadh nasal othar a raibh fuar coitianta orthu i lár na 1960idí.

translation.en: Since then, more knowledge was accumulated through extensive studies on hcov-229e and hcov-oc43, both of which cause self-limiting symptoms.
translation.ga: Ó shin i leith, bailíodh níos mó eolais trí staidéir fhairsinge ar hcov-229e agus hcov-oc43, a bhfuil comharthaí féin-theorannaithe ina gcúis leo araon.

translation.en: Indeed, the concept had been widely accepted that infection with hcovs is generally harmless until the outbreak of sars.
translation.ga: Go deimhin, glacadh leis an gcoincheap go forleathan go mbíonn ionfhabhtú le hcovanna neamhdhíobhálach go ginearálta go dtí go dtosaíonn sars.

translation.en: The sars outbreak occurred in 2003 is one of the most devastating in current history, infecting over 8,000 people with a crude case fatality of approximately 10%.
translation.ga: Tá an ráig sars a tharla i 2003 ar cheann de na cinn is tubaisteach sa stair reatha, ag ionfhabhtú os cionn 8,000 duine le básmhaireacht cás amh de thart ar 10%.

translation.en: Ten years later, the middle east respiratory syndrome (mers) outbreak resulted in a persistent epidemic in the arabian peninsula with sporadic spreading to the rest of the world.
translation.ga: Deich mbliana ina dhiaidh sin, mar thoradh ar ráig siondróm riospráide an mheánoirthir (mers) bhí eipidéim leanúnach i leithinis na haraibe agus scaipeadh go sporadic go dtí an chuid eile den domhan.

translation.en: The 2019 novel hcov (2019-ncov), which has subsequently been renamed sars-cov-2, is the causative agent of the ongoing epidemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (covid-19), which has claimed more than 3,120 lives and infected more than 91,000 people as of march 3, 2020.
translation.ga: Is é úrscéal 2019 hcov (2019-ncov), a athainmníodh ina dhiaidh sin sars-cov-2, gníomhaire cúiseach eipidéim leanúnach an ghalair coronavirus 2019 (covid-19), a d ’ éiligh níos mó ná 3,120 beatha agus ionfhabhtaithe níos mó ná 91,000 duine amhail an 3 márta, 2020.

translation.en: The alarm has been ringing and the world has to prepare for the coming pandemic of sars-cov-2.
translation.ga: Tá an t-aláram ag bualadh agus caithfidh an domhan ullmhú don phaindéim atá le teacht de sars-cov-2.

translation.en: All seven hcovs have a zoonotic origin from bats, mice or domestic animals.
translation.ga: Tá bunús zónóiseach ag gach ceann de na seacht hcov ó ialtóga, lucha nó ainmhithe clóis.

translation.en: Multiple lines of evidence support an evolutionary origin of all hcovs from bats, where viruses are well adapted and non-pathogenic but show great genetic diversity.
translation.ga: Tacaíonn iliomad línte fianaise le bunús éabhlóideach de gach hcov ó ialtóga, áit a bhfuil víris oiriúnaithe go maith agus neamh-phataigineach ach a léiríonn éagsúlacht mhór ghéiniteach.

translation.en: The covid-19 epidemic has presented enormous medical, scientific, social and moral challenges to china and the world.
translation.ga: Chuir eipidéim covid-19 dúshláin ollmhóra leighis, eolaíochta, sóisialta agus morálta os comhair na síne agus an domhain.

translation.en: Tracing the zoonotic origins of hcovs provides a framework to understand the natural history, driving force and restriction factors of species jumping.
translation.ga: Soláthraíonn bunús zónóiseach hcovanna creat chun tuiscint a fháil ar stair an dúlra, ar fhórsa tiomána agus ar fhachtóirí srianta léim speiceas.

translation.en: This might also guide or facilitate the search for the reservoir, intermediate and amplifying animal host (s) of sars-cov-2, with important implications in the prevention of future spillovers.
translation.ga: D ’ fhéadfadh sé seo treoir a thabhairt freisin nó cuardach a dhéanamh ar chuardach taiscumar, óstach (í) ainmhithe idirmheánach agus aimplithe sars-cov-2, le himpleachtaí tábhachtacha maidir le doirteadh amach anseo a chosc.

translation.en: In this review we present an overview of the zoonotic origins, interspecies transmission and pathogenesis of hcovs.
translation.ga: San athbhreithniú seo cuirimid forbhreathnú i láthair ar bhunús zónóiseach, tarchur idir-speicis agus pataigineacht hcovanna.

translation.en: Particularly, we highlight and discuss the common theme that parental viruses of hcovs are typically non-pathogenic in their natural reservoir hosts but become pathogenic after interspecies transmission to a new host.
translation.ga: Go háirithe, tarraingímid aird agus plé ar an téama comónta go mbíonn víris tuismitheoirí hcovanna neamh-phataigineach de ghnáth ina n-óstach taiscumar nádúrtha ach go mbíonn siad pataigineach tar éis tarchur idir-speicis chuig óstach nua.

translation.en: We also review the trend of hcov evolution in which the increase in transmissibility often comes with the decrease in pathogenicity.
translation.ga: Déanaimid athbhreithniú freisin ar threocht éabhlóid hcov ina dtagann an méadú ar in-tarchurtha go minic leis an laghdú ar phataigineacht.

translation.en: The outcome of the ongoing sars-cov-2 outbreak is also discussed in this context.
translation.ga: Pléitear toradh na ráige leanúnaí sars-cov-2 sa chomhthéacs seo.

translation.en: Animal covs have been known since late 1930s.
translation.ga: Tá covanna ainmhithe ar eolas ó dheireadh na 1930idí.

translation.en: Before the first isolation of hcov-229e strain b814 from the nasal discharge of patients who had contracted common cold, different covs had been isolated in various infected animals, including turkey, mouse, cow, pig, cat and dog.
translation.ga: Roimh an chéad iargúltacht de strus b814 hcov-229e ó urscaoileadh nasal na n-othar a raibh fuar coitianta orthu, bhí covanna éagsúla scoite amach in ainmhithe ionfhabhtaithe éagsúla, lena n-áirítear turcaí, luch, bó, muc, cat agus madra.

translation.en: In the past decades, seven hcovs have been identified.
translation.ga: Le fiche nó tríocha bliain anuas, aithníodh seacht hcov.

translation.en: A brief summary of the history of hcov discovery in chronological order (table ​ 1) would be informative and instructive.
translation.ga: Bheadh ​ ​ achoimre ghairid ar stair fhionnachtain hcov in ord croineolaíoch (tábla 1) faisnéiseach agus oiliúnach.

translation.en: The first hcov-229e strain was isolated from the respiratory tract of patients with upper respiratory tract infection in the year of 1966, and was subsequently adapted to grow in wi-38 lung cell lines.
translation.ga: Rinneadh an chéad strain hcov-229e a scaradh ó chonair riospráide na n-othar a raibh ionfhabhtú an chonair riospráide uachtarach acu sa bhliain 1966, agus rinneadh é a oiriúnú ina dhiaidh sin chun fás i línte cille scamhóg wi-38.

translation.en: Patients infected with hcov-229e presented with common cold symptoms, including headache, sneezing, malaise and sore-throat, with fever and cough seen in 10 ~ 20% cases.
translation.ga: Tá comharthaí fuar coitianta ag othair atá ionfhabhtaithe le hcov-229e, lena n-áirítear tinneas cinn, sraothartach, malaise agus scornach tinn, le fiabhras agus casacht le feiceáil i 10 ~ 20% de chásanna.

translation.en: Later in 1967, hcov-oc43 was isolated from organ culture and subsequent serial passage in brains of suckling mice.
translation.ga: Níos déanaí i 1967, bhí hcov-oc43 scoite amach ó chultúr orgán agus sliocht sraitheach ina dhiaidh sin in brains na lucha diúil.

translation.en: The clinical features of hcov-oc43 infection appear to be similar to those caused by hcov-229e, which are symptomatically indistinguishable from infection with other respiratory tract pathogens such as influenza a viruses and rhinoviruses.
translation.ga: Is cosúil go bhfuil gnéithe cliniciúla an ionfhabhtaithe hcov-oc43 cosúil leis na gnéithe is cúis le hcov-229e, nach féidir a aithint go siomptómach ó ionfhabhtú le pataiginí eile an chonair riospráide mar víris fliú a agus riníteas.

translation.en: Both hcov-229e and hcov-oc43 are distributed globally, and they tend to be predominantly transmitted during the season of winter in temperate climate.
translation.ga: Déantar hcov-229e agus hcov-oc43 a dháileadh ar fud an domhain, agus is gnách go dtarchuirtear iad den chuid is mó i rith séasúr an gheimhridh in aeráid mheasartha.

translation.en: Generally, the incubation time of these two viruses is less than one week, followed by an approximately 2-week illness.
translation.ga: De ghnáth, bíonn am goir an dá víreas seo níos lú ná seachtain, agus breoiteacht thart ar 2 sheachtain ina dhiaidh sin.

translation.en: According to a human volunteer study, healthy individuals infected with hcov-229e developed mild common cold.
translation.ga: De réir staidéir ar oibrithe deonacha daonna, d ’ fhorbair daoine sláintiúla atá ionfhabhtaithe le hcov-229e fuar coitianta éadrom.

translation.en: Only a few immunocompromised patients exhibited severe lower respiratory tract infection.
translation.ga: Ní raibh ach cúpla othar imdhíon-chomhbhrúite a raibh ionfhabhtú mór conaire riospráide níos ísle acu.

translation.en: Sars, also known as “atypical pneumonia ”, was the first well documented hcov-caused pandemic in human history and the etiological agent is sars-cov, the third hcov discovered.
translation.ga: Ba é sars, ar a dtugtar “niúmóine aitíopúil ” freisin, an chéad phaindéim dea-dhoiciméadaithe de bharr hcov i stair an duine agus is é sars-cov, an tríú hcov a fuarthas an gníomhaire éiteolaíoch.

translation.en: The first case of sars can be traced back to late 2002 in guangdong province of china.
translation.ga: Is féidir an chéad chás de sars a rianú siar go dtí deireadh 2002 i gcúige guangdong na síne.

translation.en: The sars epidemic resulted in 8,096 reported cases with 774 deaths, spreading across many countries and continents.
translation.ga: Mar thoradh ar eipidéim sars tuairiscíodh 8,096 cás le 774 bás, ag leathadh ar fud go leor tíortha agus mór-ranna.

translation.en: Apart from the super-spreaders, it was estimated that each case could give rise to approximately two secondary cases, with an incubation period of 4 to 7 days and the peak of viral load appearing on the 10th day of illness.
translation.ga: Seachas na sár-scaiptheoirí, measadh go bhféadfadh thart ar dhá chás tánaisteacha a bheith mar thoradh ar gach cás, le tréimhse goir idir 4 agus 7 lá agus buaic an ualaigh víreasach le feiceáil ar an 10ú lá de bhreoiteacht.

translation.en: Patients infected with sars-cov initially present with myalgia, headache, fever, malaise and chills, followed by dyspnea, cough and respiratory distress as late symptoms.
translation.ga: Cuireann othair atá ionfhabhtaithe le sars-cov i láthair le myalgia, tinneas cinn, fiabhras, malaise agus chills, agus ina dhiaidh sin dyspnea, casacht agus anacair riospráide mar chomharthaí déanacha.

translation.en: Lymphopenia, deranged liver function tests, and elevated creatine kinase are common laboratory abnormalities of sars.
translation.ga: Is neamhghnáchaíochtaí saotharlainne coitianta de sars iad lymphopenia, tástálacha feidhm ae deranged, agus creatine kinase ardaithe.

translation.en: Diffuse alveolar damage, epithelial cell proliferation and an increase of macrophages are also observed in sars patients.
translation.ga: Tugtar faoi deara damáiste idirleata ailbheolach, iomadú cille epithelial agus méadú ar mhicrophages in othair sars.

translation.en: Approximately 20-30% of patients subsequently require intensive care and mechanical ventilation.
translation.ga: Teastaíonn dianchúram agus aeráil mheicniúil ó thart ar 20-30% d ’ othair ina dhiaidh sin.

translation.en: In addition to lower respiratory tract, multiple organs including gastrointestinal tract, liver and kidney can also be infected in these severe cases, usually accompanied with a cytokine storm, which might be lethal particularly in immunocompromised patients.
translation.ga: Chomh maith leis an gconair riospráide níos ísle, is féidir le horgáin iolracha lena n-áirítear an conradh gastrointestinal, an t-ae agus na duáin a bheith ionfhabhtaithe sna cásanna tromchúiseacha seo, agus stoirm cytokine ag gabháil leo de ghnáth, a d ’ fhéadfadh a bheith marfach go háirithe in othair imdhíon-chomhbhrúite.

translation.en: The virus was first isolated from the open lung biopsy of a relative of the index patient who travelled to hong kong from guangzhou.
translation.ga: Rinneadh an víreas a leithlisiú ar dtús ó bithóipse scamhóg oscailte ghaolta den othar innéacs a thaistil go hong cong ó guangzhou.

translation.en: Since then, tremendous efforts have been dedicated to hcov research.
translation.ga: Ó shin i leith, rinneadh iarrachtaí iontacha le taighde hcov.

translation.en: Hcov-nl63 was isolated from a 7-month-old child from the netherlands during late 2004.
translation.ga: Bhí hcov-nl63 scoite amach ó leanbh 7 mí d' aois ón ísiltír go déanach i 2004.

translation.en: It was initially found to be prevalent in young children, the elderly and immunocompromised patients with respiratory illnesses.
translation.ga: Fuarthas amach ar dtús go raibh sé forleithne i measc leanaí óga, daoine scothaosta agus othair imdhíontaithe le galair riospráide.

translation.en: Presentation of coryza, conjunctivitis, fever, and bronchiolitis is common in the disease caused by hcov-nl63.
translation.ga: Tá cur i láthair coryza, toinníteas, fiabhras, agus bronchiolitis coitianta sa ghalar de bharr hcov-nl63.

translation.en: Another independent study described the isolation of the same virus from a nasal specimen from an 8-month-old boy suffering from pneumonia in the netherlands.
translation.ga: Rinne staidéar neamhspleách eile cur síos ar aonrú an víris chéanna ó eiseamal nasal ó bhuachaill 8 mí d ’ aois atá ag fulaingt ó niúmóine san ísiltír.

translation.en: Although it was identified in netherlands, it is actually distributed globally.
translation.ga: Cé gur aithníodh é san ísiltír, déantar é a dháileadh ar fud an domhain i ndáiríre.

translation.en: It has been estimated that hcov-nl63 accounts for approximately 4.7% of common respiratory diseases, and its peak incidence occurs during early summer, spring and winter.
translation.ga: Meastar go bhfuil thart ar 4.7% de ghalair coitianta riospráide i hcov-nl63, agus tarlaíonn a bhuaic-mhinicíocht go luath sa samhradh, san earrach agus sa gheimhreadh.

translation.en: Hcov-nl63 is associated with obstructive laryngitis, also known as croup.
translation.ga: Tá baint ag hcov-nl63 le laryngítis bhacrach, ar a dtugtar croup freisin.

translation.en: In the same year, hcov-hku1 was isolated from a 71-year-old man who had been hospitalized with pneumonia and bronchiolitis in hong kong.
translation.ga: An bhliain chéanna, bhí hcov-hku1 scoite amach ó fhear 71 bliain d ’ aois a bhí san ospidéal le niúmóine agus bronchiolitis i hong cong.

translation.en: Besides community-acquired pneumonia and bronchiolitis, hcov-hku1 was reported to be associated with acute asthmatic exacerbation.
translation.ga: Tuairiscíodh go raibh baint ag hcov-hku1 le géarú asthmatach géarmhíochaine seachas niúmóine agus bronchiolitis a fuarthas sa phobal.

translation.en: Similar to hcov-nl63, hcov-229e and hcov-oc43, hcov-hku1 was found worldwide, causing mild respiratory diseases.
translation.ga: Fuarthas cosúil le hcov-nl63, hcov-229e agus hcov-oc43, hcov-hku1 ar fud an domhain, agus is cúis le galair riospráide éadroma iad.

translation.en: All these four community-acquired hcovs have been well adapted to humans and are generally less likely to mutate to cause highly pathogenic diseases, though accidents did occur for unknown reasons as in the rare case of a more virulent subtype of hcov-nl63, which has recently been reported to cause severe lower respiratory tract infection in china.
translation.ga: Tá na ceithre hcov seo a fuarthas sa phobal curtha in oiriúint go maith do dhaoine agus go ginearálta is lú seans go dtréigfidh siad galair an-phataigineacha, cé gur tharla timpistí ar chúiseanna anaithnid mar a tharlaíonn i gcás fo-chineál níos géire de hcov-nl63, a bhfuil tuairiscíodh le déanaí go bhfuil sé ina chúis le hionfhabhtú mór conaire riospráide sa tsín.

translation.en: Generally, when these hcovs acquire the abilities to transmit efficiently and to maintain themselves continuously within humans, they also become less virulent or pathogenic.
translation.ga: Go ginearálta, nuair a fhaigheann na hcovanna seo an cumas chun tarchur go héifeachtúil agus iad féin a choinneáil go leanúnach laistigh de dhaoine, bíonn siad chomh fíochmhar nó chomh pataigineach freisin.

translation.en: Mers-cov was first isolated in 2012 from the lung of a 60-year-old patient who developed acute pneumonia and renal failure in saudi arabia.
translation.ga: Rinneadh mers-cov a leithlisiú den chéad uair in 2012 ó scamhóg othair 60 bliain d ’ aois a d ’ fhorbair niúmóine géarmhíochaine agus cliseadh duánach san araib shádach.

translation.en: Whereas most of the laboratory-confirmed cases originate from the middle east, imported cases with occasional secondary spreads to close contacts have been reported in various european countries and tunisia.
translation.ga: Cé gur ón meánoirthear a thagann an chuid is mó de na cásanna a dhearbhaíonn saotharlann, tuairiscíodh cásanna allmhairithe le leathadh tánaisteach ó am go chéile go dlúth-theagmhálacha i dtíortha eorpacha éagsúla agus sa túinéis.

translation.en: Another secondary outbreak occurred in south korea in 2015 with 186 confirmed cases.
translation.ga: Tharla ráig thánaisteach eile sa chóiré theas in 2015 le 186 cás dearbhaithe.

translation.en: Clinical manifestations of mers resemble those of sars, characterized by progressive acute pneumonia.
translation.ga: Tá léirithe cliniciúla de mers cosúil le cinn sars, arb iad is sainairíonna niúmóine forásach forásach.

translation.en: Unlike sars, many patients with mers also developed acute renal failure, which is thus far unique for mers among hcov-caused diseases.
translation.ga: Murab ionann agus sars, d ’ fhorbair go leor othar le mers cliseadh géarmhíochaine duánach, atá uathúil go dtí seo do mers i measc galair de bharr hcov.

translation.en: More than 30% of patients present with gastrointestinal symptoms, such as diarrhea and vomiting.
translation.ga: Tá comharthaí gastraistéigeach ag níos mó ná 30% d ’ othair, mar shampla buinneach agus urlacan.

translation.en: As of february 14, 2020, over 2500 laboratory confirmed cases were reported with a high case fatality of 34.4%, making mers-cov one of the most devastating viruses known to humans.
translation.ga: Amhail an 14 feabhra, 2020, tuairiscíodh go raibh níos mó ná 2500 cás dearbhaithe saotharlainne le básmhaireacht ard cásanna de 34.4%, rud a fhágann go bhfuil mers-cov ar cheann de na víris is tubaisteach is eol do dhaoine.

translation.en: During middle to late december 2019, clusters of pneumonia patients retrospectively known to be associated with sars-cov-2 infection were detected in wuhan, hubei province, china.
translation.ga: Le linn lár go deireadh mhí na nollag 2019, braitheadh ​ ​ braislí d ’ othair niúmóine ar eol dóibh go raibh baint acu le hionfhabhtú sars-cov-2 i wuhan, cúige hubei, an tsín.

translation.en: World health organization declared the ongoing outbreak of lower respiratory tract infection caused by sars-cov-2 a public health emergency of international concern and also named the disease covid-19.
translation.ga: Dhearbhaigh an eagraíocht dhomhanda sláinte an ráig leanúnach d ’ ionfhabhtú an chonair riospráide níos ísle de bharr sars-cov-2, éigeandáil sláinte poiblí a bhfuil imní idirnáisiúnta air agus ainmníodh an galar covid-19 freisin.

translation.en: As of march 3, 2020, 90,053 cases have been confirmed worldwide, with a crude case fatality of 3.4%.
translation.ga: Amhail an 3 márta, 2020, bhí 90,053 cás dearbhaithe ar fud an domhain, agus ba é 3.4% básmhaireacht cásanna amh.

translation.en: Notably, the case fatality in hubei, china is 4.2%, whereas the one outside of it is 1.2%.
translation.ga: Go háirithe, is é an básmhaireacht cáis i hubei, an tsín ná 4.2%, ach is é an ceann lasmuigh de 1.2%.

translation.en: Sars-cov-2 causes severe respiratory infection like sars-cov and mers-cov, presented as fever, cough and dyspnea.
translation.ga: Tá sars-cov-2 ina chúis le hionfhabhtú riospráide trom mar sars-cov agus mers-cov, a chuirtear i láthair mar fhiabhras, casacht agus dyspnea.

translation.en: Diarrhea is also seen in some patients.
translation.ga: Feictear buinneach i roinnt othar freisin.

translation.en: Pneumonia is one of the most severe symptoms and can progress rapidly to acute respiratory distress syndrome.
translation.ga: Tá an niúmóine ar cheann de na hairíonna is déine agus is féidir léi dul ar aghaidh go gasta chuig siondróm anacair riospráide géarmhíochaine.

translation.en: Although sars-cov and sars-cov-2 are very similar due to high nucleotide sequence homology of 82%, they cluster into different branches in the phylogenetic tree.
translation.ga: Cé go bhfuil sars-cov agus sars-cov-2 an-chosúil mar gheall ar homology ard seicheamh núicléitíde de 82%, cnuasaíonn siad isteach i mbrainsí éagsúla sa chrann phylogenetic.

translation.en: Sars-cov-2 is apparently less pathogenic but more transmissible compared to sars-cov and mers-cov.
translation.ga: Is cosúil go bhfuil sars-cov-2 níos lú pataigineach ach níos in-tarchurtha i gcomparáid le sars-cov agus mers-cov.

translation.en: Asymptomatic subjects infected with sars-cov-2 have been reported and might contribute to its rapid spreading around the world.
translation.ga: Tuairiscíodh ábhair neamhshiomptómacha atá ionfhabhtaithe le sars-cov-2 agus d ’ fhéadfadh go gcuirfeadh siad lena scaipeadh go tapa ar fud an domhain.

translation.en: Comparing and contrasting sars-cov-2 with the other six hcovs reveal similarities and differences of great interest.
