translation.ga: Nochtann comparáid agus codarsnacht sars-cov-2 leis na sé hcov eile cosúlachtaí agus difríochtaí spéise mór.

translation.en: First, the incubation period and the duration of the course of hcov disease are very similar.
translation.ga: Ar dtús, tá an tréimhse goir agus fad chúrsa an ghalair hcov an-chosúil.

translation.en: In this regard, sars-cov-2 follows the general trend of the other six hcovs.
translation.ga: Maidir leis seo, leanann sars-cov-2 treocht ghinearálta na sé hcov eile.

translation.en: Second, the severity of symptoms of covid-19 lies between sars-cov and the four community-acquired hcovs (i.e. hcov-229e, hcov-oc43, hcov-hku1 and hcov-nl63).
translation.ga: Ar an dara dul síos, tá déine na hairíonna de covid-19 idir sars-cov agus na ceithre hcov a fuarthas sa phobal (i.e. hcov-229e, hcov-oc43, hcov-hku1 agus hcov-nl63).

translation.en: On one hand, sars-cov-2 infection exhibits features that are more commonly seen during infection with community-acquired hcovs, including the presentation of non-specific, mild or even no symptoms.
translation.ga: Ar lámh amháin, taispeánann ionfhabhtú sars-cov-2 gnéithe a fheictear níos minice le linn ionfhabhtaithe le hcovanna a fhaightear sa phobal, lena n-áirítear comharthaí neamhshonracha, éadroma nó fiú gan aon comharthaí a chur i láthair.

translation.en: On the other hand, a small subset of severe cases of covid-19 can also be seen as in the case of sars-cov infection, although the ratio is a bit lower.
translation.ga: Ar an láimh eile, is féidir fo-thacar beag de chásanna tromchúiseacha de covid-19 a fheiceáil mar atá i gcás ionfhabhtaithe sars-cov, cé go bhfuil an cóimheas beagán níos ísle.

translation.en: Third, the transmission of sars-cov-2 also shows interesting patterns characteristic of both community-acquired hcovs and sars-cov.
translation.ga: Ar an tríú dul síos, léiríonn tarchur sars-cov-2 patrúin spéisiúla ar saintréith de hcovanna a fuarthas sa phobal agus sars-cov.

translation.en: On one hand, the transmissibility of sars-cov-2 is at least as high as that of community-acquired hcovs.
translation.ga: Ar lámh amháin, tá in-tarchurtha sars-cov-2 ar a laghad chomh hard le hcovanna a fhaigheann an pobal.

translation.en: On the other hand, it remains to be verified whether the transmissibility of sars-cov-2 decreases after passages in humans as in the cases of sars-cov and mers-cov.
translation.ga: Ar an láimh eile, tá sé fós le fíorú an laghdaíonn in-tarchurtha sars-cov-2 tar éis pasáistí i ndaoine mar atá i gcásanna sars-cov agus mers-cov.

translation.en: Finally, same as the other hcovs, sars-cov-2 can be detected in fecal samples.
translation.ga: Ar deireadh, mar an gcéanna leis na hcovanna eile, is féidir sars-cov-2 a bhrath i samplaí fecal.

translation.en: Whether fecal-oral transmission of sars-cov-2 plays an important role as in the case of sars-cov at least under some circumstance remains to be clarified by future studies.
translation.ga: Cibé an bhfuil ról tábhachtach ag tarchur fecal-béil sars-cov-2 mar i gcás sars-cov faoi imthosca áirithe ar a laghad, tá sé fós le soiléiriú ag staidéir amach anseo.

translation.en: It is also of particularly great interest to see whether sars-cov-2 might exhibit seasonality as in the cases of community-acquired hcovs.
translation.ga: Is díol spéise ar leith é freisin féachaint an bhféadfadh sars-cov-2 séasúracht a thaispeáint mar a tharlaíonn i gcás hcovanna a fhaigheann an pobal.

translation.en: Nevertheless, the features of sars-cov-2 including its transmissibility, pathogenicity and sustainable spreading after passages in humans will be influential on the ultimate fate of the ongoing outbreak of covid-19.
translation.ga: Mar sin féin, beidh tionchar ag gnéithe sars-cov-2 lena n-áirítear a inaistritheacht, a phataigineacht agus a leathadh inbhuanaithe tar éis pasáistí i ndaoine ar chinniúint dheiridh na ráige leanúnaí de covid-19.

translation.en: All four community-acquired hcovs causing mild symptoms have been well adapted to humans.
translation.ga: Tá na ceithre hcov uile a fuarthas sa phobal agus is cúis le hairíonna éadroma curtha in oiriúint go maith do dhaoine.

translation.en: From another perspective, it might also be true that humans have been well adapted to these four hcovs.
translation.ga: Ó thaobh eile de, d ’ fhéadfadh sé a bheith fíor freisin go bhfuil daoine curtha in oiriúint go maith do na ceithre hcov seo.

translation.en: In other words, both could be the survivors of ancient hcov pandemics.
translation.ga: Is é sin le rá, d ’ fhéadfadh an dá rud a bheith ina marthanóirí ó phaindéimí ársa hcov.

translation.en: Hcovs that cause severe diseases in humans and humans who developed severe hcov diseases have been eliminated.
translation.ga: Cuireadh deireadh le hcovanna is cúis le galair thromchúiseacha i ndaoine agus i ndaoine a d ’ fhorbair galair thromchúiseacha hcov.

translation.en: For this to happen, hcovs have to replicate in humans to sufficient extent to allow the accumulation of adaptive mutations that counteract host restriction factors.
translation.ga: Chun go dtarlóidh sé seo, ní mór do hcovanna macasamhlú i ndaoine a dhóthain chun carnadh sóchán oiriúnaitheach a chuireann in aghaidh fachtóirí srianta óstacha a cheadú.

translation.en: In this sense, the longer the sars-cov-2 outbreak persists and the more people that it infects, the greater chance that it will fully adapt to humans.
translation.ga: Sa chiall seo, an níos faide a mhaireann an ráig sars-cov-2 agus an níos mó daoine a ionfhabhtaíonn sé, is mó an seans go n-oirfidh sé go hiomlán do dhaoine.

translation.en: If it adapts well, its transmission in humans would be difficult to stop by quarantine or other infection control measures.
translation.ga: Má athraíonn sé go maith, bheadh ​ ​ sé deacair a tharchur i ndaoine a stopadh trí choraintín nó trí bhearta rialaithe ionfhabhtaithe eile.

translation.en: For many years, the four community-acquired covs circulate in human populations, triggering common cold in immunocompetent subjects.
translation.ga: Le blianta fada, scaiptear na ceithre cov a fhaigheann an pobal i ndaonraí an duine, ag spreagadh fuar coitianta in ábhair imdhíon-imdhíonachta.

translation.en: These viruses do not need an animal reservoir.
translation.ga: Níl taiscumar ainmhithe de dhíth ar na víris seo.

translation.en: In contrast, highly pathogenic sars-cov and mers-cov have not adapted to humans well and their transmission within humans cannot be sustained.
translation.ga: I gcodarsnacht leis sin, níor oiriúnaigh sars-cov agus mers-cov an-phataigineach do dhaoine go maith agus ní féidir a dtarchur laistigh de dhaoine a chothú.

translation.en: They need to maintain and propagate in their zoonotic reservoirs and seek the chance to spillover to susceptible human targets, possibly via one or more intermediate and amplifying hosts.
translation.ga: Caithfidh siad a dtaiscumair zónóiseacha a choinneáil agus a iomadú agus an deis a lorg chun spriocanna daonna so-ghabhálacha a dhoirteadh, b ’ fhéidir trí óstach idirmheánach agus aimplithe amháin nó níos mó.

translation.en: Sars-cov-2 has features that are similar to both sars-cov / mers-cov and the four community-acquired hcovs.
translation.ga: Tá gnéithe ag sars-cov-2 atá cosúil le sars-cov / mers-cov agus na ceithre hcov a fhaigheann an pobal.

translation.en: It is highly transmissible like community-acquired hcovs, at least for the time being.
translation.ga: Tá sé in-tarchurtha cosúil le hcovanna a fhaigheann an pobal, de thuras na huaire ar a laghad.

translation.en: However, it is more pathogenic than community-acquired hcovs and less pathogenic than sars-cov or mers-cov.
translation.ga: Mar sin féin, tá sé níos pataigineach ná hcovanna a fhaigheann an pobal agus níos lú pataigineach ná sars-cov nó mers-cov.

translation.en: It remains to be seen whether it will adapt fully to humans and circulate within humans without a reservoir or intermediate animal host.
translation.ga: Tá sé fós le feiceáil an ndéanfaidh sé oiriúnú iomlán do dhaoine agus an scaipfidh sé laistigh de dhaoine gan taiscumar nó óstach ainmhithe idirmheánach.

translation.en: Before discussing the animal origins of hcovs, it will serve us well to discuss the definitions and characteristics of evolutionary, natural, reservoir, intermediate and amplifying hosts of hcovs.
translation.ga: Sula bpléifear bunús ainmhithe hcovanna, is maith an rud é sainmhínithe agus tréithe óstach éabhlóideach, nádúrtha, taiscumar, idirmheánach agus aimplithe hcovanna a phlé.

translation.en: An animal serves as the evolutionary host of an hcov if it harbours a closely related ancestor sharing high homology at the level of nucleotide sequence.
translation.ga: Feidhmíonn ainmhí mar óstach éabhlóideach hcov má chuanta sé le sinsear a bhfuil dlúthbhaint aige agus a bhfuil ard-homalógacht aige ar leibhéal na seicheamh núicléitíde.

translation.en: The ancestral virus is usually well adapted and non-pathogenic in this host.
translation.ga: Is gnách go mbíonn an víreas sinsear oiriúnaithe go maith agus neamh-phataigineach san óstach seo.

translation.en: Likewise, a reservoir host harbours hcov continuously and for long term.
translation.ga: Mar an gcéanna, déanann óstach taiscumar caladh hcov go leanúnach agus go fadtéarmach.

translation.en: In both cases, the hosts are naturally infected and are the natural hosts of hcov or its parental virus.
translation.ga: Sa dá chás, tá na hóstach ionfhabhtaithe go nádúrtha agus is óstach nádúrtha hcov nó víreas a dtuismitheoirí iad.

translation.en: In contrast, if the hcov is newly introduced to an intermediate host right before or around its introduction to humans, it is not well adapted to the new host and is often pathogenic.
translation.ga: I gcodarsnacht leis sin, má thugtar an hcov isteach mar óstach idirmheánach díreach roimh é a thabhairt isteach do dhaoine, ní dhéantar é a oiriúnú go maith don óstach nua agus is minic a bhíonn sé pataigineach.

translation.en: This intermediate host can serve as the zoonotic source of human infection and play the role of an amplifying host by allowing the virus to replicate transiently and then transmitting it to humans to amplify the scale of human infection.
translation.ga: Féadann an t-óstach idirmheánach seo fónamh mar fhoinse zónóiseach d ’ ionfhabhtú daonna agus ról óstach aimplithe a imirt trí ligean don víreas macasamhlú go neamhbhuan agus ansin é a tharchur chuig daoine chun scála an ionfhabhtaithe daonna a mhéadú.

translation.en: An hcov can undergo a dead-end infection if it cannot sustain its transmission within the intermediate host.
translation.ga: Is féidir le hcov ionfhabhtú marbh a fháil mura féidir leis a tharchur laistigh den óstach idirmheánach a choinneáil.

translation.en: On the contrary, hcovs can also adapt to the intermediate host and even establish long-term endemicity.
translation.ga: A mhalairt ar fad, is féidir le hcovanna oiriúnú don óstach idirmheánach agus fiú endemicity fadtéarmach a bhunú.

translation.en: In this case, the intermediate host becomes a natural reservoir host.
translation.ga: Sa chás seo, bíonn an t-óstach idirmheánach ina óstach taiscumar nádúrtha.

translation.en: Epidemiological data revealed retrospectively that the index case of sars had a contact history with game animals.
translation.ga: Léirigh sonraí eipidéimeolaíocha go siarghabhálach go raibh stair teagmhála ag ainmhithe innéacs le cás innéacs sars.

translation.en: Subsequent seroprevalence investigations indicated that animal traders had a higher prevalence of anti-sars-cov igg compared with that of the general population.
translation.ga: Léirigh imscrúduithe seroprevalence ina dhiaidh sin go raibh leitheadúlacht níos airde igg frith-sars-cov ag trádálaithe ainmhithe i gcomparáid le leitheadúlacht an daonra i gcoitinne.

translation.en: Masked palm civets (paguma larvata) and a racoon dog in live animal markets were first identified to carry sars-cov-like viruses that are almost identical to sars-cov.
translation.ga: Aithníodh civets pailme maisc (paguma larvata) agus madra racún i margaí ainmhithe beo ar dtús chun víris cosúil le sars-cov a iompar atá beagnach mar an gcéanna le sars-cov.

translation.en: This was indirectly supported by the fact that no further sars was reported after killing all civets in the markets.
translation.ga: Thacaigh sé go hindíreach leis seo nár tuairiscíodh aon sars eile tar éis gach civets sna margaí a mharú.

translation.en: However, it has been reported that masked palm civets from the wild or farms without exposure to the live animal markets were largely negative for sars-cov, suggesting that masked palm civets might only serve as the intermediate amplifying host but not the natural reservoir of sars-cov.
translation.ga: Tuairiscíodh, áfach, go raibh civets pailme maiscithe ón bhfiáine nó ó na feirmeacha gan nochtadh do mhargaí na n-ainmhithe beo diúltach den chuid is mó do sars-cov, rud a thugann le tuiscint go bhféadfadh civets pailme maiscithe a bheith mar óstach aimplithe idirmheánach ach ní mar thaiscumar nádúrtha sars -cov.

translation.en: Notably, since 80% of the different animals in the markets in guangzhou have anti-sars-cov antibodies, the possibilities that multiple species of small mammals might also serve as intermediate amplifying hosts of sars-cov cannot be excluded.
translation.ga: Go háirithe, ós rud é go bhfuil antasubstaintí frith-sars-cov ag 80% de na hainmhithe éagsúla sna margaí i guangzhou, ní féidir na féidearthachtaí a d ’ fhéadfadh go mbeadh speicis iolracha de mhamaigh bheaga mar óstach aimplithe idirmheánach de sars-cov a eisiamh.

translation.en: All of these appear to be dead-end hosts of sars-cov.
translation.ga: Is cosúil go bhfuil siad seo go léir ina hóstach deiridh de sars-cov.

translation.en: Subsequent search for the natural animal host of sars-cov unveiled a closely related bat cov, termed sars-related rhinolophus bat cov hku3 (sarsr-rh-batcov hku3), which exists in chinese horseshoe bats.
translation.ga: Nocht cuardach ina dhiaidh sin ar óstach ainmhithe nádúrtha sars-cov sciathán leathair a raibh dlúthbhaint aige le cov, ar a dtugtar ialtóg rhinolophus a bhaineann le sars cov hku3 (sarsr-rh-batcov hku3), atá ann in ialtóga crú capaill na síne.

translation.en: These bats are positive for anti-sars-cov antibodies and genome sequence of sarsr-rh-batcov hku3.
translation.ga: Tá na sciatháin leathair seo dearfach maidir le antasubstaintí frith-sars-cov agus seicheamh géanóm de sarsr-rh-batcov hku3.

translation.en: This and other bat covs share 88-92% nucleotide sequence homology with sars-cov.
translation.ga: Roinneann sé seo agus covanna ialtóg eile homology seicheamh núicléitíde 88-92% le sars-cov.

translation.en: These studies have laid the foundation for the new concept that bats host emerging human pathogens.
translation.ga: Tá na staidéir seo tar éis bunús a leagan síos don choincheap nua a óstáil ialtóga pataiginí daonna atá ag teacht chun cinn.

translation.en: Several sars-like covs (sl-covs) have also been identified from bats, but none except for one designated wiv1 can be isolated as live virus.
translation.ga: Sainaithníodh roinnt covanna cosúil le sars (sl-covanna) ó ialtóga, ach ní féidir aon cheann seachas wiv1 ainmnithe a leithlisiú mar víreas beo.

translation.en: Human angiotensin converting enzyme 2 (ace2) is known to be the receptor of sars-cov.
translation.ga: Is eol go bhfuil einsím tiontaithe angiotensin daonna 2 (ace2) mar ghabhdóir sars-cov.

translation.en: Wiv1 derived from fecal sample of bats was demonstrated to use bat, civet and human ace2 as receptor for cell entry.
translation.ga: Taispeánadh go n-úsáideann wiv1 a dhíorthaítear ó shampla fecal ialtóga ialtóg, civet agus ace2 daonna mar ghabhdóir le haghaidh iontrála cille.

translation.en: Intriguingly, sera of convalescent sars patients were capable of neutralizing wiv1.
translation.ga: Rud suimiúil, bhí sera d ’ othair sars téarnaimh in ann wiv1 a neodrú.

translation.en: Thus far, wiv1 represents the most closely related ancestor of sars-cov in bats, sharing 95% nucleotide sequence homology.
translation.ga: Go dtí seo, is ionann wiv1 agus an sinsear sars-cov is dlúithe a bhaineann le sciatháin leathair, ag roinnt homology seicheamh núicléitíde 95%.

translation.en: Albeit the high homology between these two viruses, it is generally believed that wiv1 is not the immediate parental virus of sars-cov and bats are not the immediate reservoir host of sars-cov.
translation.ga: Cé go bhfuil an homalóg ard idir an dá víreas seo, creidtear go ginearálta nach é wiv1 an víreas tuismitheora láithreach de sars-cov agus nach iad ialtóga an t-óstach taiscumar láithreach de sars-cov.

translation.en: Phylogenetic analysis clusters mers-cov to the same group as bat cov-hku4 and bat cov-hku5.
translation.ga: Braislí anailíse phylogenetic mers-cov chuig an ngrúpa céanna le bat cov-hku4 agus bat cov-hku5.

translation.en: Bat cov-hku4 and mers-cov utilize the same host receptor, dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (dpp4), for virus entry.
translation.ga: Úsáideann ialtóg cov-hku4 agus mers-cov an gabhdóir óstach céanna, dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (dpp4), chun víreas a iontráil.

translation.en: Rna-dependent rna polymerase sequences of mers-cov are phylogenetically closer to counterparts in bat beta-covs identified from europe and africa.
translation.ga: Tá seichimh polaiméaráise rna atá spleách ar rna de mers-cov níos gaire ó thaobh phylogenetically do chomhghleacaithe i béite-covanna ialtóg a shainaithnítear ón eoraip agus ón afraic.

translation.en: Up to now, no live mers-cov can be found in wild bats.
translation.ga: Go dtí seo, ní féidir aon mers-cov beo a fháil i sciatháin leathair fiáine.

translation.en: Mers-cov and its closest relative bat cov-hku25 share only 87% nucleotide sequence homology.
translation.ga: Ní roinneann mers-cov agus an sciathán leathair coibhneasta is gaire cov-hku25 ach homology seicheamh núicléitíde 87%.

translation.en: Thus, bats might not be the immediate reservoir host of mers-cov.
translation.ga: Mar sin, b ’ fhéidir nach iad ialtóga an t-óstach taiscumar láithreach de mers-cov.

translation.en: On the other hand, studies in middle east have shown that dromedary camels are seropositive for mers-cov-specific neutralizing antibodies, same as camels of middle east origin in multiple african countries.
translation.ga: Ar an láimh eile, tá sé léirithe ag staidéir sa mheánoirthear go bhfuil camáin dromlaigh seropositive d ’ antaibheathaigh neodraithe atá sonrach do mers-cov, mar an gcéanna le camel de bhunadh an mheánoirthir i dtíortha iomadúla san afraic.

translation.en: Live mers-cov identical to the virus found in humans was isolated from the nasal swabs of dromedary camels, further indicating that camels serve as the bona fide reservoir host of mers-cov.
translation.ga: Rinneadh mers-cov beo atá comhionann leis an víreas a fhaightear i ndaoine a leithlisiú ó swabs nasal na gcamán dromlaigh, rud a thugann le fios freisin go bhfreastalaíonn camel mar óstach taiscumar bona fide de mers-cov.

translation.en: It is also noteworthy that generally mild symptoms but massive virus shedding were observed in camels experimentally infected with mers-cov.
translation.ga: Is fiú a lua freisin gur breathnaíodh comharthaí éadroma go ginearálta ach sceitheadh ​ ​ víreas ollmhór i gcamáin a bhí ionfhabhtaithe go turgnamhach le mers-cov.

translation.en: Notably, infected camels shed viruses not only through respiratory route but also through fecal-oral route, which is also the main route for virus shedding from bats.
translation.ga: Go háirithe, caitheann camel ionfhabhtaithe víris ní amháin tríd an mbealach riospráide ach freisin trí bhealach fecal-béil, atá freisin ar an bpríomhbhealach chun víris a shedding ó ialtóga.

translation.en: However, questions still remain since many confirmed cases of mers have no contact history with camels prior to symptom onset, plausibly ascribed to human-to-human transmission or unknown transmission routes involving unrecognized animal species that harbour mers-cov.
translation.ga: Tá ceisteanna fós ann, áfach, ós rud é nach bhfuil aon stair teagmhála ag go leor cásanna deimhnithe de mers le camel sula dtosaíonn na hairíonna, a chuirtear i leith go dóchúil ar tharchur duine-go-duine nó ar bhealaí tarchuir anaithnid ina mbíonn speicis ainmhithe neamh-aitheanta a chaitheann mers-cov.

translation.en: Sars-cov-2 shares 96.2% nucleotide homology with a bat cov ratg13 isolated from rhinolophus affinis bats.
translation.ga: Roinneann sars-cov-2 homology núicléitíde 96.2% le sciathán leathair cov ratg13 atá scoite amach ó ialtóga rhinolophus affinis.

translation.en: As in the cases of sars-cov and mers-cov, the sequence divergence between sars-cov-2 and ratg13 is too great to assign parental relationship.
translation.ga: Mar a tharla i gcásanna sars-cov agus mers-cov, tá an éagsúlacht seicheamh idir sars-cov-2 agus ratg13 ró-iontach chun caidreamh tuismitheoirí a shannadh.

translation.en: That is to say, bats might not be the immediate reservoir host (s) of sars-cov-2 unless almost identical bat covs are found in future.
translation.ga: Is é sin le rá, b ’ fhéidir nach mbeadh ialtóga mar óstach (í) taiscumar láithreach sars-cov-2 mura bhfaighfear covanna ialtóg atá beagnach mar an gcéanna amach anseo.

translation.en: Presumably, the intermediate animal hosts of sars-cov-2 should be among the wildlife species sold and killed at the huanan seafood wholesale market, with which many of the initial cases of covid-19 were associated, indicative of a probable animal-to-human transmission event.
translation.ga: Is dócha, ba cheart go mbeadh na hóstach ainmhithe idirmheánacha de sars-cov-2 i measc na speiceas fiadhúlra a dhíoltar agus a maraíodh ag margadh mórdhíola bia mara na huanáine, a raibh baint ag go leor de na cásanna tosaigh de covid-19 leo, rud a léiríonn ainmhí dóchúil go- imeacht tarchuir daonna.

translation.en: Several recent studies based on metagenomic sequencing have suggested that a group of endangered small mammals known as pangolins (manis javanica) could also harbour ancestral beta-covs related to sars-cov-2.
translation.ga: Thug roinnt staidéir le déanaí bunaithe ar sheicheamh metagenómach le fios go bhféadfadh grúpa mamaigh bheaga atá i mbaol ar a dtugtar pangóil (manis javanica) béite-covanna sinsear a bhaineann le sars-cov-2 a chaladh.

translation.en: These novel pangolin cov genomes share 85-92% nucleotide sequence homology with sars-cov-2.
translation.ga: Roinneann na géanóm núíosacha cov pangolin seo homology seicheamh núicléitíde 85-92% le sars-cov-2.

translation.en: However, they are equally closely related to ratg13 with about 90% identity at the level of nucleotide sequence.
translation.ga: Mar sin féin, tá dlúthbhaint acu le ratg13 le thart ar 90% aitheantais ag leibhéal seicheamh na núicléitíde.

translation.en: They cluster into two sub-lineages of sars-cov-2-like viruses in the phylogenetic tree, one of which share a more similar receptor binding domain (rbd) with sars-cov-2, with 97.4% amino acid sequence identity.
translation.ga: Braislíonn siad ina dhá fho-líne de víris cosúil le sars-cov-2 sa chrann phylogenetic, a bhfuil fearann ​ ​ ceangailteach gabhdóra (rbd) níos cosúla le ceann acu le sars-cov-2, le haitheantas seicheamh aimínaigéad 97.4%.

translation.en: In stark contrast, the rbds of sars-cov-2 and ratg13 are more divergent, albeit a higher degree of sequence homology genome-wide.
translation.ga: I gcodarsnacht lom, tá na rbdanna de sars-cov-2 agus ratg13 níos éagsúla, cé go bhfuil leibhéal níos airde seicheamh géanóm homology ar fud an domhain.

translation.en: An earlier study on diseased pangolins also reported the detection of viral contigs from lung samples, which turn out to be similarly related to sars-cov-2.
translation.ga: Thuairiscigh staidéar níos luaithe ar pangóilí galraithe go bhfuarthas contigs víreasacha ó shamplaí scamhóg, a bhfuil baint chéanna acu le sars-cov-2.

translation.en: This study adopted different assembly methods and manual curation to generate a partial genome sequence comprising about 86.3% of the full-length viral genome.
translation.ga: Ghlac an staidéar seo modhanna cóimeála éagsúla agus leigheas láimhe chun seicheamh páirteach de ghéanóma a ghiniúint a chuimsíonn thart ar 86.3% den ghéanóm víreasach lánfhada.

translation.en: We cannot exclude the possibility that pangolin is one of the intermediate animal hosts of sars-cov-2.
translation.ga: Ní féidir linn an fhéidearthacht a eisiamh go bhfuil pangolin ar cheann de na hóstach ainmhithe idirmheánacha de sars-cov-2.

translation.en: However, currently there is no evidence in support of a direct pangolin origin of sars-cov-2 due to the sequence divergence between sars-cov-2 and pangolin sars-cov-2-related beta-covs.
translation.ga: Mar sin féin, faoi láthair níl aon fhianaise ann a thacaíonn le bunús díreach pangolin de sars-cov-2 mar gheall ar an éagsúlacht seicheamh idir sars-cov-2 agus beta-covanna a bhaineann le sars-cov-2 a bhaineann le pangolin.

translation.en: In addition, the distance between sars-cov-2 and ratg13 is even shorter than that between sars-cov-2 and pangolin sars-cov-2-related beta-covs.
translation.ga: Ina theannta sin, tá an fad idir sars-cov-2 agus ratg13 níos giorra fós ná an fad idir sars-cov-2 agus béite-covanna a bhaineann le sars-cov-2 pangolin.

translation.en: The evolutionary pathway of sars-cov-2 in bats, pangolins and other mammals remains to be established.
translation.ga: Tá cosán éabhlóideach sars-cov-2 i sciatháin leathair, pangóilí agus mamaigh eile fós le bunú.

translation.en: Whereas the highest sequence homology has been found in the rbds between sars-cov-2 and pangolin, sars-cov-2-related beta-covs, sars-cov-2 and ratg13 share the highest genome-wide sequence homology.
translation.ga: Cé go bhfuarthas an homology seicheamh is airde sna rbdanna idir sars-cov-2 agus pangolin, roinneann beta-covanna a bhaineann le sars-cov-2, sars-cov-2 agus ratg13 an homology seicheamh is airde ar fud na géanóm.

translation.en: It is highly speculative that the high degree of similarity between the rbds of pangolin sars-cov-2-related beta-covs and sars-cov-2 is driven by selectivity-mediated convergent evolution.
translation.ga: Tá sé an-amhantrach go bhfuil an leibhéal ard cosúlachta idir na rbdanna de béite-covanna a bhaineann le pangolin sars-cov-2 agus sars-cov-2 á dtiomáint ag éabhlóid chóineasaithe idirghabhála roghnaíochta.

translation.en: A counter-proposal is in favour of a recombination between a pangolin sars-cov-2-related beta-cov and ratg13 in the third wild animal species.
translation.ga: Tá frith-thogra i bhfabhar athmholadh idir béite-cov a bhaineann le pangolin sars-cov-2 agus ratg13 sa tríú speiceas ainmhithe fiáine.

translation.en: As a driving force in evolution, recombination is widespread among beta-covs.
translation.ga: Mar fhórsa tiomána san éabhlóid, tá athmholadh forleathan i measc béite-covanna.

translation.en: The jury is still out on the immediate zoonotic origin of sars-cov-2.
translation.ga: Tá an giúiré fós amuigh ar bhunús zónóiseach láithreach sars-cov-2.

translation.en: Besides the highly pathogenic hcovs, the zoonotic origin of hcov-229e, hcov-oc43, hcov-nl63 and hcov-hku1 have also been studied.
translation.ga: Chomh maith leis na hcovanna an-phataigineacha, rinneadh staidéar freisin ar bhunús zónóiseach hcov-229e, hcov-oc43, hcov-nl63 agus hcov-hku1.

translation.en: Phylogenetic evidence indicated that both hcov-nl63 and hcov-229e might have originated from bat covs, while the parental viruses of hcov-oc43 and hcov-hku1 have been found in rodents.
translation.ga: Thug fianaise phylogenetic le fios go bhféadfadh gur ó covanna ialtóg a tháinig hcov-nl63 agus hcov-229e, agus fuarthas víris tuismitheoirí hcov-oc43 agus hcov-hku1 i gcreimirí.

translation.en: It has been reported that a bat cov termed arcov.2 (appalachian ridge cov) detected in north american tricolored bat displayed close relationship with hcov-nl63.
translation.ga: Tuairiscíodh go raibh dlúthbhaint ag ialtóg cov ar a dtugtar arcov.2 (appalachian ridge cov) a braitheadh ​ ​ in ialtóg tríthoiseach mheiriceá thuaidh le hcov-nl63.

translation.en: On the other hand, hcov-229e was genetically related to another bat cov, termed hipposideros / ghanakwam / 19 / 2008, which was detected in ghana, while camelids have also been suspected as its intermediate host.
translation.ga: Ar an láimh eile, bhí baint ghéiniteach ag hcov-229e le cov ialtóg eile, ar a dtugtar hipposideros / ghanakwam / 19 / 2008, a braitheadh ​ ​ i ngána, agus tá amhras ann go bhfuil camelids mar a óstach idirmheánach.

translation.en: For clarity, the current knowledge on animal origins of known hcovs is summarized in figure ​ 1 and table 2.
translation.ga: Ar mhaithe le soiléire, déantar achoimre ar an eolas reatha ar bhunús ainmhithe de hcovanna aitheanta i bhfíor 1 agus tábla 2.

translation.en: Phylogenetic analysis has provided evidence for interspecies transmission events of hcovs in the history.
translation.ga: Chuir anailís phylogenetic fianaise ar fáil maidir le himeachtaí tarchuir idir-speicis hcovanna sa stair.

translation.en: When hcov-oc43 crossed species to infect humans from domestic livestock around 1890, a pandemic of respiratory infection was recorded.
translation.ga: Nuair a thrasnaigh hcov-oc43 speicis chun daoine a ionfhabhtú ó bheostoc baile timpeall 1890, taifeadadh paindéim d ’ ionfhabhtú riospráide.

translation.en: The interspecies transmission history of hcov-229e is less clear.
translation.ga: Níl stair tarchuir idir-speicis hcov-229e chomh soiléir.

translation.en: Bat alpha-covs closely related to hcov-229e have been found.
translation.ga: Fuarthas alfa-covanna ialtóg a bhfuil dlúthbhaint acu le hcov-229e.

translation.en: Between them there is an alpaca alpha-cov.
translation.ga: Eatarthu tá alpaca alfa-cov.

translation.en: Several lines of evidence support the transmission of virus from bats to humans directly.
translation.ga: Tacaíonn roinnt línte fianaise le tarchur víris ó ialtóga chuig daoine go díreach.

translation.en: First, humans but not alpacas might have contact with bats in a shared ecological niche.
translation.ga: Ar dtús, d ’ fhéadfadh go mbeadh teagmháil ag daoine ach ní alpacanna le sciatháin leathair i nideoige éiceolaíoch roinnte.

translation.en: Instead, humans have close contact with alpacas.
translation.ga: Ina áit sin, bíonn dlúth-theagmháil ag daoine le alpacanna.

translation.en: Second, hcov-229e-related bat alpha-covs are diverse and non-pathogenic in bats, whereas alpaca alpha-cov caused an outbreak of respiratory disease in infected animals.
translation.ga: Ar an dara dul síos, tá alfa-covanna ialtóg a bhaineann le hcov-229e éagsúil agus neamh-phataigineach in ialtóga, ach ba chúis le alpaca alfa-cov ráig den ghalar riospráide in ainmhithe ionfhabhtaithe.

translation.en: Finally, alpaca alpha-cov has not been found in feral animals.
translation.ga: Mar fhocal scoir, níor aimsíodh alpaca alfa-cov in ainmhithe fiáine.

translation.en: Thus, the possibility cannot be excluded that alpacas obtain the hcov-229e-related alpha-cov from humans.
translation.ga: Mar sin, ní féidir an fhéidearthacht a eisiamh go bhfaigheann alpacanna an alfa-cov a bhaineann le hcov-229e ó dhaoine.

translation.en: In fact, bats are the direct source of human pathogenic viruses including rabies virus, ebola virus, nipah virus and hendra virus.
translation.ga: Déanta na fírinne, is iad ialtóga foinse dhíreach víris phataigineacha an duine lena n-áirítear víreas confaidh, víreas ebola, víreas nipah agus víreas hendra.

translation.en: It is therefore not too surprising that bats might transmit hcov-229e to humans directly.
translation.ga: Ní haon ionadh mar sin go bhféadfadh ialtóga hcov-229e a tharchur chuig daoine go díreach.

translation.en: Alternatively, whereas bat alpha-covs serve as the gene pool of hcov-229e, alpacas and dromedary camels might serve as intermediate hosts that transmit viruses to humans, exactly as in the case of mers-cov.
translation.ga: De rogha air sin, cé go bhfónann alfa-covanna ialtóg mar chomhthiomsú géine hcov-229e, d ’ fhéadfadh alpacanna agus camel dromlaigh feidhmiú mar óstach idirmheánach a tharchuireann víris chuig daoine, díreach mar atá i gcás mers-cov.

translation.en: Mers-cov serves as an excellent example of interspecies transmission from bats to dromedary camels and from dromedary camels to humans.
translation.ga: Is sampla iontach é mers-cov de tharchur idir-speicis ó ialtóga go camáin dromlaigh agus ó chamáin dromlaigh go daoine.

translation.en: The evolutionary origin of mers-cov from bats is known at its initial identification and has also been strengthened by subsequent findings.
translation.ga: Tá bunús éabhlóideach mers-cov ó ialtóga ar eolas nuair a sainaithníodh é ar dtús agus neartaíodh é freisin le torthaí ina dhiaidh sin.

translation.en: It is obvious that bats provide a rich pool of virus species for interspecies exchange of genetic fragments and interspecies transmission.
translation.ga: Is léir go soláthraíonn ialtóga líon saibhir speiceas víris le haghaidh malartú idir-speicis blúirí géiniteacha agus tarchur idir-speicis.

translation.en: Longevity, densely packed colonies, close social interaction and strong ability to fly are all favourable conditions for bats to be an ideal 'virus spreader'.
translation.ga: Is coinníollacha fabhracha iad fad saoil, coilíneachtaí dlúth pacáilte, dlúth-idirghníomhaíocht shóisialta agus cumas láidir eitilt chun go mbeidh ialtóga ina ‘ scaiptheoir víris ’ idéalach.

translation.en: On the other hand, mers-cov has been introduced to dromedary camels for decades.
translation.ga: Ar an láimh eile, tá mers-cov tugtha isteach do chamáin dromlaigh le blianta fada.

translation.en: It is well adapted to these camels that have turned from an intermediate host to a stable and natural reservoir host.
translation.ga: Tá sé oiriúnaithe go maith do na camáin seo a d' iompaigh ó óstach idirmheánach go óstach taiscumar nádúrtha seasmhach.

translation.en: Mers-cov causes very mild disease and maintains a relatively low mutation rate in these animals.
translation.ga: Is galar an-éadrom é mers-cov agus coinníonn sé ráta sócháin réasúnta íseal sna hainmhithe seo.

translation.en: Its sporadic transmission to humans is an accident and humans remain a dead-end host of mers-cov as its transmission cannot be sustained.
translation.ga: Is timpiste é a tharchur ó am go chéile do dhaoine agus fanann daoine mar óstach gan stad de mers-cov toisc nach féidir a tharchur a chothú.

translation.en: In contrast to the role of camels in the transmission of mers-cov, the role of pangolins, if there is any, in the transmission of sars-cov-2 is different.
translation.ga: I gcodarsnacht le ról na gcamán i dtarchur mers-cov, tá ról na bpangolins, más ann dó, i dtarchur sars-cov-2 difriúil.

translation.en: Particularly, pangolin beta-covs are highly pathogenic in pangolins.
translation.ga: Go háirithe, tá béite-covanna pangolin an-phataigineach i bpangóil.

translation.en: They might be a dead-end host for sars-cov-2-related beta-covs, similar to civets in the case of sars-cov.
translation.ga: D ’ fhéadfadh siad a bheith ina óstach deiridh do beta-covanna a bhaineann le sars-cov-2, cosúil le civets i gcás sars-cov.

translation.en: Several possibilities for interspecies transmission of sars-cov-2 from animals to humans have to be ruled in or ruled out in future studies.
translation.ga: Caithfear roinnt féidearthachtaí maidir le tarchur idir-speicis sars-cov-2 ó ainmhithe go daoine a chur as an áireamh nó a scriosadh amach i staidéir amach anseo.

translation.en: First, bats could be the reservoir host of a sars-cov-2-related virus almost identical to sars-cov-2.
translation.ga: Ar dtús, d ’ fhéadfadh ialtóga a bheith mar óstach taiscumar víreas a bhaineann le sars-cov-2 beagnach mar an gcéanna le sars-cov-2.

translation.en: Humans might share the ecological niche with bats through butchering or coal mining.
translation.ga: D ’ fhéadfadh daoine an nideoige éiceolaíoch a roinnt le sciatháin leathair trí bhúistéireacht nó mianadóireacht guail.

translation.en: Second, pangolins could be one of intermediate amplifying host to which a sars-cov-2-related virus had been newly introduced.
translation.ga: Ar an dara dul síos, d ’ fhéadfadh pangolins a bheith ar cheann de óstach aimplithe idirmheánach ar tugadh víreas nua a bhaineann le sars-cov-2 isteach.

translation.en: Humans contract the virus through butchering and consumption of game meat.
translation.ga: Déanann daoine an víreas a chonradh trí bhúistéireacht agus tomhaltas feola géim.

translation.en: It is possible that many mammals including domestic animals are susceptible to sars-cov-2.
translation.ga: Is féidir go bhfuil go leor mamaigh lena n-áirítear ainmhithe clóis so-ghabhálach do sars-cov-2.

translation.en: A survey of domestic and wild animals for antibodies is warranted.
translation.ga: Tá gá le suirbhé ar ainmhithe clóis agus ainmhithe fiáine le haghaidh antasubstaintí.

translation.en: Third, as mentioned above, recombination and adaptation of sars-cov-2 might have occurred in a third species that has contact with both bats and pangolins.
translation.ga: Ar an tríú dul síos, mar a luadh thuas, d ’ fhéadfadh go dtarlódh athmholadh agus oiriúnú sars-cov-2 i dtríú speiceas a bhfuil teagmháil acu le sciatháin leathair agus pangóilí.

translation.en: The search for the animal origins of sars-cov-2 is still on.
translation.ga: Tá an cuardach ar bhunús ainmhithe sars-cov-2 fós ar siúl.

translation.en: Apart from different types of the animal hosts, three major factors on the viral side are also important in facilitating covs to cross species barriers.
translation.ga: Seachas cineálacha éagsúla na n-óstach ainmhithe, tá trí mhórfhachtóir ar an taobh víreasach tábhachtach freisin chun covanna a éascú chun bacainní ar speicis a thrasnú.

translation.en: First of all, their relatively high mutation rates in rna replication.
translation.ga: Ar dtús báire, a rátaí sócháin réasúnta ard i macasamhlú rna.

translation.en: In comparison to other single-stranded rna viruses, the estimated mutation rates of covs could be regarded as “moderate ” to“ high ” with an average substitution rate being ~ 10-4 substitution per year per site 2, depending on the phase of cov adaptation to novel hosts.
translation.ga: I gcomparáid le víris rna aon-shnáithe eile, d ’ fhéadfaí a mheas go bhfuil rátaí sócháin measta covanna “measartha ” go“ ard ” agus meánráta ionadaíochta ~ 10-4 ionadú in aghaidh na bliana in aghaidh an láithreáin 2, ag brath ar chéim na cov oiriúnú d ’ óstach úrscéal.

translation.en: Covs have a proof-reading exoribonuclease, deletion of which results in exceedingly high mutability and attenuation or even inviability.
translation.ga: Tá exoribonuclease profa-léitheoireachta ag covanna, agus bíonn suaiteacht agus tanú an-ard nó fiú dofheictheacht mar thoradh ar a scriosadh.

translation.en: Interestingly, the nucleotide analogue remdesivir is known to suppress cov replication through inhibition of this exoribonuclease and the rna-dependent rna polymerase.
translation.ga: Suimiúil go leor, is eol don analóg analóg núicléitíde remdesivir macasamhlú cov a bhaint trí chosc a chur ar an exoribonuclease seo agus an polaiméaráise rna atá spleách ar rna.

translation.en: Remdesivir is one of most promising anti-sars-cov-2 agents to be tested in clinical trials.
translation.ga: Tá remdesivir ar cheann de na gníomhairí frith-sars-cov-2 is geallta a thástáil i dtrialacha cliniciúla.

translation.en: Nevertheless, mutation rates of covs are about a million times higher than those of their hosts.
translation.ga: Mar sin féin, tá rátaí sócháin covanna thart ar mhilliún uair níos airde ná rátaí a n-óstach.

translation.en: In addition, mutation rate is often high when covs are not well adapted to the host.
translation.ga: Ina theannta sin, is minic a bhíonn an ráta sócháin ard nuair nach mbíonn covanna oiriúnaithe go maith don óstach.

translation.en: Compared to sars-cov with a high mutation rate, the mutation rate of sars-cov-2 is apparently lower, suggestive of a higher level of adaptation to humans.
translation.ga: I gcomparáid le sars-cov le ráta sócháin ard, is cosúil go bhfuil ráta sócháin sars-cov-2 níos ísle, rud a thugann le tuiscint go bhfuil leibhéal oiriúnaithe níos airde ann do dhaoine.

translation.en: Presumably, it has already been adapted to another host close to humans.
translation.ga: Is dócha, tá sé curtha in oiriúint cheana féin d ’ óstach eile atá gar do dhaoine.

translation.en: In addition to sars-cov-2, this also applies to mers-cov, which is well adapted to dromedary camels.
translation.ga: Chomh maith le sars-cov-2, baineann sé seo freisin le mers-cov, atá oiriúnaithe go maith do chamáin dromlaigh.

translation.en: Theoretically, it is unlikely that genetic drift would render vaccines and antivirals against sars-cov-2 ineffective quickly.
translation.ga: Teoiriciúil, ní dócha go bhfágfadh sruth géiniteach vacsaíní agus frithvíreas i gcoinne sars-cov-2 neamhéifeachtach go tapa.

translation.en: Second, the large rna genome in covs exerts extra plasticity in genome modification for mutations and recombination, thereby increasing the probability for interspecies co-evolution, which is advantageous for the emergence of novel covs when the conditions become appropriate.
translation.ga: Ar an dara dul síos, feidhmíonn an géanóm rna mór i covanna plaisteacht bhreise i modhnú géanóm le haghaidh sóchán agus athmholadh, agus ar an gcaoi sin an dóchúlacht go dtarlóidh comh-éabhlóid idir-speicis a mhéadú, rud atá buntáisteach do theacht chun cinn covanna nua nuair a thiocfaidh na coinníollacha iomchuí.

translation.en: This is supported by the copious unique open reading frames and protein functions encoded towards the 3 ′ end of the genome.
translation.ga: Tacaíonn na frámaí léitheoireachta oscailte uathúla iomadúla agus na feidhmeanna próitéine atá ionchódaithe i dtreo dheireadh 3 ′ an ghéanóim leis seo.

translation.en: Third, covs randomly and frequently switch templates during rna replication through a unique “copy-choice ” mechanism.
translation.ga: Ar an tríú dul síos, athraíonn covanna teimpléid go randamach agus go minic le linn macasamhlú rna trí mheicníocht uathúil “cóip-rogha ”.

translation.en: In a host that serves as the mixing vessel, strand switching occurs frequently during cov rna transcription.
translation.ga: In óstach a fheidhmíonn mar an soitheach meascáin, tarlaíonn athrú snáithe go minic le linn trascríobh cov rna.

translation.en: Highly homologous full-length and subgenomic rnas could recombine to generate new covs.
translation.ga: D ’ fhéadfadh rnanna lán-homalógacha lánfhada agus subgenómacha athmholadh chun covanna nua a ghiniúint.

translation.en: Phylogenetic evidence of natural recombination has been found in both hcov-hku1 and hcov-oc43, as well as animal covs such as bat sl-cov and batcov-hku9.
translation.ga: Fuarthas fianaise phylogenetic de athmholadh nádúrtha i hcov-hku1 agus hcov-oc43, chomh maith le covanna ainmhithe mar ialtóg sl-cov agus batcov-hku9.

translation.en: Virus-host interaction in relation to transmission
translation.ga: Idirghníomhaíocht óstach víris maidir le tarchur

translation.en: Besides three viral factors stated above, viral interaction with host receptor is another key factor influential on interspecies transmission.
translation.ga: Chomh maith le trí fhachtóir víreasacha a luaitear thuas, is príomhfhachtóir eile é idirghníomhaíocht víreasach leis an receptor óstach ar tharchur idir-speicis.

translation.en: Herein, recombination of sars-cov is taken as a typical example, which also showed evidence of positive selection during interspecies transmission events.
translation.ga: Anseo, glactar le hathmholadh sars-cov mar shampla tipiciúil, a léirigh fianaise freisin ar roghnú dearfach le linn imeachtaí tarchuir idir-speicis.

translation.en: Based on the comparative analysis between isolates of human and civet sars-covs, sars-cov is thought to undergo rapid adaptation in different hosts, particularly with mutations at the rbd of the s protein.
translation.ga: Bunaithe ar an anailís chomparáideach idir aonrú sars-covanna daonna agus civet, ceaptar go ndéanfar oiriúnú tapa ar sars-cov in óstach éagsúil, go háirithe le sócháin ag rbd an phróitéin s.

translation.en: Generally, the rbd in the s protein of a cov interacts with the cellular receptor and is intensely selected by the host antibody response.
translation.ga: De ghnáth, bíonn an rbd i bpróitéin s de cov ag idirghníomhú leis an receptor ceallacha agus roghnaíonn an freagra óstach antashubstaintí go dian é.

translation.en: In sars-cov, the rbd is in the 318th to 510th amino acids on the s1 fragment, which binds to the human ace2 as well as its coreceptors for viral entry.
translation.ga: I sars-cov, tá an rbd sa 318ú go 510ú aimínaigéad ar an blúire s1, a cheanglaíonn leis an ace2 daonna chomh maith lena chroí-ghabhdóirí le haghaidh iontrála víreasach.

translation.en: The rbd of sars-cov is capable of recognizing the ace2 receptors of various animals, including bat, civet, mouse and raccoon dog, allowing interspecies transmission of the virus.
translation.ga: Tá an rbd de sars-cov in ann gabhdóirí ace2 ainmhithe éagsúla a aithint, lena n-áirítear ialtóg, civet, luch agus madra racún, rud a ligeann don víreas an víreas a tharchur idir speicis.

translation.en: In fact, only 6 amino acid residues were observed to be different from human and civet viral isolates in the rbd and 4 of them locate in the receptor-binding motif for interaction with the ace2 receptor.
translation.ga: Déanta na fírinne, níor breathnaíodh ach 6 iarmhar aimínaigéad a bhí difriúil ó aonrú víreasach daonna agus civet sa rbd agus tá 4 cinn acu lonnaithe sa mhóitíf atá ceangailteach le gabhdóirí le haghaidh idirghníomhaíochta leis an receptor ace2.

translation.en: Civet sars-cov has k479n and s487t mutations in its rbd, which might increase the affinity of the interaction of spike protein with human ace2 receptor.
translation.ga: Tá sócháin k479n agus s487t ag civet sars-cov ina rbd, rud a d ’ fhéadfadh cleamhnas idirghníomhaíocht próitéine spíce le gabhdóir ace2 daonna a mhéadú.

translation.en: In other words, these two amino acid substitutions might be critical to viral adaption to humans.
translation.ga: Is é sin le rá, d ’ fhéadfadh an dá ionadú aimínaigéad seo a bheith ríthábhachtach d ’ oiriúnú víreasach do dhaoine.

translation.en: It is noteworthy that sars-cov-2 shares the same cellular receptor with sars-cov.
translation.ga: Is fiú a lua go roinneann sars-cov-2 an gabhdóir ceallacha céanna le sars-cov.

translation.en: A 30% difference between sars-cov-2 and sars-cov in the s1 unit of the s protein implicates that the binding affinity of its s protein with human ace2 might have altered.
translation.ga: Tugann difríocht 30% idir sars-cov-2 agus sars-cov in aonad s1 den phróitéin s le tuiscint go bhféadfadh athrú a bheith tagtha ar an cleamhnas ceangailteach dá phróitéin s le ace2 daonna.

translation.en: Indeed, a cryo-em study indicates a 10- to 20-fold higher affinity of this binding than that between human ace2 and sars-cov s protein.
translation.ga: Go deimhin, tugann staidéar cryo-em le fios go bhfuil cleamhnas níos airde idir 10 agus 20 huaire ag an gceangal seo ná an gaol idir próitéin ace2 daonna agus próitéin sars-cov s.

translation.en: It will also be of interest to determine whether any other coreceptor might be required for sars-cov-2 transmission.
translation.ga: Is díol spéise freisin a chinneadh an bhféadfadh go mbeadh gá le croí-ghabhdóir eile le haghaidh tarchur sars-cov-2.

translation.en: Intriguingly, hcov-nl63 also binds to ace2 but with a different part of s.
translation.ga: Go hiontach, ceanglaíonn hcov-nl63 le ace2 ach le cuid dhifriúil de s.

translation.en: There exist many other hcov receptors, such as aminopeptidase n for hcov-229e, and 9-o-acetylated sialic acid for hcov-oc43.
translation.ga: Tá go leor gabhdóirí hcov eile ann, mar shampla aminopeptidase n le haghaidh hcov-229e, agus aigéad sialic 9-o-aicéitilithe do hcov-oc43.

translation.en: They might also account for successful adaptation of these covs in humans after interspecies transmission from their animal hosts.
translation.ga: D ’ fhéadfadh siad cuntas a thabhairt freisin ar oiriúnú rathúil na covanna seo i ndaoine tar éis tarchur idir speicis óna n-óstach ainmhithe.

translation.en: In addition to cellular receptors, the outcome of interspecies transmission of hcovs is also governed by other host dependency and restriction factors.
translation.ga: Chomh maith le gabhdóirí ceallacha, tá toradh tarchur idir-speicis hcovanna á rialú ag fachtóirí spleáchais agus srianta óstacha eile.

translation.en: The divergence of these host proteins between humans and natural reservoir hosts of hcovs such as bats, dromedary camels and rodents might constitute a barrier to interspecies transmission.
translation.ga: D ’ fhéadfadh go mbeadh éagsúlacht na próitéiní óstacha seo idir daoine agus óstach taiscumar nádúrtha hcovanna mar ialtóga, camel dromlaigh agus creimirí ina mbacainn ar tharchur idir-speicis.

translation.en: Hcovs have to usurp host dependency factors and subvert host restriction factors for a successful interspecies transmission.
translation.ga: Ní mór do hcovanna tosca spleáchais óstacha a athúsáid agus fachtóirí srianta óstacha a chur ar ais le haghaidh tarchur rathúil idir-speicis.

translation.en: In this regard, molecular determinants in this important area of virus-host interaction remain to be identified and characterized.
translation.ga: Maidir leis seo, tá deitéarmanaint mhóilíneacha sa réimse tábhachtach seo den idirghníomhaíocht óstach-víris fós le sainaithint agus le tréith.

translation.en: An unbiased genome-wide screening of host dependency and restriction factors for sars-cov-2 using the state-of-the-art technology of crispr might be fruitful.
translation.ga: D ’ fhéadfadh go mbeadh toradh rathúil ar scagadh neamhchlaonta ar fud an ghéanóim ar fhachtóirí spleáchais agus srianta ósta do sars-cov-2 ag baint úsáide as an teicneolaíocht úrscothach crispr.

translation.en: Emergence of novel hcovs: Back to ground zero
translation.ga: Teacht chun cinn hcovanna nua: Ar ais go talamh nialas

translation.en: The diversity of bat covs provides ample opportunities for the emergence of novel hcovs.
translation.ga: Soláthraíonn éagsúlacht na covanna ialtóg neart deiseanna chun hcovanna nua a theacht chun cinn.

translation.en: In this sense, bat covs serve as the gene pool of hcovs.
translation.ga: Sa chiall seo, feidhmíonn covanna ialtóg mar chomhthiomsú géine hcovanna.

translation.en: In addition, rapid mutation and genetic recombination also drive hcov evolution and serve as two important steps in this process.
translation.ga: Ina theannta sin, spreagann sóchán tapa agus athmholadh géiniteach éabhlóid hcov agus feidhmíonn siad mar dhá chéim thábhachtacha sa phróiseas seo.

translation.en: For example, the acquisition or loss of novel protein-coding genes has the potential to drastically modify viral phenotypes.
translation.ga: Mar shampla, tá sé de chumas ag géinte códaithe próitéine núíosacha feinitíopaí víreasacha a mhodhnú go suntasach.

translation.en: Among sars-cov accessory proteins, orf8 has been thought to be important in adaptation to humans, as sars-cov-related bat viruses were isolated but found to encode divergent orf8 proteins.
translation.ga: I measc próitéiní cúlpháirtí sars-cov, measadh go raibh orf8 tábhachtach maidir le hoiriúnú do dhaoine, toisc go raibh víris ialtóg a bhaineann le sars-cov scoite amach ach fuarthas go raibh siad ag ionchódú próitéiní éagsúla orf8.

translation.en: A 29-nucleotide deletion characteristic of sars-covs has been found in strains isolated at the beginning of the human epidemic.
translation.ga: Fuarthas tréith scriosadh 29-núicléatíd arb iad is sainairíonna sars-covanna i dtréimhsí atá scoite amach ag tús an eipidéim dhaonna.

translation.en: This deletion splits orf8 into orf8a and orf8b and is thought to be an adaptive mutation that promotes the switch of hosts.
translation.ga: Roinntear an scriosadh seo orf8 i orf8a agus orf8b agus ceaptar gur sóchán oiriúnaitheach é a chuireann athrú na hóstach chun cinn.

translation.en: Besides, sars-cov has a possible recombination history with lineages of alpha- and gamma-covs, where a large number of smaller recombinant regions were identified in the rna-dependent rna polymerase.
translation.ga: Ina theannta sin, tá stair athmholta féideartha ag sars-cov le líneálacha alfa-agus gáma-covanna, áit ar sainaithníodh líon mór réigiún athchuingreach níos lú sa pholaimeras rna atá spleách ar rna.

translation.en: Recombination locations were also identified in the nsp9, most of nsp10, and parts of nsp14.
translation.ga: Sainaithníodh suíomhanna athmhúnlaithe freisin sa nsp9, an chuid is mó de nsp10, agus i gcodanna de nsp14.

translation.en: Likewise, it has been shown that the epidemic mers-cov experienced recombination events between different lineages, which occurred in dromedary camels in saudi arabia.
translation.ga: Ar an gcaoi chéanna, léiríodh go raibh imeachtaí athmholta ag an eipidéim mers-cov idir líneálacha éagsúla, a tharla i gcamáin dromlaigh san araib shádach.

translation.en: Besides sars-cov and mers-cov, recombination events have also been observed in other hcovs, in which the hcovs recombine with other animal covs in their non-structural genes.
translation.ga: Chomh maith le sars-cov agus mers-cov, breathnaíodh imeachtaí athmholta i hcovanna eile, ina ndéanann na hcovanna athmhúnlú le covanna ainmhithe eile ina ngéinte neamhstruchtúrtha.

translation.en: It should also be cautioned that artificial selection can contribute to unintended changes in viral genomes, most likely resulting from relieving viruses from selection pressures exerted, such as by the host immune system.
translation.ga: Ba chóir a rabhadh freisin gur féidir le roghnú saorga cur le hathruithe neamhbheartaithe i ngéanóim víreasacha, is dóichí a thig as víris a mhaolú ó bhrú roghnaithe a chuirtear i bhfeidhm, amhail an córas imdhíonachta óstach.

translation.en: An example of these effects is the loss of a full-length orf4 in the hcov-229e prototype strain, owing to a two-nucleotide deletion.
translation.ga: Sampla de na héifeachtaí seo is ea cailliúint orf4 lánfhada sa bhrú fréamhshamhla hcov-229e, mar gheall ar scriosadh dhá núicléatíd.

translation.en: While intact orf4 could be observed in bat and camel viruses related to hcov-229e, the alpaca alpha-cov displays a single nucleotide insertion, resulting in a frameshift.
translation.ga: Cé go bhféadfaí orf4 slán a fheiceáil i víris ialtóg agus camel a bhaineann le hcov-229e, taispeánann an alpaca alfa-cov ionchur núicléitíde amháin, agus mar thoradh air sin tá fráma-aistriú.

translation.en: Last but not least, the evolution of novel hcovs is also driven by the selection pressure in their reservoir hosts.
translation.ga: Ar deireadh ach ní ar a laghad, tá éabhlóid na hcovanna nua á dtiomáint ag an mbrú roghnaithe ina n-óstach taiscumar.

translation.en: Asymptomatic or only mild symptoms were detected when bats were infected with covs, indicating the mutual adaptation between covs and bats.
translation.ga: Braitheadh ​ ​ comharthaí neamhshiomptómacha nó éadroma amháin nuair a bhí ialtóga ionfhabhtaithe le covanna, rud a léiríonn an t-oiriúnú frithpháirteach idir covanna agus sciatháin leathair.

translation.en: It appeared that bats are well adapted to covs anatomically and physiologically.
translation.ga: Dhealraigh sé go bhfuil ialtóga oiriúnaithe go maith do covanna go anatamaíoch agus go fiseolaíoch.

translation.en: For example, defects in the activation of pro-inflammatory response in bats efficiently reduce the pathology triggered by covs.
translation.ga: Mar shampla, laghdaíonn lochtanna i ngníomh freagartha athlastach i sciatháin leathair an paiteolaíocht a spreagann covanna go héifeachtúil.

translation.en: Besides, the natural killer cell activity in bats is suppressed due to upregulation of inhibitory natural killer cell receptor nkg2 / cd94 and low expression level of major histocompatibility complex class i molecules.
translation.ga: Ina theannta sin, cuirtear an ghníomhaíocht cille marú nádúrtha i sciatháin leathair faoi chois mar gheall ar upregulation an receptor cille coisctheach nádúrtha nkg2 / cd94 agus leibhéal slonn íseal de mhóilíní aicme casta i histocompatibility.

translation.en: Moreover, the high level of reactive oxygen species (ros) generated from high metabolic activity of bats could both suppress cov replication and affects proofreading by exoribonuclease, thus providing the selection pressure for the generation of virus strains highly pathogenic when introduced into a new host.
translation.ga: Thairis sin, d ’ fhéadfadh leibhéal ard na speiceas ocsaigin imoibríoch (ros) a ghintear ó ardghníomhaíocht meitibileach ialtóga macasamhlú cov a bhaint agus tionchar a imirt ar léamh profaí trí exoribonuclease, agus ar an gcaoi sin an brú roghnaithe a sholáthar chun géinte víris a ghiniúint an-phataigineach nuair a thugtar isteach in óstach nua iad.

translation.en: More pathogenic cov strains might also evolve by recombination, leading to the acquisition of novel proteins or protein features for host adaptation.
translation.ga: D ’ fhéadfadh go dtiocfadh níos mó amhrán cov pataigineacha chun cinn trí athmholadh, rud a d ’ fhágfadh go bhfaighfí próitéiní núíosacha nó gnéithe próitéine le haghaidh oiriúnú óstach.

translation.en: Thus, it is not by chance that three novel hcovs have emerged in the past two decades.
translation.ga: Mar sin, ní trí sheans gur tháinig trí hcov úrscéal chun cinn le fiche bliain anuas.

translation.en: Covs are non-pathogenic or cause mild symptoms in their reservoir hosts such as bats and camels.
translation.ga: Tá covanna neamh-phataigineacha nó bíonn siad ina gcúis le hairíonna éadroma ina n-óstach taiscumar mar ialtóga agus camel.

translation.en: They replicate robustly without eliciting a strong host immune response.
translation.ga: Déanann siad macasamhlú go láidir gan freagairt láidir imdhíonachta óstach a fháil.

translation.en: Herein lie the secrets of why asymptomatic carriers are seen and what causes the severe cases in human infection.
translation.ga: Anseo luíonn na rúin maidir le cén fáth a bhfeictear iompróirí neamhshiomptómacha agus cad is cúis leis na cásanna tromchúiseacha in ionfhabhtú an duine.

translation.en: The severe symptoms are mainly due to the hyperactivation of immune response and the cytokine storm wherein the stronger the immune response, the more severe the lung damage.
translation.ga: Is de bharr hipirghníomhaíocht na freagartha imdhíonachta agus na stoirme ciotocine is mó a bhíonn na hairíonna tromchúiseacha agus is láidre an fhreagairt imdhíonachta, is déine an damáiste scamhóg.

translation.en: In contrast, in asymptomatic carriers, the immune response has been de-coupled from cov replication.
translation.ga: I gcodarsnacht leis sin, in iompróirí neamhshiomptómacha, rinneadh an freagra imdhíonachta a dhíchúpláil ó mhacasamhlú cov.

translation.en: The same strategy of delinking the immune response might have beneficial effects in anti-sars-cov-2 therapy.
translation.ga: D ’ fhéadfadh go mbeadh éifeachtaí tairbhiúla ag an straitéis chéanna chun an fhreagairt imdhíonachta a dhíspreagadh i dteiripe frith-sars-cov-2.

translation.en: The interferon response is particularly strong in bats.
translation.ga: Tá an freagra interferon láidir go háirithe i sciatháin leathair.

translation.en: Thus, administration of type i interferon at least in the early phase of sars-cov-2 infection in humans should be beneficial.
translation.ga: Dá bhrí sin, ba cheart go mbeadh sé tairbheach riarachán de chineál i interferon ar a laghad sa chéim luath den ionfhabhtú sars-cov-2 i ndaoine.

translation.en: In addition, nlrp3 inflammasome activation in bats is defective.
translation.ga: Ina theannta sin, tá gníomhachtú inflammasome nlrp3 lochtach.

translation.en: By this reasoning, inhibition of nlrp3 inflammasome with mcc950 might be useful in the treatment of covid-19.
translation.ga: Leis an réasúnaíocht seo, d ’ fhéadfadh sé go mbeadh sé úsáideach cóireáil a dhéanamh ar covid-19 le cosc ​ ​ a chur ar inflammasome nlrp3 le mcc950.

translation.en: The emergence of sars-cov-2 follows the general theme by which sars-cov and mers-cov arose.
translation.ga: Leanann teacht chun cinn sars-cov-2 an téama ginearálta inar eascair sars-cov agus mers-cov.

translation.en: Whereas a bat beta-cov sharing 95% nucleotide homology with sars-cov has been found, there also exists a bat-cov sharing 96% nucleotide homology with sars-cov-2.
translation.ga: Cé go bhfuarthas béite-cov ialtóg a roinneann homology núicléitíde 95% le sars-cov, tá ialtóg-cov ann freisin a roinneann homology núicléitíde 96% le sars-cov-2.

translation.en: Whereas civets and other animals in the markets have been found to harbour viruses identical to sars-cov, immediate intermediate hosts for sars-cov-2 have not been identified.
translation.ga: Cé go bhfuarthas go bhfuil víris cuain atá comhionann le sars-cov ag civets agus ainmhithe eile sna margaí, níor sainaithníodh óstach idirmheánach láithreach do sars-cov-2.

translation.en: Pangolin beta-covs strikingly homologous to sars-cov-2 have been found, indicating that pangolins might serve as one of intermediate hosts or pangolin beta-covs could contribute gene fragments to the final version of sars-cov-2.
translation.ga: Fuarthas beta-covanna peangóil atá an-aonchineálach do sars-cov-2, rud a thugann le fios go bhféadfadh pangóilí a bheith mar cheann de na hóstach idirmheánach nó go bhféadfadh béite-covanna pangolin blúirí géine a chur leis an leagan deiridh de sars-cov-2.

translation.en: Although questions remain, there is no evidence that sars-cov-2 is man-made either deliberately or accidentally.
translation.ga: Cé go bhfanann ceisteanna ann, níl aon fhianaise ann go ndéantar sars-cov-2 de dhéantús an duine d ’ aon ghnó nó trí thimpiste.

translation.en: Covs have returned to the limelight due to the recent outbreak of sars-cov-2.
translation.ga: Tá covanna tar éis filleadh ar an léargas mar gheall ar ráig sars-cov-2 le déanaí.

translation.en: The study of covs in bats and other animals has drastically changed our perception of the importance of zoonotic origins and animal reservoirs of hcovs in human transmission.
translation.ga: Tá an staidéar ar covanna in ialtóga agus in ainmhithe eile tar éis athrú suntasach a dhéanamh ar an dearcadh atá againn ar thábhacht bhunús zónóiseach agus taiscumair ainmhithe hcovanna i dtarchur an duine.

translation.en: Pervasive evidence has shown that sars-cov, mers-cov and sars-cov-2 have a bat origin and are transmitted to humans via intermediate hosts.
translation.ga: Taispeánann fianaise forleatach go bhfuil bunús ialtóg ag sars-cov, mers-cov agus sars-cov-2 agus go ndéantar iad a tharchur chuig daoine trí óstach idirmheánach.

translation.en: Given that sars-cov infection originates from the contact between humans and civets in the markets, closing wet markets and killing civets therein could have effectively ended the sars epidemic.
translation.ga: Ós rud é go dtagann ionfhabhtú sars-cov ón teagmháil idir daoine agus civets sna margaí, d ’ fhéadfadh sé go gcuirfeadh deireadh le heipidéim sars deireadh éifeachtach le margaí fliucha a dhúnadh agus civets a mharú ann.

translation.en: By the same reasoning, pangolins should be removed from wet markets to prevent zoonotic transmission, in view of the discovery of multiple lineages of pangolin beta-covs closely related to sars-cov-2.
translation.ga: Ar an réasúnaíocht chéanna, ba cheart pangóilí a bhaint ó mhargaí fliucha chun tarchur zónóiseach a chosc, i bhfianaise go bhfuarthas líneálacha iolracha de béite-covanna phangóil a bhfuil dlúthbhaint acu le sars-cov-2.

translation.en: However, whether and how sars-cov-2 is transmitted to humans through pangolins and other mammals remain to be clarified in future investigations.
translation.ga: Mar sin féin, tá soiléiriú fós in imscrúduithe amach anseo cibé an ndéantar sars-cov-2 a tharchur chuig daoine trí pangóil agus mamaigh eile.

translation.en: On the other hand, mers-cov has existed in dromedary camels for a long time.
translation.ga: Ar an láimh eile, tá mers-cov ann i gcamáin dromlaigh le fada an lá.

translation.en: These camels serve as an important tool for transportation as well as a main source of meat, milk, leather and wool products for the local people.
translation.ga: Is uirlis thábhachtach iad na camáin seo le haghaidh iompair chomh maith le príomhfhoinse táirgí feola, bainne, leathair agus olann do mhuintir na háite.

translation.en: They are widely distributed across the middle east and africa.
translation.ga: Déantar iad a dháileadh go forleathan ar fud an mheánoirthir agus na hafraice.

translation.en: It is therefore impossible to sacrifice all camels for the control of mers, as what was done in wild animal markets in china to prevent the spreading of sars-cov and sars-cov-2.
translation.ga: Tá sé dodhéanta dá bhrí sin gach camel a íobairt chun mers a rialú, mar a rinneadh i margaí ainmhithe fiáine sa tsín chun scaipeadh sars-cov agus sars-cov-2 a chosc.

translation.en: To stop the recurrent outbreaks of mers, a comprehensive approach should be taken to develop effective vaccines against mers-cov for camels, in combination with other infection control measures.
translation.ga: Chun ráigeanna athfhillteach mers a stopadh, ba cheart cur chuige cuimsitheach a ghlacadh chun vacsaíní éifeachtacha a fhorbairt i gcoinne mers-cov do chamáin, i dteannta le bearta rialaithe ionfhabhtaithe eile.

translation.en: As we are not able to eliminate these viruses, new genotypes might emerge to cause outbreaks.
translation.ga: Toisc nach féidir linn deireadh a chur leis na víris seo, d ’ fhéadfadh géinitíopaí nua teacht chun cinn chun ráigeanna a chur faoi deara.

translation.en: A variety of zoonotic covs are circulating in the wild.
translation.ga: Tá éagsúlacht de covanna zónóiseacha ag scaipeadh timpeall san fhiáine.

translation.en: Particularly, bat covs with zoonotic potential are so diverse.
translation.ga: Go háirithe, tá covanna ialtóg a bhfuil acmhainneacht zónóiseach acu chomh héagsúil.

translation.en: There are plenty of opportunities that these zoonotic covs evolve and recombine, resulting in the emergence of new covs that are more transmissible and / or deadly in humans in future.
translation.ga: Tá go leor deiseanna ann go dtiocfaidh forbairt agus athmholadh ar na covanna zónóiseacha seo, agus go dtiocfaidh covanna nua chun cinn a bheidh níos in-tarchurtha agus / nó marfacha i ndaoine amach anseo.

translation.en: The culture of eating wild animals in some places of china should be abandoned to reduce unnecessary contact between humans and animals.
translation.ga: Ba cheart an cultúr a bhaineann le hainmhithe fiáine a ithe i roinnt áiteanna sa tsín a thréigean chun teagmháil neamhriachtanach idir daoine agus ainmhithe a laghdú.

translation.en: With the ordeals of sars, mers and covid-19, a better preparedness and response plan should be in place.
translation.ga: Le ordeals sars, mers agus covid-19, ba chóir go mbeadh plean ullmhachta agus freagartha níos fearr i bhfeidhm.

translation.en: In fact, many viruses have existed in the planet for a very long time.
translation.ga: Déanta na fírinne, tá go leor víris ann ar an phláinéid le fada an lá.

translation.en: They stay in their own natural reservoirs until there is a chance for spillover.
translation.ga: Fanann siad ina dtaiscumair nádúrtha féin go dtí go mbeidh deis ann doirteadh.

translation.en: Although bats have many features that favours the spreading of viruses, the chance for humans to be in contact with bats and other wildlife species can be minimized if people are educated to stay away from them.
translation.ga: Cé go bhfuil go leor gnéithe ag ialtóga arbh fhearr leo víris a scaipeadh, is féidir an deis do dhaoine a bheith i dteagmháil le sciatháin leathair agus speicis fiadhúlra eile a íoslaghdú má chuirtear oideachas ar dhaoine fanacht amach uathu.

translation.en: Continuous surveillance in mammals is necessary for better understanding of the ecology of covs and their natural hosts, which will prove useful in preventing animal-to-human transmission and future outbreaks.
translation.ga: Tá gá le faireachas leanúnach i mamaigh chun tuiscint níos fearr a fháil ar éiceolaíocht covanna agus a n-óstach nádúrtha, rud a bheidh úsáideach chun tarchur ainmhí go duine agus ráigeanna amach anseo a chosc.

translation.en: To conclude, the most effective way to prevent viral zoonosis is for humans to stay away from the ecological niches of the natural reservoirs of the zoonotic viruses.
translation.ga: Mar fhocal scoir, is é an bealach is éifeachtaí le zónóis víreasach a chosc ná go bhfanfadh daoine ar shiúl ó nideoga éiceolaíocha taiscumair nádúrtha na víris zónóiseacha.

translation.en: Several pieces in the puzzle of the zoonotic origin of sars-cov-2 are still missing.
translation.ga: Tá roinnt píosaí sa bhfreagra de bhunús zónóiseach sars-cov-2 fós ar iarraidh.

translation.en: First, if bats transmit an ancestral virus of sars-cov-2 to pangolins, it will be of interest to see under what circumstances bats and pangolins could share the same ecological niche.
translation.ga: Ar dtús, má tharchuireann ialtóga víreas sinsear sars-cov-2 chuig pangóil, beidh sé spéisiúil a fheiceáil faoi na cúinsí a bhféadfadh ialtóga agus pangóilí an nideoige éiceolaíoch céanna a roinnt.

translation.en: Second, if bats play a more direct role in human transmission, how humans get into contact with bats should be determined.
translation.ga: Ar an dara dul síos, má tá ról níos dírí ag ialtóga i dtarchur an duine, ba cheart a chinneadh conas a théann daoine i dteagmháil le sciatháin leathair.

translation.en: Third, if a third mammal acts as the true intermediate host, how it interacts with the different species including humans, bats and pangolins has to be clarified.
translation.ga: Ar an tríú dul síos, má fheidhmíonn tríú mamach mar an fíor óstach idirmheánach, caithfear an chaoi a n-idirghníomhaíonn sé leis na speicis éagsúla lena n-áirítear daoine, ialtóga agus pangóilí a shoiléiriú.

translation.en: Finally, since many mammals including domestic animals might be susceptible to sars-cov-2, both surveillance and experimental infection should be conducted.
translation.ga: Mar fhocal scoir, ós rud é go bhféadfadh go leor mamaigh lena n-áirítear ainmhithe clóis a bheith so-ghabhálach do sars-cov-2, ba cheart faireachas agus ionfhabhtú turgnamhach a dhéanamh.

translation.en: Should it be a bat, a pangolin or another mammal, it is expected that sars-cov-2 or its parental viruses that are almost identical will be identified in its natural hosts in future.
translation.ga: Más ialtóg, pangolin nó mamaigh eile atá ann, táthar ag súil go n-aithneofar sars-cov-2 nó a víris tuismitheoirí atá beagnach mar an gcéanna ina óstach nádúrtha amach anseo.

translation.en: Continued investigations in this area will elucidate the evolutionary pathway of sars-cov-2 in animals, with important implications in the prevention and control of covid-19 in humans.
translation.ga: Léireoidh imscrúduithe leanúnacha sa réimse seo bealach éabhlóideach sars-cov-2 in ainmhithe, agus beidh impleachtaí tábhachtacha aige maidir le cosc ​ ​ agus rialú covid-19 i ndaoine.

translation.en: Updating the diagnostic criteria of covid-19 “suspected case ” and“ confirmed case ” is necessary
translation.ga: Is gá critéir dhiagnóiseach covid-19 “cás amhrasta ” agus“ cás dearbhaithe ” a nuashonrú

translation.en: On 6 february 2020, our team had published a rapid advice guideline for diagnosis and treatment of 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-ncov) infection, and this guideline provided our experience and make well reference for fighting against this pandemic worldwide.
translation.ga: An 6 feabhra 2020, d ’ fhoilsigh ár bhfoireann treoirlíne comhairle thapa maidir le hionfhabhtú coronavirus núíosach 2019 (2019-ncov) a dhiagnóisiú agus a chóireáil, agus chuir an treoirlíne seo ár dtaithí ar fáil agus déanann sí tagairt mhaith chun troid i gcoinne na paindéime seo ar fud an domhain.

translation.en: However, the coronavirus disease 2019 (covid-19) is a new disease, our awareness and knowledge are gradually increasing based on the ongoing research findings and clinical practice experience; hence, the strategies of diagnosis and treatment are also continually updated.
translation.ga: Mar sin féin, is galar nua é an galar coronavirus 2019 (covid-19), tá ár bhfeasacht agus ár n-eolas ag méadú de réir a chéile bunaithe ar thorthaí leanúnacha an taighde agus ar thaithí cleachtais chliniciúil; dá bhrí sin, déantar straitéisí an diagnóis agus na cóireála a nuashonrú go leanúnach freisin.

translation.en: In this letter, we answered one comment on our guideline and provided the newest diagnostic criteria of “suspected case ” and“ confirmed case ” according to the latest diagnosis and treatment guidelines for covid-19 (seventh version) that issued by the national health committee of the people ’ s republic of china.
translation.ga: Sa litir seo, d ’ fhreagair muid trácht amháin ar ár dtreoirlíne agus chuireamar na critéir dhiagnóiseacha is nua “cás amhrasta ” agus“ cás dearbhaithe ” ar fáil de réir na dtreoirlínte diagnóis agus cóireála is déanaí do covid-19 (an seachtú leagan) a d ’ eisigh an coiste sláinte náisiúnta de dhaon-phoblacht na síne.

translation.en: In december 2019, the 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-ncov) has caused an outbreak, which is now officially named as the coronavirus disease 2019 (covid-19) and the virus has been named severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (sars-cov-2).
translation.ga: I mí na nollag 2019, ba chúis le ráig de chuid coronavirus úrscéal 2019 (2019-ncov), atá ainmnithe go hoifigiúil anois mar an galar coronavirus 2019 (covid-19) agus ainmníodh an víreas go géar le siondróm riospráide géarmhíochaine 2 (sars-cov-) 2).

translation.en: On 11 march 2020, who characterized covid-19 as a pandemic.
translation.ga: An 11 márta 2020, léirigh who covid-19 mar phaindéim.

translation.en: In order to fight against the sars-cov-2 infection, our team has developed a rapid advice guideline and that has been published online in military medical research on 06 february 2020.
translation.ga: D ’ fhonn troid i gcoinne an ionfhabhtaithe sars-cov-2, d ’ fhorbair ár bhfoireann treoirlíne comhairle thapa agus foilsíodh é ar líne i dtaighde leighis míleata an 06 feabhra 2020.

translation.en: It has attracted a great attention since published.
translation.ga: Tá aird mhór tarraingthe aige ó foilsíodh é.

translation.en: Note however that covid-19 is a new disease, our awareness and knowledge is gradually increasing based on the ongoing research findings and clinical practice experience; hence, the strategies of diagnosis and treatment are also continually updated.
translation.ga: Tabhair faoi deara, áfach, gur galar nua é covid-19, tá ár bhfeasacht agus ár n-eolas ag méadú de réir a chéile bunaithe ar thorthaí leanúnacha an taighde agus ar thaithí cleachtais chliniciúil; dá bhrí sin, déantar straitéisí an diagnóis agus na cóireála a nuashonrú go leanúnach freisin.

translation.en: For instance the diagnosis and treatment guidelines for covid-19 issued by the national health committee of the people ’ s republic of china (http: / / www.nhc.gov.cn /), among 16 january 2020 to 3 march 2020, has issued a total of seven editions with some contexts being substantively changed.
translation.ga: Mar shampla, tá na treoirlínte diagnóis agus cóireála do covid-19 arna n-eisiúint ag coiste sláinte náisiúnta dhaon-phoblacht na síne (http: / / www.nhc.gov.cn /), i measc an 16 eanáir 2020 go 3 márta 2020, a seacht n-eagrán san iomlán agus roinnt comhthéacsanna á n-athrú go substaintiúil.

translation.en: Now our guideline received a comment by zhou et al., they introduced a simple scoring proposal based on their clinical experience.
translation.ga: Anois go bhfuair ár dtreoirlíne trácht ó zhou et al., thug siad isteach togra scórála simplí bunaithe ar a dtaithí cliniciúil.

translation.en: Their work added new evidence for our guideline and also make valuable reference for this pandemic worldwide.
translation.ga: Chuir a gcuid oibre fianaise nua lenár dtreoirlíne agus déanann siad tagairt luachmhar don phaindéim seo ar fud an domhain.

translation.en: We endorse their significant work and express our thanks.
translation.ga: Tacaímid lena gcuid oibre suntasaí agus gabhaimid buíochas.

translation.en: However, their work also needs update according to the latest diagnosis and treatment guidelines for covid-19 (trial seventh version) and recently studies.
translation.ga: Mar sin féin, is gá a gcuid oibre a nuashonrú freisin de réir na dtreoirlínte diagnóis agus cóireála is déanaí do covid-19 (seachtú leagan na trialach) agus staidéir le déanaí.

translation.en: According to the seventh edition (3 march 2020), to confirm the suspected case needs to combine any one item of epidemiological history features with two items of clinical manifestations to make a comprehensive analysis, or needs to meet three items of clinical manifestations if without clear epidemiological history:
translation.ga: De réir an seachtú heagrán (3 márta 2020), chun a dhearbhú go gcaithfidh an cás amhrasta aon earra amháin de ghnéithe staire eipidéimeolaíocha a chomhcheangal le dhá mhír de léirithe cliniciúla chun anailís chuimsitheach a dhéanamh, nó go gcaithfidh sé trí mhír de léirithe cliniciúla a chomhlíonadh mura bhfuil siad soiléir stair eipidéimeolaíoch:

translation.en: Epidemiological history: (1) a history of travel or residence in wuhan city and surrounding areas, or other communities where covid-19 cases had been reported in the last 14 days before symptom onset; (2) a history of contact with sars-cov-2 infectious cases (with positive nucleic acid test); (3) a history of contacting with patients with fever or respiratory symptoms from wuhan city and surrounding areas, or other communities where covid-19 had been reported in the last 14 days before symptom onset; (4) a history of contacting with cluster of confirmed cases (≥ 2 cases with fever and / or respiratory symptoms occurred within 2 weeks in small areas, such as home, office, class of school, etc).
translation.ga: Stair eipidéimeolaíoch: (1) stair taistil nó cónaithe i gcathair wuhan agus sna ceantair máguaird, nó i bpobail eile inar tuairiscíodh cásanna covid-19 le 14 lá anuas sular thosaigh an symptom; (2) stair teagmhála le cásanna tógálach sars-cov-2 (le tástáil dearfach aigéad núicléasach); (3) stair de theagmháil le hothair a bhfuil fiabhras nó comharthaí riospráide orthu ó chathair wuhan agus na ceantair máguaird, nó pobail eile inar tuairiscíodh covid-19 le 14 lá anuas sular thosaigh an symptom; (4) stair teagmhála le braisle cásanna deimhnithe (≥ tharla 2 chás le fiabhras agus / nó comharthaí riospráide laistigh de 2 sheachtain i gceantair bheaga, mar shampla an baile, an oifig, aicme na scoile, srl).

translation.en: Clinical manifestations: (1) fever and / or respiratory symptoms; (2) with imaging features of covid-19 infection; (3) total white blood cell counts showing normal, decreased, or reduced lymphocyte count in the early onset stage.
