translation.en: Measures to delay the spread of the virus taken on 12 March 2020 included closing schools, colleges, childcare facilities and staterun cultural institutions.
translation.ga: Áiríodh i measc na mbearta chun moill a chur ar scaipeadh an víris a glacadh an 12 Márta 2020 scoileanna, coláistí, áiseanna cúram leanaí agus institiúidí cultúrtha stáit a dhúnadh.

translation.en: Hospital visits were restricted.
translation.ga: Cuireadh srian ar chuairteanna chuig ospidéil.

translation.en: Pubs were advised to close.
translation.ga: Moladh do thithe tábhairne dúnadh.

translation.en: These measures were extended, along with further measures announced on 24 March 2020.
translation.ga: Leathnaíodh na bearta seo, in éineacht le tuilleadh beart an 24 Márta 2020.

translation.en: On 10 April, the measures were extended until 5 May 2020.
translation.ga: An 10 Aibreán, leathnaíoch na bearta go dtí an 5 Bealtaine 2020.

translation.en: On 1 May, it was announced that most of the measures would be further extended to 18 May 2020.
translation.ga: Ar 1 Bealtaine, fógraíodh go ndéanfaí an chuid is mó de na bearta a leathnú tuilleadh go dtí an 18 Bealtaine 2020.

translation.en: Phase 1 of the roadmap for reopening society and business started on 18 May and lasted until 8 June 2020.
translation.ga: Cuireadh tús le Céim 1 den treochlár chun an tsochaí agus an gnó a athoscailt an 18 Bealtaine agus mhair sí go dtí an 8 Meitheamh 2020.

translation.en: Phase 2 of the roadmap for reopening society and business started on 8 June and lasted until 29 June 2020.
translation.ga: Cuireadh tús le Céim 2 den treochlár chun an tsochaí agus an gnó a athoscailt an 8 Meitheamh agus mhair sí go dtí an 29 Meitheamh 2020.

translation.en: Phase 3 of the roadmap for reopening society and business started on 29 June 2020.
translation.ga: Cuireadh tús le Céim 3 den treochlár chun an tsochaí agus an gnó a athoscailt an 29 Meitheamh 2020.

translation.en: On 15 July 2020, it was announced that Phase 3 would be extended by 3 weeks.
translation.ga: An 15 Iúil 2020, fógraíodh go leathnófaí Céim 3 ar feadh 3 seachtaine.

translation.en: On 4 August 2020, the start of Phase 4 was delayed for a further 3 weeks.
translation.ga: An 4 Lúnasa 2020, cuireadh moill ar thús Chéim 4 ar feadh 3 seachtaine eile.

translation.en: Additional measures were announced on 18 August 2020.
translation.ga: Fógraíodh bearta breise an 18 Lúnasa 2020.

translation.en: Resilience and Recovery 2020–2021: Plan for Living with COVID19 was published on 15 September 2020.
translation.ga: Foilsíodh Athléimneacht agus Athshlánú 2020–2021: Plean chun maireachtail le COVID19 an 15 Meán Fómhair 2020.

translation.en: Level 2 of the plan applied to all counties.
translation.ga: Cuireadh Leibhéal 2 den phlean i bhfeidhm ar gach contae.

translation.en: Level 3 was introduced for Dublin from midnight 19 September 2020, for Donegal from midnight 25 September and for all other counties from midnight 6 October 2020.
translation.ga: Tugadh Leibhéal 3 isteach i mBaile Átha Cliath ó mheán oíche an 19 Meán Fómhair 2020, i nDún na nGall ó mheán oíche an 25 Meán Fómhair agus i ngach contae eile ó mheán oíche an 6 Deireadh Fómhair 2020.

translation.en: Cavan, Monaghan and Donegal moved to Level 4 from midnight 15 October 2020.
translation.ga: Bhog an Cabhán, Muineachán agus Dún na nGall go Leibhéal 4 ó mheán oíche an 15 Deireadh Fómhair 2020.

translation.en: Every county in Ireland moved to Level 5 from midnight 21 October 2020 until midnight 30 November 2020.
translation.ga: Bhog gach contae in Éirinn go Leibhéal 5 ó mheán oíche an 21 Deireadh Fómhair 2020 go dtí meán oíche an 30 Samhain 2020.

translation.en: A phased move to Level 3 was introduced on 1 December 2020, with some exceptions in place for the Christmas period.
translation.ga: Tugadh isteach bogadh céimnithe go Leibhéal 3 an 1 Nollaig 2020, le roinnt eisceachtaí i bhfeidhm do thréimhse na Nollag.

translation.en: Nonessential retail, gyms, museums, libraries, cinemas and places of worship reopened.
translation.ga: Athosclaíodh miondíol neamhriachtanach, ionaid aclaíochta, músaeim, leabharlanna, pictiúrlanna agus ionaid adhartha.

translation.en: On 4 December 2020, cafes, restaurants and bars serving food reopened with some restrictions.
translation.ga: An 4 Nollaig 2020, d’oscail caiféanna, bialanna agus beáir a bhí ag riar bia le roinnt srianta.

translation.en: From 18 December 2020, you could travel outside your county and up to 3 households could meet indoors as part of the eased restrictions for Christmas.
translation.ga: Ón 18 Nollaig 2020, d’fhéadfá taisteal lasmuigh de do chontae agus d’fhéadfadh suas le 3 theaghlach teacht le chéile taobh istigh mar chuid de na srianta maolaithe don Nollaig.

translation.en: This was intended to last until 6 January.
translation.ga: Bhí sé beartaithe go mairfeadh sé seo go dtí an 6 Eanáir.

translation.en: However, on 24 December 2020, Level 5 restrictions with some adjustments were introduced.
translation.ga: An 24 Nollaig 2020, áfach, tugadh isteach Srianta Leibhéal 5 le roinnt athruithe.

translation.en: On 30 December 2020, full Level 5 restrictions were introduced until 5 March 2021.
translation.ga: An 30 Nollaig 2020, tugadh isteach srianta iomlána Leibhéal 5 go dtí an 5 Márta 2021.

translation.en: On 23 February 2021, Level 5 restrictions were extended to 5 April 2021.
translation.ga: An 23 Feabhra 2021, leathnaíodh srianta Leibhéal 5 go dtí an 5 Aibreán 2021.

translation.en: Testing for COVID19
translation.ga: Tástáil le haghaidh COVID19

translation.en: To find out if you have COVID19, you must be tested at a special COVID19 test centre or in your home.
translation.ga: Chun a fháil amach an bhfuil COVID19 agat, caithfidh oibrí cúraim sláinte oifigiúil tú a thástáil ag ionad tástála speisialta COVID19 nó i do theach.

translation.en: Some people may also get a COVID19 test in hospital before they have a hospital procedure.
translation.ga: D’fhéadfadh daoine áirithe tástáil COVID19 a fháil san ospidéal sula gcuirfear gnáthamh ospidéil orthu.

translation.en: Who can get tested?
translation.ga: Cé ata in ann tástáil a fháil?

translation.en: You may be tested for COVID19 if you have developed at least one of these symptoms:
translation.ga: Féadfar tástáil a dhéanamh ort le haghaidh COVID19 má léiríonn tú ceann amháin ar a laghad de na comharthaí seo:

translation.en: Fever (high temperature)
translation.ga: Fiabhras (teocht ard)

translation.en: Cough
translation.ga: Casacht

translation.en: Shortness of breath
translation.ga: Giorracht anála

translation.en: Loss of taste or smell
translation.ga: Cailliúint bhlas nó bholaidh

translation.en: You may also be tested if you have been in close contact with a confirmed case (even if you do not have symptoms).
translation.ga: D’fhéadfaí tástáil a dhéanamh ort freisin má bhí tú i ndlúththeagmháil le cás dearbhaithe (fiú mura bhfuil comharthaí ort).

translation.en: In this case, you will be phoned by a contact tracer who will arrange your appointment for you.
translation.ga: Sa chás seo, cuirfidh ‘rianaí teagmhála’ glaoch ort chun do choinne a shocrú.

translation.en: A close contact can be if:
translation.ga: D'fhéadfá a bheith i do dhlúththeagmhálaí más rud é:

translation.en: You had facetoface contact within 2 metres of an infected person for more than 15 minutes
translation.ga: Go raibh teagmháil duine le duine agat laistigh de 2 mhéadar ó dhuine ionfhabhtaithe ar feadh níos mó ná 15 nóiméad

translation.en: You live in the same house or accommodation as an infected person
translation.ga: Go bhfuil tú i do chónaí sa teach nó sa chóiríocht chéanna le duine atá ionfhabhtaithe

translation.en: You sat within 2 seats of an infected person, in any direction, on an airplane
translation.ga: Gur shuigh tú laistigh de 2 shuíochán ó dhuine ionfhabhtaithe, in aon treo, ar eitleán

translation.en: You spent more than 2 hours in a closed space with an infected person, such as an office or a classroom
translation.ga: Chaith tú níos mó ná 2 uair an chloig i spás dúnta le duine ionfhabhtaithe, mar shampla oifig nó seomra ranga

translation.en: If you are a close contact, you should restrict your movements for 14 days, even if you receive a negative COVID19 test result.
translation.ga: Más dlúththeagmháil tú, ba cheart duit do ghluaiseachtaí a shrianadh ar feadh 14 lá, fiú má fhaigheann tú toradh diúltach tástála COVID19.

translation.en: What to do if you have symptoms of COVID19
translation.ga: Cad a dhéanann tú má tá comharthaí COVID19 agat

translation.en: If you think you might have COVID19, you should phone your GP.
translation.ga: Má cheapann tú go bhféadfadh COVID19 a bheith agat, ba cheart duit glaoch a chur ar do dhochtúir teaghlaigh.

translation.en: Do not go to the GP clinic.
translation.ga: Ná téigh chuig clinic an Dochtúra Theaghlaigh.

translation.en: If you do not have a GP, you can find a GP in your area.
translation.ga: Mura bhfuil dochtúir teaghlaigh agat, is féidir leat dochtúir teaghlaigh a aimsiú i do cheantar.

translation.en: Your GP will carry out an assessment over the phone.
translation.ga: Déanfaidh do dhochtúir teaghlaigh measúnú ar an bhfón.

translation.en: This assessment is free (including for nonmedical card holders).
translation.ga: Tá an measúnú seo saor in aisce (lena náirítear daoine nach bhfuil cárta leighis acu).

translation.en: If your doctor thinks you need a COVID19 test, they will arrange the test for you.
translation.ga: Má cheapann do dhochtúir go dteastaíonn tástáil COVID19 uait, socróidh sé an tástáil duit.

translation.en: You will be sent your appointment details by text message (including the exact location and time of your appointment).
translation.ga: Seolfar sonraí do choinne trí theachtaireacht téacs (lena náirítear suíomh beacht agus am do choinne).

translation.en: If your GP thinks that you do not need a test, you should stay at home until you have had no symptoms for 48 hours.
translation.ga: Má cheapann do dhochtúir teaghlaigh nach bhfuil tástáil ag teastáil uait, ba chóir duit fanacht sa bhaile go dtí nach mbeidh aon comharthaí ort ar feadh 48 uair an chloig.

translation.en: You should self isolate while waiting for your appointment.
translation.ga: Ba chóir duit féin a fhéinaonrú agus tú ag fanacht ar do choinne.

translation.en: This means that you stay indoors and avoid contact with other people.
translation.ga: Ciallaíonn sé seo go bhfanfaidh tú laistigh agus go seachnóidh tú teagmháil le daoine eile.

translation.en: The people in your household should restrict their movements.
translation.ga: Ba cheart go gcuirfeadh na daoine i do theaghlach srian ar a ngluaiseachtaí.

translation.en: You can read more about restricted movement and selfisolation.
translation.ga: Is féidir leat tuilleadh eolais a fháil inár ndoiciméad ar an difríocht idir gluaiseacht shrianta agus féinaonrú.

translation.en: Getting tested
translation.ga: Tástáil a fháil

translation.en: The test for COVID19 is simple and usually takes about 15 minutes.
translation.ga: Tá an tástáil le haghaidh COVID19 simplí agus de ghnáth tógann sé 15 nóiméad.

translation.en: If you are medically unable to attend a test centre, you may be tested at home.
translation.ga: Mura féidir leat freastal ar ionad tástála, féadtar tástáil a dhéanamh ort sa bhaile.

translation.en: If you cannot drive yourself to a test centre, you can ask a family member or friend to drive you.
translation.ga: Mura féidir leat tú féin a thiomáint chuig an ionad tástála, féadfaidh tú iarraidh ar dhuine ó do theaghlach tú a thabhairt.

translation.en: When you arrive at the test centre, a healthcare worker will:
translation.ga: Nuair a shroicheann tú ionad tástála, déanfaidh oibrí cúram sláinte:

translation.en: Confirm your identity and contact details
translation.ga: d’aitheantas agus sonraí teagmhála a dheimhniú

translation.en: Give you a face mask to wear
translation.ga: masc aghaidhe a thabhairt duit

translation.en: Explain what will happen next
translation.ga: cad a tharlóidh ina dhiaidh sin a mhíniú

translation.en: If you are at a drivethru test centre, you will be asked to stay in your car.
translation.ga: Má tá tú ag ionad tástála carrsheirbhíse, iarrfar ort fanacht i do charr.

translation.en: A healthcare worker will come to the vehicle and do the test through the window.
translation.ga: Tiocfaidh oibrí cúram sláinte chuig an bhfeithicil agus déanfaidh sé an tástáil tríd an bhfuinneog.

translation.en: The test
translation.ga: An tástáil

translation.en: You will be asked to blow your nose into a tissue.
translation.ga: Iarrfar ort do shrón a shéideadh i gciarsúr.

translation.en: This can be thrown into a bin bag provided.
translation.ga: Is féidir é seo a chaitheamh isteach sa mhála bruscair a chuirfear ar fáil.

translation.en: The healthcare worker will then use a swab (similar to a long cotton bud) to take a sample from the back of your throat and nose.
translation.ga: Ansin úsáidfidh an toibrí cúram sláinte maipín (cosúil le baitín fada cadáis) chun sampla a thógáil ó chúl do scornach agus do shrón.

translation.en: You may feel some discomfort during the swabbing, but it is not painful.
translation.ga: B’fhéidir go mbraitheann tú míchompord éigin lena linn, ach níl sé pianmhar.

translation.en: The healthcare worker will send your sample to a lab where it will be tested for COVID19.
translation.ga: Ansin seolfaidh an toibrí cúram sláinte do shampla chuig saotharlann, áit a ndéanfar tástáil air le haghaidh COVID19.

translation.en: Waiting for your results
translation.ga: Ag fanacht ar do thorthaí

translation.en: You should continue to selfisolate while you are waiting for your results.
translation.ga: Ba chóir duit leanúint ar aghaidh ag féinaonrú agus tú ag fanacht ar do thorthaí.

translation.en: If you were tested because you are a close contact and do not have symptoms, you should continue to restrict your movements.
translation.ga: Má rinneadh tástáil ort toisc gur dlúththeagmháil tú agus nach bhfuil comharthaí ort, ba cheart duit leanúint le do ghluaiseachtaí a shrianadh.

translation.en: You should also make a list of everyone you had close contact with during the 48 hour period before you developed symptoms.
translation.ga: Ba cheart duit liosta a dhéanamh freisin de gach duine a raibh dlúththeagmháil agat leis/léi le linn na tréimhse 48 uair an chloig sular léirigh tú na comharthaí.

translation.en: If your results are positive, a ‘contact tracing team’ will ask you for their names and contact details.
translation.ga: Má tá do thorthaí dearfach, iarrfaidh ‘foireann rianaithe teagmhála’ ort a nainmneacha agus a sonraí teagmhála a sholáthar.

translation.en: Test results
translation.ga: Torthaí tástála

translation.en: Your test results will be sent to you by text message.
translation.ga: Seolfar do thorthaí chugat trí théacs nó féadfaidh tú glao gutháin a fháil.

translation.en: The Health Service Executive (HSE) website explains what your test results mean.
translation.ga: Míníonn láithreán Gréasáin Fheidhmeannacht na Seirbhíse Sláinte (FSS) cad a chiallaíonn torthaí do thástála.

translation.en: If you had symptoms of COVID19 and do not get a negative test result, you should continue to selfisolate until:
translation.ga: Má bhí comharthaí de COVID19 agat agus mura bhfaigheann tú toradh tástála diúltach, ba cheart duit leanúint ar aghaidh ag féinaonrú go dtí:

translation.en: You have had no fever for 5 days and
translation.ga: Nach mbeidh aon fhiabhras ort ar feadh 5 lá agus

translation.en: It has been 10 days since you first developed symptoms (or 14 days if you are in longterm residential care or you recently left hospital after treatment for COVID19)
translation.ga: Tá 10 lá caite ó léirigh tú comharthaí den chéad uair

translation.en: If you had symptoms of COVID19 and you get a negative test result, you should continue to self isolate until you have not had any symptoms for 48 hours.
translation.ga: Má bhí comharthaí de COVID19 agat agus má fhaigheann tú toradh tástála diúltach, ba cheart duit leanúint ar aghaidh ag féinleithlisiú go dtí nach mbeidh aon comharthaí ort le 48 uair an chloig.

translation.en: You will be tested again 7 days after your last contact with the confirmed case.
translation.ga: Déanfar tástáil ort arís 7 lá tar éis do theagmhála deireanaí leis an gcás dearbhaithe.

translation.en: If you had to restrict your movements because you recently came to Ireland, you should continue to do so for 14 days, even if you receive a negative COVID19 test result.
translation.ga: Má bhí ort srian a chur ar do ghluaiseachtaí toisc gur tháinig tú go hÉirinn le déanaí, ba cheart duit leanúint ar aghaidh ag déanamh amhlaidh ar feadh 14 lá, fiú má fhaigheann tú toradh tástála diúltach COVID19.

translation.en: You can read more about Returning to Ireland and COVID19 and what to do if you are travelling to Ireland.
translation.ga: Féadfaidh tú níos mó a léamh faoi Filleadh ar Éirinn agus COVID19 agus cad atá le déanamh má tá tú ag taisteal go hÉirinn.

translation.en: If the test results are for a child, you can read about results of a COVID19 test for a child under the age of 13.
translation.ga: Má dhéantar tástáil ar leanbh, is féidir leat foghlaim faoi thorthaí tástála COVID19 do leanbh faoi bhun 13 bliana d’aois.

translation.en: Face coverings during COVID19
translation.ga: Clúdaigh aghaidhe le linn COVID19

translation.en: Wearing a face covering is recommended to help stop the spread of COVID19.
translation.ga: Moltar duit clúdach aghaidhe a chaitheamh chun stop a chur le scaipeadh COVID19.

translation.en: In some situations, wearing a face covering is mandatory, and you could be fined or imprisoned if you refuse to wear one without a reasonable excuse.
translation.ga: I roinnt cásanna, tá sé éigeantach clúdach aghaidhe a chaitheamh, agus d’fhéadfaí fíneáil nó príosúnacht a ghearradh ort má dhiúltaíonn tú ceann a chaitheamh gan leithscéal réasúnach.

translation.en: You are also strongly recommended to wear a face covering in situations where social distancing is difficult, for example, when visiting people who are cocooning.
translation.ga: Moltar go láidir duit clúdach aghaidhe a chaitheamh i gcásanna ina mbíonn sé deacair fadú sóisialta a dhéanamh, mar shampla, agus tú ag tabhairt cuairte ar dhaoine atá ag cócúnú.

translation.en: This document explains the law on face coverings and gives advice on how to use one safely.
translation.ga: Míníonn an doiciméad seo an dlí maidir le clúdaigh aghaidhe agus tugann sé comhairle maidir le conas ceann a úsáid go sábháilte.

translation.en: When must I wear a face covering?
translation.ga: Cathain a chaithfidh mé clúdach aghaidhe a chaitheamh?

translation.en: Public transport
translation.ga: Iompar poiblí

translation.en: You must wear a face covering while using public transport.
translation.ga: Caithfidh tú clúdach aghaidhe a chaitheamh agus tú ag úsáid iompar poiblí.

translation.en: If you have a reasonable excuse to not wear a face covering, you should tell the driver or inspector.
translation.ga: Má tá leithscéal réasúnach agat gan clúdach aghaidhe a chaitheamh, ba chóir duit é sin a rá leis an tiománaí nó leis an gcigire.

translation.en: Read ‘Exceptions’ below for information on reasonable excuses.
translation.ga: Léigh ‘Eisceachtaí’ thíos chun faisnéis a fháil faoi leithscéalta réasúnta.

translation.en: Drivers of a public transport vehicle do not have to wear a face covering if they are:
translation.ga: Ní gá do thiománaithe feithicil iompair phoiblí clúdach aghaidhe a chaitheamh má tá siad:

translation.en: Alone in a compartment
translation.ga: Ina naonar i gcábán

translation.en: Separated from passengers by a screen
translation.ga: Scartha ó phaisinéirí le scáileán

translation.en: In the vehicle but there are no passengers getting on or off
translation.ga: San fheithicil ach gan aon phaisinéirí ag teacht ar bord ná ag tuirlingt

translation.en: Shops and other retail settings
translation.ga: Siopaí agus suíomhanna miondíola eile

translation.en: Face coverings are mandatory for customers in:
translation.ga: Tá clúdaigh aghaidhe éigeantach do chustaiméirí i:

translation.en: Shops, including pharmacies
translation.ga: Siopaí, lena náirítear cógaslanna

translation.en: Shopping centres
translation.ga: Ionaid siopadóireachta

translation.en: Libraries
translation.ga: Leabharlanna

translation.en: Cinemas and cinema complexes
translation.ga: Pictiúrlanna agus Ollphictiúrlanna

translation.en: Theatres
translation.ga: Amharclanna

translation.en: Concert halls
translation.ga: Hallaí ceolchoirme

translation.en: Bingo halls
translation.ga: Hallaí biongó

translation.en: Museums
translation.ga: Músaeim

translation.en: Nail salons
translation.ga: Sciamhlanna ingne

translation.en: Hair salons and barbers
translation.ga: Sciamhlanna gruaige agus bearbóirí

translation.en: Tattoo and piercing parlours
translation.ga: Parlúis tatú agus phollta

translation.en: Travel agents and tour operators
translation.ga: Gníomhairí taistil agus tionscnóirí turas

translation.en: Laundries and dry cleaners
translation.ga: Neachtlanna agus titimghlantóirí

translation.en: Bookmakers
translation.ga: Geallghlacadóirí

translation.en: It is also mandatory for retail staff to wear a face covering unless there is a partition or they take all reasonable steps to keep a 2metre distance from others.
translation.ga: Tá sé éigeantach freisin d’fhoireann mhiondíola clúdach aghaidhe a chaitheamh mura bhfuil deighilt ann nó má ghlacann siad gach céim réasúnach chun achar 2 mhéadar a choinneáil ó dhaoine eile.

translation.en: You may be asked to remove your face covering to verify your age or identity to staff.
translation.ga: B’fhéidir go niarrfaí ort do chlúdach aghaidhe a bhaint chun d’aois nó d’aitheantas a fhíorú don fhoireann.

translation.en: Face coverings are not mandatory in:
translation.ga: Níl cumhdaigh aghaidhe éigeantach in:

translation.en: Post offices, credit unions or banks
translation.ga: Oifigí poist, comhair chreidmheasa nó bainc

translation.en: Medical or dental services
translation.ga: Seirbhísí míochaine nó fiaclóireachta

translation.en: Sitin restaurants or cafés
translation.ga: Bialanna nó caiféanna ina suíonn daoine laistigh

translation.en: While it is not mandatory to wear a face covering in restaurants, you should wear one when arriving to and leaving your table.
translation.ga: Cé nach bhfuil sé éigeantach clúdach aghaidhe a chaitheamh i mbialanna, ba chóir duit ceann a chaitheamh agus tú ag teacht agus ag fágáil do bhoird.

translation.en: You may be refused entry if you refuse to wear one.
translation.ga: D’fhéadfaí go ndiúltófaí cead isteach duit má dhiúltaíonn tú ceann a chaitheamh.

translation.en: This is for the safety of staff and customers around you.
translation.ga: Tá sé seo ar mhaithe le sábháilteacht na foirne agus na gcustaiméirí mórthimpeall ort.

translation.en: Fine and penalties
translation.ga: Fíneáileacha agus pionóis

translation.en: Anyone who does not wear a face covering (or anyone who ignores a request to wear one) without a reasonable excuse may get:
translation.ga: Féadfaidh duine ar bith nach gcaitheann clúdach aghaidhe (nó aon duine a dhéanann neamhaird ar iarratas ar cheann a chaitheamh) gan leithscéal réasúnach a fháil:

translation.en: A fine of up to €2,500
translation.ga: Fíneáil suas le €2,500 a fháil

translation.en: Up to 6 months' imprisonment
translation.ga: Suas le 6 mhí príosúnachta a fháil

translation.en: Both a fine and imprisonment
translation.ga: Fíneáil agus príosúnacht araon a fháil

translation.en: Face coverings are not recommended for some people, including children under 13.
translation.ga: Ní mholtar cumhdaigh aghaidhe do dhaoine áirithe, lena náirítear leanaí faoi 13.

translation.en: However, children under 13 may be asked to wear one by a healthcare worker at a doctor’s clinic, hospital or COVID19 testing centre.
translation.ga: Mar sin féin, féadtar go niarrfaidh oibrí cúram sláinte ar dhuine faoi 13 duine ceann a chaitheamh ag clinic dochtúra, ospidéal nó ionad tástála COVID19.

translation.en: Children under 13 should also wear a face covering if they are attending secondary school.
translation.ga: Ba chóir do leanaí faoi 13 bliana d’aois clúdach aghaidhe a chaitheamh má tá siad ag freastal ar mheánscoil.

translation.en: If you have a reasonable excuse to not wear a face covering, you should tell a member of staff.
translation.ga: Má tá leithscéal réasúnach agat gan clúdach aghaidhe a chaitheamh, ba chóir duit é sin a rá le ball foirne.

translation.en: Reasonable excuses include where you:
translation.ga: Cuimsíonn leithscéalta réasúnta cásanna:

translation.en: Cannot wear a face covering because of a physical or mental illness or a disability, or because it would cause you severe distress
translation.ga: Nach féidir le duine clúdach aghaidhe a chaitheamh mar gheall ar thinneas coirp nó meabhrach nó míchumas, nó toisc go gcuirfeadh sé anacair mhór air

translation.en: Need to communicate with someone who has difficulties communicating
translation.ga: Gur gá cumarsáid a dhéanamh le duine a bhfuil deacrachtaí cumarsáide aige

translation.en: Remove a face covering to provide care or assistance to a vulnerable person or to provide emergency assistance to someone
translation.ga: Caithfear clúdach aghaidhe a bhaint chun cúram nó cúnamh a sholáthar do dhuine leochaileach nó chun cúnamh éigeandála a sholáthar do dhuine

translation.en: Remove a face covering to take medication
translation.ga: Caithfear clúdach aghaidhe a bhaint chun cógas a ghlacadh

translation.en: Remove a face covering to avoid harm or injury
translation.ga: Caithfear clúdach aghaidhe a bhaint chun dochar nó gortú a sheachaint

translation.en: Members of the Garda Síochána do not have to wear a face covering when performing their duties.
translation.ga: Ní gá do bhaill an Gharda Síochána clúdach aghaidhe a chaitheamh agus a ndualgais á gcomhlíonadh acu.

translation.en: What type of face mask should I use?
translation.ga: Cén cineál maisc aghaidhe ba chóir dom a úsáid?

translation.en: A face covering (or barrier mask) is not a medical mask, which should be reserved for healthcare professionals.
translation.ga: Ní masc leighis é clúdach aghaidhe (nó masc bacainne), ar chóir iad a chur in áirithe do chúram sláinte.

translation.en: It is material (usually cotton or linen) that you wear across your nose and mouth using elastic or string.
translation.ga: Is ábhar (cadás nó línéadach de ghnáth) a chaitheann tú ar fud do shróine agus do bhéil ag úsáid leaisteacha nó sreangáin.

translation.en: You can buy a face covering or make a face covering.
translation.ga: Is féidir leat clúdach aghaidhe a cheannach nó clúdach aghaidhe a dhéanamh.

translation.en: Face coverings or barrier masks are not personal protective equipment (PPE).
translation.ga: Ní trealamh cosanta pearsanta (TCP) iad cumhdaigh aghaidhe nó maisc bhacainne.

translation.en: They are not intended to protect the wearer against viral infection.
translation.ga: Níl siad beartaithe chun an té atá ag caitheamh a chosaint ar ionfhabhtú víreasach.

translation.en: Instead, they may prevent the spread of COVID19 to others.
translation.ga: In ionad sin, féadfaidh siad cosc a chur ar scaipeadh COVID19 chuig daoine eile.

translation.en: If you are distributing (or buying) face coverings, you should make sure they are produced in line with National Standards Authority of Ireland (NSAI) specifications.
translation.ga: Má tá tú ag dáileadh (nó ag ceannach) cumhdaigh aghaidhe, ba cheart duit a chinntiú go dtáirgtear iad de réir shonraíochtaí Údarás Caighdeán Náisiúnta na hÉireann (NSAI).

translation.en: The specifications include:
translation.ga: Áirítear ar na sonraíochtaí:

translation.en: Clear use of the words ‘barrier mask’
translation.ga: Úsáid shoiléir as na focail ‘masc bacainne’

translation.en: Name and address of the producer
translation.ga: Ainm agus seoladh an táirgeora

translation.en: Any warnings or safety information
translation.ga: Aon rabhaidh nó faisnéis sábháilteachta

translation.en: Instructions for use
translation.ga: Treoracha lena núsáid

translation.en: When you wear a face covering, you should continue to:
translation.ga: Nuair a chaitheann tú clúdach aghaidhe, ba chóir duit leanúint ar aghaidh ag:

translation.en: Wash your hands properly and often
translation.ga: Nigh do lámha i gceart agus go minic

translation.en: Cover your mouth and nose with a tissue when you cough or sneeze
translation.ga: Clúdaigh do bhéal agus do shrón le ciarsúr nuair a bhíonn tú ag casacht nó ag sraothartach

translation.en: Keep at least 2 metres from other people
translation.ga: Coinnigh 2 mhéadar ar a laghad ó dhaoine eile

translation.en: How do I use a face covering?
translation.ga: Conas a chaithim clúdach aghaidh?

translation.en: You should always wash your hands before putting on your face covering (barrier mask).
translation.ga: Ba chóir duit do lámha a ní i gcónaí sula gcuirfidh tú do chlúdach aghaidhe (masc bacainne) ort.

translation.en: Avoid touching it while you are wearing it and if you accidently touch the front, wash your hands straight away.
translation.ga: Seachain teagmháil a dhéanamh leis agus tú á chaitheamh agus má dhéanann tú teagmháil leis an éadan de thaisme, nigh do lámha láithreach.

translation.en: Make sure that the material fully covers your nose and mouth.
translation.ga: Déan cinnte go gclúdaíonn an tábhar do shrón agus do bhéal go hiomlán.

translation.en: You should check that it is tied securely and fits snugly against the side of your face.
translation.ga: Ba cheart duit a sheiceáil go bhfuil sé ceangailte go daingean agus go ndéanann sé dlúththeagmháil le thaobh d’aghaidhe.

translation.en: Keep your spare face coverings in a clean, waterproof bag (such as a ziplock bag).
translation.ga: Coinnigh do chlúdaigh aghaidhe spárála i mála glan uiscedhíonach (cosúil le mála ziplock).

translation.en: You should carry a similar bag for used face coverings.
translation.ga: Ba chóir duit mála den chineál céanna a iompar le haghaidh clúdaigh aghaidhe atá caite.

translation.en: Label these bags clearly so that you do not mix them up.
translation.ga: Lipéadaigh na málaí seo go soiléir ionas nach ndéanann tú iad a mheascadh.

translation.en: If you are a smoker, do not lift up your face covering to smoke.
translation.ga: Má chaitheann tú tobac, ná bain do chlúdach aghaidh chun tobac a chaitheamh.

translation.en: Instead, remove it completely and place it in your ‘used’ ziplock bag.
translation.ga: In ionad sin, bain go hiomlán é agus cuir é i do mhála ziplock ‘caite’.

translation.en: When you are removing your face covering, do so using the strings at the back.
translation.ga: Agus do chlúdach aghaidhe á bhaint agat, déan é sin trí na sreangáin ar chúl a úsáid.

translation.en: Do not touch the front.
translation.ga: Ná déan teagmháil leis an tosaigh.

translation.en: If your face covering is disposable, throw it in a bin immediately after use.
translation.ga: Má tá do chlúdach aghaidh indiúscartha, caith é i mbosca bruscair díreach tar éis é a úsáid.

translation.en: If it is reusable, you should wash it in hot water (60 degrees or hotter) with detergent.
translation.ga: Má tá sé inathúsáidte, ba chóir duit é a nigh in uisce te (60 céim nó níos teo) le glantach.

translation.en: Read more about the guidelines for wearing a face covering correctly.
translation.ga: Léigh tuilleadh faoi na treoirlínte maidir le clúdach aghaidhe a chaitheamh i gceart.

translation.en: Download posters on the correct use of face coverings in English or Irish.
translation.ga: Íoslódáil póstaeir ar úsáid cheart clúdaigh aghaidhe.

translation.en: Services and supports during COVID19
translation.ga: Seirbhísí agus tacaíochtaí le linn COVID19

translation.en: Community Call
translation.ga: Glao Pobail

translation.en: Services from An Post
translation.ga: Seirbhísí ó An Post

translation.en: Minding your mental health
translation.ga: Aire a thabhairt do do Shláinte Mheabhrach

translation.en: Resources for children and teenagers
translation.ga: Acmhainní do Leanaí agus do Dhéagóirí

translation.en: Resources for people with a disability
translation.ga: Acmhainní do dhaoine faoi mhíchumas

translation.en: Domestic abuse and crisis contacts
translation.ga: Drochíde baile agus teagmhálacha géarchéime

translation.en: Resources for exercising at home
translation.ga: Acmhainní le haghaidh aclaíocht a dhéanamh sa bhaile

translation.en: Religious services
translation.ga: Seirbhísí reiligiúnacha

translation.en: This document lists the contact details for services and supports you might need during COVID19.
translation.ga: Liostaíonn an doiciméad seo na sonraí teagmhála le haghaidh seirbhísí agus tacaíochtaí a d’fhéadfadh a bheith ag teastáil uait le linn COVID19.

translation.en: The HSE has published a list of people who should stay home as much as possible and advice for people at very high risk.
translation.ga: D’fhoilsigh FSS liosta de na daoine ar chóir dóibh fanacht sa bhaile a oiread agus is féidir chomh maith le comhairle do dhaoine atá sa chatagóir riosca anard.

translation.en: If you are not sure whether you are at very high risk, you should phone your GP.
translation.ga: Mura bhfuil tú cinnte an bhfuil tú sa chatagóir riosca anard, ba cheart duit glaoch a chur ar do dhochtúir teaghlaigh.

translation.en: Community Call
translation.ga: Glao Pobail

translation.en: The purpose of Community Call is to coordinate local services and make them easy to access for people who need them.
translation.ga: Is é cuspóir an Ghlao Phobail seirbhísí áitiúla a chomhordú agus go mbeidh furasta rochtain a fháil orthu do dhaoine a bhfuil gá acu leo.

translation.en: Local authorities have set up local Community Response Forums in each local authority area.
translation.ga: Bhunaigh údaráis áitiúla Fóraim Freagartha Pobail áitiúla i ngach ceantar údaráis áitiúil.

translation.en: You can get the contact details for the forum in your area in the list below.
translation.ga: Is féidir leat na sonraí teagmhála don fhóram i do cheantar a fháil ar an liosta thíos.

translation.en: Or you can call 0818 222 024 8am to 8pm, Monday to Sunday.
translation.ga: Nó is féidir leat glaoch a chur ar 0818 222 024 8rn go 8in, Luan go Domhnach.

translation.en: This number is being managed by the charity Alone which provides support for older or vulnerable people.
translation.ga: Tá an uimhir seo á bhainistiú ag an gcarthanas Alone a sholáthraíonn tacaíocht do dhaoine scothaosta nó leochaileacha

translation.en: What kind of help is available?
translation.ga: Cén cineál cabhrach atá ar fáil?

translation.en: Call the national number, or your local authority’s community response number if you need help with:
translation.ga: Glaoigh ar an uimhir náisiúnta, nó uimhir freagartha pobail d’údaráis áitiúil má theastaíonn cúnamh uait maidir le:

translation.en: Shopping for food, fuel and other essential household items
translation.ga: Siopadóireacht le haghaidh bia, breosla agus earraí riachtanacha tí eile

translation.en: Transport to medical appointments
translation.ga: Iompar chuig coinní míochaine

translation.en: Delivery of hot meals through local meals on wheels services
translation.ga: Béilí te a sheachadadh trí sheirbhísí áitiúla béilí ar rothaí

translation.en: Collection of prescribed medicines
translation.ga: Cógais ordaithe a bhailiú

translation.en: If you are not sure who you should call for your particular needs, the national helpline and the numbers listed below will be able to advise you.
translation.ga: Mura bhfuil tú cinnte cé air ar cheart duit glaoch a chur maidir do riachtanais áirithe féin, beidh an líne chabhrach náisiúnta agus na huimhreacha atá liostaithe thíos in ann comhairle a chur ort.

translation.en: Services from An Post
translation.ga: Seirbhísí ó An Post

translation.en: An Post is providing extra services for older and more vulnerable people.
translation.ga: Tá Post ag cur seirbhísí breise ar fáil do dhaoine scothaosta agus do dhaoine leochaileacha.

translation.en: You can register with An Post to have a postman or postwoman call to your house during their delivery route.
translation.ga: Féadfaidh tú clárú leis An Post chun go rachaidh fear no bean an phoist chuig do theach le linn a mbealach seachadta.

translation.en: The postal worker can contact the Alone helpline on your behalf if you need help to access local services.
translation.ga: Féadfaidh an toibrí poist teagmháil a dhéanamh le líne chabhrach Alone thar do cheann má theastaíonn cúnamh uait chun rochtain a fháil ar sheirbhísí áitiúla.

translation.en: You have to register for this service.
translation.ga: Caithfidh tú clárú don tseirbhís seo.

translation.en: If you have post that you want delivered, you can put a sign in your window that says I HAVE MAIL, and the postman or postwoman will collect it and send it for you free of charge.
translation.ga: Má tá post agat a theastaíonn uait é a bheith sheachadta, is féidir leat comhartha a chur i d’fhuinneog agus TÁ POST AGAM air, agus baileoidh fear nó bean an phoist é agus seolfaidh sé/sí saor in aisce é ar do shon.

translation.en: An Post also has a newspaper delivery service.
translation.ga: Tá seirbhís seachadta nuachtán ag An Post freisin.

translation.en: You can get your daily newspaper delivered for no extra charge.
translation.ga: Féadfaidh tú do nuachtán laethúil a bheith sheachadta gan aon táille bhreise.

translation.en: You can register for this service on the An Post website.
translation.ga: Féadfaidh tú clárú don tseirbhís seo ar láithreán gréasáin An Post.

translation.en: You can send cards and letters for free to and from Nursing and Care homes in Ireland through An Post until 31 May 2021.
translation.ga: Féadfaidh tú cártaí agus litreacha a sheoladh saor in aisce tríd An Post chuig thithe Altranais agus Cúraim in Éirinn agus uathu go dtí an 31 Bealtaine 2021.

translation.en: Minding your mental health
translation.ga: Aire a thabhairt do do Shláinte Mheabhrach

translation.en: This is a challenging time, and feelings of stress, anxiety and worry are normal.
translation.ga: Is tréimhse dhúshlánach é seo, agus is gnáthmhothúcháin iad strus, imní agus buairt.

translation.en: Your mental health is just as important as your physical health, and it is important you look after it during this time.
translation.ga: Tá do mheabhairshláinte chomh tábhachtach céanna le do shláinte choirp, agus tá sé tábhachtach go dtabharfá aire di le linn na tréimhse seo.

translation.en: If you need to talk to someone urgently, you can call Samaritans at any time for free on 116 123.
translation.ga: Más gá duit labhairt le duine go práinneach, is féidir leat glaoch ar na Samáraigh ag am ar bith saor in aisce ar 116 123.

translation.en: While you may not be able to see a counsellor face to face, you can access many mental health services online, over the phone and by text.
translation.ga: Cé go mb’fhéidir nach mbeidh tú in ann comhairleoir a fheiceáil duine le duine, is féidir leat rochtain a fháil ar go leor seirbhísí meabhairshláinte ar líne, ar an bhfón agus trí théacs.

translation.en: Pieta House
translation.ga: Teach Pieta

translation.en: If you are suicidal or engaging in selfharm:
translation.ga: Má tá tú i riocht tú féin a mharú nó má dhéanann tú féindhíobháil:

translation.en: Freephone 1800 247 247 (any time, day or night)
translation.ga: Saorfhón 1800 247 247 (am ar bith, lá nó oíche)

translation.en: Text HELP to 51444 (standard rates apply)
translation.ga: Téacsáil HELP go 51444 (baineann rátaí caighdeánacha)

translation.en: If you need support with your own mood or the mood of a friend or family member:
translation.ga: Má theastaíonn tacaíocht uait le do ghiúmar féin nó le giúmar carad nó baill teaghlaigh:

translation.en: Freephone 1800 80 48 48 (from 10am to 10pm daily).
translation.ga: Saorfhón 1800 80 48 48 (ó 10rn go 10in gach lá).

translation.en: Email supportmail@aware.ie for a response within 24 hours.
translation.ga: Seol ríomhphost chuig supportmail@aware.ie le haghaidh freagra laistigh de 24 uair an chloig

translation.en: You can chat with a crisis volunteer:
translation.ga: Is féidir leat comhrá a dhéanamh le hoibrí deonach géarchéime:

translation.en: Supports people with mental health difficulties and their families:
translation.ga: Tacaíochtaí do daoine a bhfuil deacrachtaí meabhairshláinte acu agus dá dteaghlaigh:

translation.en: Call 01 541 3715 or email phil@shineonline.ie.
translation.ga: Glao ar 01 541 3715 nó seol ríomhphost chuig phil@shineonline.ie

translation.en: The HSE has a full list of online, phone and text mental health services.
translation.ga: Tá liosta iomlán de sheirbhísí meabhairshláinte ar líne, teileafóin agus téacs ag an FSS.

translation.en: The Parents Centre provides a range of resources and advice on how to look after your children’s mental and emotional wellbeing during the pandemic.
translation.ga: Soláthraíonn Ionad na dTuismitheoirí raon acmhainní agus comhairle maidir le conas aire a thabhairt do fholláine mheabhrach agus mhothúchánach do leanaí le linn na paindéime.

translation.en: The Department of Education's National Educational Psychological Service (NEPS) has also published advice on how to talk to children and young people about COVID19 (pdf).
translation.ga: D’fhoilsigh Seirbhís Náisiúnta Síceolaíochta Oideachais (NEPS) na Roinne Oideachais comhairle freisin ar conas labhairt le leanaí agus daoine óga faoi COVID19 (pdf).

translation.en: Guidance and advice on supporting your child’s mental health and wellbeing is also available from the HSE’s Child and Adolescent Mental Health Services (CAMHS).
translation.ga: Tá treoir agus comhairle maidir le tacú le meabhairshláinte agus folláine do linbh ar fáil freisin ó Seirbhísí Meabhairshláinte do Leanaí agus d'Ógánaigh FSS (CAMHS).

translation.en: UNICEF has also issued advice on how to protect your family’s mental health during COVID19.
translation.ga: D'eisigh UNICEF comhairle freisin ar conas meabhairshláinte do theaghlaigh a chosaint le linn COVID19.

translation.en: Bereavement
translation.ga: Méala

translation.en: The Irish Childhood Bereavement Network, in partnership with the Irish Hospice Foundation, has developed specific resources to help parents support a grieving child or young person in these exceptional times.
translation.ga: D'fhorbair Líonra na hÉireann um Méala an Óige, i gcomhpháirtíocht le Fondúireacht Ospíse na hÉireann, acmhainní sonracha chun cabhrú le tuismitheoirí tacú le leanbh nó duine óg atá faoi bhrón le linn na namanna eisceachtúla seo.

translation.en: The Irish Hospice Foundation operates the Bereavement Support Line on 1800 807 077 from 10am – 1pm, Monday to Friday.
translation.ga: Feidhmíonn Fondúireacht Ospíse na hÉireann an Líne Tacaíochta Méala ar 1800 807 077 ó 10rn 1in, Luan go hAoine.

translation.en: The freephone service is for anyone who wants to talk about their experience or to ask questions relating to the death of someone during the COVID19 pandemic, or a previous bereavement.
translation.ga: Tá an tseirbhís saorfhóin ann do dhuine ar bith atá ag iarraidh labhairt faoina dtaithí nó ceisteanna a chur maidir le bás duine le linn na paindéime COVID19, nó maidir le méala roimhe seo.

translation.en: Barnardos, Ireland children's charity, also provide a children's bereavement service on 01 473 2110, 10am – 12pm, Monday to Thursday.
translation.ga: Cuireann Barnardos, carthanas leanaí na hÉireann, seirbhís méala do leanaí ar fáil freisin ar 01 473 2110, 10rn 12in, Luan go Déardaoin.

translation.en: Barnardos is providing telephone support for parents in response to the challenges posed by COVID19 on 1800 910 123, 10am – 2pm, Monday to Friday.
translation.ga: Tá tacaíocht teileafóin curtha ar fail do thuismitheoirí ag Barnardos mar fhreagairt ar dhúshláin COVID19 ar 1800 910 123, 10rn – 2on, Luan go hAoine.

translation.en: Parentline is a free, national, confidential helpline that offers parents support, information and guidance on all aspects of being a parent and any parenting issues.
translation.ga: Líne chabhrach rúnda, náisiúnta, saor in aisce is ea Parentline a thugann tacaíocht, faisnéis agus treoir do thuismitheoirí ar gach gné de thuismitheoireacht agus ar aon shaincheist tuismitheoireachta.

translation.en: Call 1890 927 277, 10am – 9pm, Monday to Thursday, and 10am – 4pm on Friday.
translation.ga: Glaoigh ar 1890 927 277, 10rn – 9in, Luan go Déardaoin, agus 10rn – 4in Dé hAoine.

translation.en: National Parents Council (NPC) assists parents in supporting childhood learning.
translation.ga: Cuidíonn Comhairle Náisiúnta na dTuismitheoirí (NPC) le tuismitheoirí tacú le foghlaim óige.

translation.en: The NPC operates a helpline on 01 887 4477 or email helpline@npc.ie.
translation.ga: Feidhmíonn an NPC líne chabhrach ar 01 887 4477 nó seol ríomhphost chuig helpline@npc.ie.

translation.en: One Family provides parenting support and mediation support online and over the phone for people parenting alone.
translation.ga: Soláthraíonn One Family tacaíocht tuismitheoireachta agus tacaíocht idirghabhála ar líne agus ar an bhfón do dhaoine atá ag tuismitheoireacht ina naonar.

translation.en: Call 1890 662 212, 10am – 1pm and 2pm – 3.30pm, Monday to Friday.
translation.ga: Glaoigh ar 1890 662 212, 10am 1pm agus 2pm 3.30pm, Luan go hAoine.

translation.en: It has also published a suite of COVID19 resources for parents.
translation.ga: D'fhoilsigh sé sraith acmhainní COVID19 do thuismitheoirí freisin.

translation.en: Treoir provides information and support services for unmarried parents.
translation.ga: Soláthraíonn Treoir seirbhísí faisnéise agus tacaíochta do thuismitheoirí neamhphósta.

translation.en: It operates a confidential helpline on 01 670 0120, 10am – 4pm, Monday to Friday or email info@treoir.ie.
translation.ga: Feidhmíonn sé líne chabhrach rúnda ar 01 670 0120, 10rn – 4in, Luan go hAoine nó seol ríomhphost chuig info@treoir.ie.

translation.en: It also offers a callback service.
translation.ga: Cuireann sé seirbhís aisghlaoigh ar fáil freisin.

translation.en: Aware provides support services to people living with depression, anxiety, bipolar disorder, and anyone concerned about a loved one.
translation.ga: Soláthraíonn Aware seirbhísí tacaíochta do dhaoine atá ag maireachtáil le dúlagar, imní, neamhord dépholach, agus d’aon duine atá buartha faoi dhuine muinteartha.

translation.en: It operates its helpline 10am – 10pm, Monday to Sunday on 1800 80 48 48 or email supportmail@aware.ie.
translation.ga: Feidhmíonn sé a líne chabhrach 10rn – 10in, Luan go Domhnach ar 1800 80 48 48 nó seol ríomhphost chuig supportmail@aware.ie.

translation.en: Shine supports people with mental health difficulties.
translation.ga: Tacaíonn Shine le daoine a bhfuil deacrachtaí meabhairshláinte acu.

translation.en: Information and support is available from phil@shineonline.ie.
translation.ga: Tá faisnéis agus tacaíocht ar fáil ó phil@shineonline.ie.

translation.en: General parenting advice is also available from:
translation.ga: Tá comhairle ghinearálta tuismitheoireachta ar fáil freisin ó:

translation.en: Resources for children and teenagers
translation.ga: Acmhainní do Leanaí agus do Dhéagóirí

translation.en: The Ombudsman for Children’s Office has put together information on COVID19 for children.
translation.ga: Tá faisnéis faoi COVID19 do leanaí curtha le chéile ag Oifig an Ombudsman do leanaí.

translation.en: UNICEF has published 6 strategies for teens facing a new (temporary) normal.
translation.ga: D’fhoilsigh UNICEF 6 straitéis do dhéagóirí chun déileáil le gnáthshaol nua (sealadach).

translation.en: The HSE has issued detailed guidance for young people on how to look after your mental health during the pandemic.
translation.ga: Tá miontreoir eisithe ag FSS do dhaoine óga maidir le conas aire a thabhairt do do mheabhairshláinte le linn na paindéime.

translation.en: Additionally, there are a range of support services available to children and young people throughout the country:
translation.ga: Ina theannta sin, tá réimse seirbhísí tacaíochta ar fáil do leanaí agus do dhaoine óga ar fud na tíre:

translation.en: Childline (ISPCC) provides a 24hour national listening service for young people up to the age of 18 on 1800 666 666.
translation.ga: Cuireann Childline (ISPCC) seirbhís éisteachta náisiúnta 24 uair an chloig do dhaoine óga suas go 18 mbliana d’aois ar 1800 666 666.

translation.en: Alternatively, you can text 50101 or chat online from 10am – 4pm every day.
translation.ga: Nó is féidir leat téacsáil chuig 50101 nó comhrá a dhéanamh ar líne ó 10rn – 4in gach lá.

translation.en: Teenline (ISPCC) is a 24hour national active listening service for children and young people up to the age of 18 on 1800 833 634.
translation.ga: Is seirbhís náisiúnta éisteachta gníomhaí 24 uair an chloig do leanaí agus do dhaoine óga suas go 18 mbliana d’aois é Teenline (ISPCC) ar 1800 833 634.

translation.en: Jigsaw offers mental health support and advice to children and young people aged 12 to 25, and parents or concerned adults.
translation.ga: Cuireann Jigsaw tacaíocht agus comhairle mheabhairshláinte ar fáil do leanaí agus do dhaoine óga idir 12 agus 25 bliana d’aois, agus do thuismitheoirí nó do dhaoine fásta atá buartha.

translation.en: Spunout.ie provides information and support for young people on many different topics including mental health.
translation.ga: Soláthraíonn Spunout.ie faisnéis agus tacaíocht do dhaoine óga ar go leor ábhar éagsúil lena náirítear meabhairshláinte.

translation.en: EPIC offers an Advocacy Phone Support Service for children in care and care leavers on Tuesdays and Thursdays, 2pm – 4pm on 01 963 1272.
translation.ga: Cuireann EPIC Seirbhís Tacaíochta Abhcóideachta ar an bhFón ar fáil do leanaí atá faoi chúram agus atá ag fágáil cúraim Dé Máirt agus Déardaoin, 2in – 4in ar 01 963 1272.

translation.en: You can also request a callback from an Advocacy Officer by texting 087 903 6598 or submit an online Advocacy Referral form.
translation.ga: Féadfaidh tú glaoch ar ais a lorg ó Oifigeach Abhcóideachta freisin trí théacsáil 087 903 6598 nó trí fhoirm Atreoraithe Abhcóideachta ar líne a chur isteach.

translation.en: Resources for people with a disability
translation.ga: Acmhainní do dhaoine faoi mhíchumas

translation.en: The Disability Federation of Ireland (DFI) has developed a ‘COVID19 and Disability’ information hub.
translation.ga: D’fhorbair Cónaidhm na hÉireann um Míchumas (DFI) mol faisnéise ‘COVID19 agus Míchumas’.

translation.en: People in need of additional guidance or support should contact the DFI at info@disabilityfederation.ie.
translation.ga: Ba chóir do dhaoine a dteastaíonn treoir nó tacaíocht bhreise uathu teagmháil a dhéanamh leis an DFI ag info@disabilityfederation.ie

translation.en: AsIAm, the national autism charity and advocacy organisation, has compiled a range of online resources to help people with autism and their families cope with the massive changes caused by COVID19.
translation.ga: Tá raon acmhainní ar líne curtha le chéile ag AsIAm, an carthanas náisiúnta eagraíocht abhcóideachta uathachais, chun cabhrú le daoine a bhfuil uathachas orthu agus lena dteaghlaigh déileáil leis na hathruithe ollmhóra de bharr COVID19.

translation.en: Inclusion Ireland has published easy to read information to support people with intellectual disabilities and their families during COVID19.
translation.ga: D’fhoilsigh Ionchuimsiú Éireann faisnéis atá furasta le léamh chun tacú le daoine faoi mhíchumas intleachtúil agus lena dteaghlaigh le linn COVID19.

translation.en: The HSE has issued detailed guidance on supporting someone with a disability during COVID19.
translation.ga: Tá miontreoir eisithe ag FSS maidir le tacú le duine faoi mhíchumas le linn COVID19.

translation.en: Support services
translation.ga: Seirbhísí tacaíochta

translation.en: People with a disability who require additional support during COVID19 can also contact:
translation.ga: Is féidir le daoine faoi mhíchumas a dteastaíonn tacaíocht bhreise uathu le linn COVID19 teagmháil a dhéanamh freisin le:

translation.en: ALONE’s support line for older and vulnerable people, Monday to Friday, 8am – 8pm, on 0818 222 024
translation.ga: Líne tacaíochta ALONE do dhaoine scothaosta agus leochaileacha, Luan go hAoine, 8rn – 8in, ar 0818 222 024

translation.en: Their local authority helpline
translation.ga: Líne chabhrach a núdaráis áitiúil

translation.en: Domestic abuse and crisis contacts
translation.ga: Drochíde baile agus teagmhálacha géarchéime

translation.en: Domestic abuse is violence or another form of abuse by a person against another person that they are, or were, in an intimate relationship with.
translation.ga: Is éard is drochíde baile ann ná foréigean nó cineál eile míúsáide ag duine i gcoinne duine eile a bhfuil, nó a raibh siad, i ndlúthchaidreamh leis/léi.

translation.en: The abuse may be physical, sexual, psychological, emotional or financial.
translation.ga: Féadfaidh an mhíúsáid a bheith fisiceach, gnéasach, síceolaíoch, mothúchánach nó airgeadúil.

translation.en: Domestic abuse can affect women, men, children and other family members.
translation.ga: Is féidir le drochíde baile chur is teach ar mhná, fir, leanaí agus baill eile den teaghlach.

translation.en: If you feel in immediate danger, call 112 or 999 as soon as it is safe to do so.
translation.ga: Má bhraitheann tú go bhfuil tú i mbaol láithreach, glaoigh ar 112 nó 999 a luaithe agus atá sé sábháilte é a dhéanamh.

translation.en: The Gardaí are specially trained to deal with these situations.
translation.ga: Tá oiliúint speisialta ar na Gardaí chun déileáil leis na cásanna seo.

translation.en: Domestic abuse applications will continue to be given priority in the court system if a protection or interim barring order is needed.
translation.ga: Leanfar ag tabhairt tosaíochta d’iarratais maidir le drochíde baile sa chóras cúirte má theastaíonn ordú cosanta nó ordú urchoisc eatramhach.

translation.en: Many organisations have extended and adapted their services during the pandemic due to increased demand for support.
translation.ga: Rinne a lán eagraíochtaí a gcuid seirbhísí a leathnú agus a oiriúnú le linn na paindéime mar gheall ar éileamh méadaithe ar thacaíocht.

translation.en: You can access a full list of domestic abuse support services.
translation.ga: Féadfaidh tú rochtain a fháil ar liosta iomlán de sheirbhísí tacaíochta um dhrochíde baile.

translation.en: The Department of Justice and Equality's 'Still Here' campaign also offers a range of valuable guidance and advice for people suffering domestic abuse during the public health emergency, including information on how to make a safety plan to escape an abusive situation.
translation.ga: Cuireann feachtas ‘Still Here’ na Roinne Dlí agus Cirt agus Comhionannais raon treorach agus comhairle luachmhar ar fáil freisin do dhaoine atá ag fulaingt drochíde baile le linn na héigeandála sláinte poiblí, lena náirítear faisnéis faoi conas plean sábháilteachta a dhéanamh chun éalú ó chás drochídeach.

translation.en: You can read more in our document about Family law and COVID19.
translation.ga: Féadfaidh tú tuilleadh a léamh inár ndoiciméad faoi dhlí an teaghlaigh agus COVID19.

translation.en: If you are concerned about elder abuse, you can call the HSE helpline on 1850 24 1850, 8am – 8pm, Monday to Saturday.
translation.ga: Má tá imní ort maidir le míúsáid daoine scothaosta, is féidir leat glaoch ar líne chabhrach FSS ar 1850 24 1850, 8rn 8in, Luan go Satharn.

translation.en: For further information visit the HSE’s website on elder abuse or Safeguarding Ireland.
translation.ga: Le haghaidh tuilleadh faisnéise tabhair cuairt ar láithreán gréasáin FSS ar mhíúsáid daoine scothaosta nó ar Safeguarding Ireland.

translation.en: If you feel in immediate danger, contact the Gardaí.
translation.ga: Má bhraitheann tú i mbaol láithreach, déan teagmháil leis na Gardaí.

translation.en: Resources for exercising at home
translation.ga: Acmhainní le haghaidh aclaíocht a dhéanamh sa bhaile

translation.en: If you would like to do some exercise at home, there are many resources to help.
translation.ga: Más mian leat roinnt aclaíochta a dhéanamh sa bhaile, tá go leor acmhainní ann le cuidiú leat.

translation.en: Age & Opportunity broadcasts a series of 15minute seated exercise sessions for older adults online.
translation.ga: Craolann Age & Opportunity sraith seisiún aclaíochta suite 15 nóiméad ar líne do dhaoine aosta.

translation.en: You can watch the exercise sessions live on Facebook at 11am on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays.
translation.ga: Is féidir leat féachaint ar na seisiúin aclaíochta beo ar Facebook ag 11am Dé Luain, Dé Céadaoin agus Dé hAoine.

translation.en: You can also watch previous sessions on YouTube.
translation.ga: Is féidir leat féachaint ar sheisiúin roimhe seo ar YouTube.

translation.en: Cara Centre has also put together a series of 10minute circuits that can be done at home or in your garden.
translation.ga: Tá sraith ciorcad 10 nóiméad curtha le chéile ag Cara Center ar féidir iad a dhéanamh sa bhaile nó i do ghairdín.

translation.en: The series includes adapted exercises for wheelchair users or people with reduced mobility.
translation.ga: Cuimsíonn an tsraith cleachtaí oiriúnaithe d’úsáideoirí cathaoireacha rothaí nó do dhaoine a bhfuil a soghluaisteacht laghdaithe.

translation.en: You can access these exercises every week.
translation.ga: Is féidir leat rochtain a fháil ar na cleachtaí seo gach seachtain.

translation.en: Triathlon Ireland has shared a selection of at home workout videos too.
translation.ga: Tá roinnt físeán babhta traenála sa bhaile roinnte ag Tríathlan Éireann freisin.

translation.en: The videos include athome strength sessions and nutrition advice.
translation.ga: Cuimsíonn na físeáin seisiúin nirt sa bhaile agus comhairle cothaithe.

translation.en: You can watch the exercise sessions on YouTube.
translation.ga: Is féidir leat breathnú ar na seisiúin aclaíochta ar YouTube.

translation.en: You can find more exercise resources on the Sport Ireland website.
translation.ga: Is féidir leat tuilleadh acmhainní aclaíochta a fháil ar láithreán gréasáin Sport Ireland.

translation.en: Religious services
translation.ga: Seirbhísí reiligiúnacha

translation.en: You can read more about COVID19 restrictions.
translation.ga: Is féidir leat tuilleadh a léamh faoi shrianta COVID19.

translation.en: Christian denominations
translation.ga: Sainchreidimh Chríostaí

translation.en: Evangelical Alliance Ireland has an online church service directory of evangelical and nondenominational Christian churches.
translation.ga: Tá eolaire seirbhíse eaglaise ar líne ag Comhaontas Soiscéalach na hEireann d’eaglaisí Críostaí soiscéalacha agus neamhshainchreidmheacha.

translation.en: If you do not have access to the internet, RTÉ News Now shows mass at 10am every weekday from St Eunan’s and St Columba’s Cathedral, Letterkenny, Co Donegal.
translation.ga: Mura bhfuil rochtain agat ar an idirlíon, craolann RTÉ News Now aifreann ag 10am gach lá i rith na seachtaine ó Ardeaglais Naomh Eunan agus Naomh Columba, Leitir Ceanainn, Co Dhún na nGall.

translation.en: You can watch RTÉ News Now on:
translation.ga: Is féidir leat féachaint ar RTÉ News Now ar:Saorview, cainéal 21

translation.en: Islam
translation.ga: Ioslam

translation.en: The Islamic Cultural Centre of Ireland broadcasts prayers live on its website.
translation.ga: Craolann Ionad Cultúrtha Ioslamach na hÉireann paidreacha beo ar a láithreán gréasáin.

translation.en: You can follow the Islamic Cultural Centre of Ireland on Twitter and Facebook.
translation.ga: Féadfaidh tú Ionad Cultúrtha Ioslamach na hÉireann a leanúint ar Twitter agus Facebook.

translation.en: Judaism
translation.ga: Giúdachas

translation.en: For details of Jewish prayer services during COVID19, you can phone the Jewish Representative Council of Ireland on (01) 546 1096.
translation.ga: Le haghaidh sonraí faoi sheirbhísí urnaí Giúdacha le linn COVID19, is féidir leat glaoch ar Chomhairle Ionadaíoch Ghiúdach na hÉireann ar (01) 546 1096.

translation.en: If you want to volunteer in your local community, you can read Government advice for volunteers.
translation.ga: Más mian leat obair dheonach a dhéanamh i do phobal áitiúil, is féidir leat comhairle an Rialtais d’oibrithe deonacha a léamh.

translation.en: You can also contact your local volunteer service.
translation.ga: Féadfaidh tú teagmháil a dhéanamh le do sheirbhís dheonach áitiúil freisin.

translation.en: You can get the latest updates on COVID19 on gov.ie.
translation.ga: Is féidir leat na nuashonruithe is déanaí ar COVID19 a fháil ar gov.ie.

translation.en: The Government’s ‘In This Together’ campaign provides guidance and information on a range of issues concerning families, with tips on looking after yourself and your family, to advice on staying active and eating healthily.
translation.ga: Tugann feachtas an Rialtais ‘In This Together’ treoir agus faisnéis ar raon saincheisteanna maidir le teaghlaigh, agus leideanna ann maidir le haire a thabhairt duit féin agus do do theaghlach, agus comhairle maidir le fanacht gníomhach agus ag nósanna itheacháin sláintiúla.

translation.en: COVID19 enhanced Illness Benefit
translation.ga: Sochar Breoiteachta feabhsaithe COVID19

translation.en: If a worker is told to self isolate, restrict their movements or diagnosed with COVID19, they can apply for a COVID19 enhanced Illness Benefit payment of €350 per week.
translation.ga: Má dheirtear le h’oibrí go gcaithfidh sé/sí féinaonrú nó má fhaigheann sé/sí diagnóis COVID19, féadfaidh sé/sí iarratas a dhéanamh ar íocaíocht um Shochar Breoiteachta feabhsaithe COVID19 €350 in aghaidh na seachtaine.

translation.en: Both employees and selfemployed people can qualify for the COVID19 enhanced Illness Benefit.
translation.ga: Féadfaidh fostaithe agus daoine féinfhostaithe cáiliú don Sochar Breoiteachta feabhsaithe COVID19.

translation.en: Workers who live in direct provision who have been diagnosed with COVID19, or who have been advised to selfisolate or restrict their movements, can access the COVID19 enhanced Illness Benefit.
translation.ga: An 6 Lúnasa 2020, d’fhógair an Rialtas maidir le hoibrithe a ndearnadh diagnóis COVID19 orthu, nó a tugadh comhairle dóibh iad féin a fhéinaonrú agus a bhfuil cónaí orthu i soláthar díreach, go mbeidh rochtain acu ar an Sochar Breoiteachta feabhsaithe COVID19.

translation.en: If you are ill for another reason or selfisolating because you are medically vulnerable, you should apply for standard Illness Benefit.
translation.ga: Má tá tú tinn ar chúis eile nó má tá tú ag féinaonrú toisc go bhfuil tú leochaileach ó thaobh míochaine, ba cheart duit iarratas a dhéanamh ar an nGnáthshochar Breoiteachta.

translation.en: COVID19 Enhanced Illness Benefit will remain in place until the end of June 2021.
translation.ga: Fanfaidh Sochar Breoiteachta Feabhsaithe COVID19 i bhfeidhm go dtí deireadh mhí an Mheithimh 2021.

translation.en: You can read more about your employment rights during COVID19 restrictions and social welfare payments and COVID19.
translation.ga: Féadfaidh tú tuilleadh a léamh faoi do chearta fostaíochta le linn shrianta COVID19 agus faoi íocaíochtaí leasa shóisialaigh agus COVID19.

translation.en: You can apply for enhanced Illness Benefit, if you:
translation.ga: Féadfaidh tú iarratas a dhéanamh ar Shochar Breoiteachta feabhsaithe, má:

translation.en: Are suspected of having COVID19 and are told by a doctor or the Health Service Executive (HSE) to selfisolate or restrict your movements or
translation.ga: Tá amhras ann go bhfuil COVID19 agat agus cuireann dochtúir nó Feidhmeannacht na Seirbhíse Sláinte (FSS) in iúl dóibh féinleithlisiú nó

translation.en: Are diagnosed with COVID19
translation.ga: Fhaigheann tú diagnóis COVID19

translation.en: To qualify for COVID19 enhanced Illness Benefit, you must:
translation.ga: Chun cáiliú le haghaidh Sochar Breoiteachta feabhsaithe COVID19, ní mór duit:

translation.en: Be aged between 18 and 66
translation.ga: A bheith idir 18 agus 66 bliana d’aois

translation.en: Have a medical certificate called a ‘Certificate of incapacity for work’ from a doctor or have a text or letter notification from the HSE to support your application
translation.ga: Teastas míochaine a bheith agat ar a dtugtar ‘Teastas éagumais chun oibre’ ó dhochtúir nó téacs nó fógra litreach a bheith agat ó FSS chun tacú le d’iarratas

translation.en: Be employed in at least one of the 4 weeks before your medical certification and have a current contract of employment, if you are an employee
translation.ga: A bheith fostaithe nó féinfhostaithe agus ag obair sna 4 seachtaine roimh dháta do dheimhnithe leighis

translation.en: Have worked immediately before your medical certification and will have reckonable income in the current contribution year, if you are selfemployed
translation.ga: Conradh fostaíochta reatha a bheith agat, más fostaí thú

translation.en: To get the payment, you must have a medical certificate called a ‘Certificate of incapacity for work’ from your own doctor or have a letter or text notification from the HSE telling you that you have been identified as having contact with someone who has COVID19.
translation.ga: Chun an íocaíocht a fháil, caithfidh teastas leighis a bheith agat ar a dtugtar ‘Teastas éagumais chun oibre’ ó do dhochtúir féin nó litir nó fógra téacs a bheith agat ó FSS ag cur in iúl duit gur aithníodh tú mar dhuine a bhí i dteagmháil le duine a bhfuil COVID 19 air/uirthi.

translation.en: If you are diagnosed with COVID19 or if you are medically required to selfisolate, there are no waiting days for payment of enhanced Illness Benefit.
translation.ga: Má fhaigheann tú diagnóis COVID19 nó má éilíonn dochtúir féinaonrú, níl aon laethanta feithimh ann chun Sochar Breoiteachta feabhsaithe a íoc.

translation.en: COVID19 enhanced Illness Benefit is a temporary measure during the public health emergency.
translation.ga: Beart sealadach is ea Sochar Breoiteachta feabhsaithe COVID19 le linn na héigeandála sláinte poiblí.

translation.en: How long can I get COVID19 enhanced Illness Benefit for?
translation.ga: Cé chomh fada is féidir liom Sochar Breoiteachta feabhsaithe COVID19 a fháil?

translation.en: Enhanced Illness Benefit can cover a COVID19 diagnosis (or selfisolation following contract tracing) up to a certain number of weeks.
translation.ga: Féadann Sochar Breoiteachta Feabhsaithe diagnóis COVID19 (nó féinaonrú tar éis rianú teagmhála) a chlúdach suas le líon áirithe seachtainí.

translation.en: If you need to self isolate because you may have COVID19, it is paid for a maximum of 2 weeks.
translation.ga: Más gá duit féinaonrú toisc go bhféadfadh COVID19 a bheith agat, íoctar é ar feadh coicíse ar a mhéad.

translation.en: This can be extended for another 2 weeks, if you are told to selfisolate again following contact tracing by the HSE.
translation.ga: Is féidir síneadh a chur air seo ar feadh coicíse eile, má iarrtar ort féinaonrú arís tar éis do FSS rianú teagmhála a dhéanamh.

translation.en: However, you will need to apply for this second period of selfisolation on a separate claim form and have medical certification for this second period of selfisolation.
translation.ga: Mar sin féin, beidh ort iarratas a dhéanamh ar an dara tréimhse féinaonraithe ar fhoirm éilimh ar leithligh agus deimhniú leighis a bheith agat don dara tréimhse féinaonraithe.

translation.en: If you have had 2 successive periods of selfisolation, you must return to work and make a PRSI contribution before you can get enhanced Illness Benefit again.
translation.ga: Má bhí dhá thréimhse féinaonraithe agat i ndiaidh a chéile, caithfidh tú filleadh ar an obair agus ranníocaíocht PRSI a dhéanamh sular féidir leat Sochar Breoiteachta feabhsaithe a fháil arís.

translation.en: If you are diagnosed with COVID19, it is paid for a maximum of 10 weeks.
translation.ga: Má fhaigheann tú diagnóis COVID19, íoctar é ar feadh 10 seachtaine ar a mhéad.

translation.en: If your medical certificate is for fewer than 10 weeks, you will be paid for the duration of your medical certificate.
translation.ga: Má tá do dheimhniú leighis níos lú ná 10 seachtaine, íocfar tú ar feadh ré do dheimhnithe leighis.

translation.en: You should continue to talk with your doctor about your diagnosis and the length of time you are medically certified unfit to work because of COVID19.
translation.ga: Ba chóir duit leanúint ag caint le do dhochtúir faoi do dhiagnóis agus faoin tréimhse ama a ndeimhnítear go bhfuil tú neamhábalta de réir míochaine don obair mar gheall ar COVID19.

translation.en: Who cannot get COVID19 enhanced Illness Benefit?
translation.ga: Cé nach féidir leis/léi Sochar Breoiteachta feabhsaithe COVID19 a fháil?

translation.en: You do not get COVID19 enhanced Illness Benefit if:
translation.ga: Ní bhfaigheann tú Sochar Breoiteachta feabhsaithe COVID19:

translation.en: You are cocooning because you are medically vulnerable to COVID19, however, you can apply for standard Illness Benefit which can be paid for longer than COVID19 enhanced Illness Benefit or
translation.ga: Má tá tú ag cócúnú toisc go bhfuil tú i mbaol COVID19 ó thaobh míochaine de, féadfaidh tú iarratas a dhéanamh áfach, ar ghnáthshochar Breoiteachta ar féidir é a fháil ar feadh níos faide ná Sochar Breoiteachta feabhsaithe COVID19 nó

translation.en: You are selfisolating because you live with a person who is medically vulnerable to COVID19
translation.ga: Má tá tú ag féinaonrú toisc go bhfuil tú i do chónaí le duine atá i mbaol COVID19 de réir míochaine

translation.en: Other social welfare payments and COVID19 enhanced Illness Benefit
translation.ga: Íocaíochtaí leasa shóisialaigh eile agus Sochar Breoiteachta feabhsaithe COVID19

translation.en: You cannot get COVID19 enhanced Illness Benefit and COVID19 Pandemic Unemployment Payment at the same time.
translation.ga: Ní féidir leat Sochar Breoiteachta feabhsaithe COVID19 agus Íocaíocht Dífhostaíochta Phaindéimeach COVID19 a fháil ag an am céanna.

translation.en: If your income is a mixture of both earnings from employment and a social welfare payment and you are required to selfisolate or you are diagnosed with COVID19, you continue to get your social welfare payment.
translation.ga: Más meascán d’thuilleamh ó fhostaíocht agus ó íocaíocht leasa shóisialaigh d’ioncam agus má iarrtar ort féinaonrú nó má fhaigheann tú diagnóis COVID19, leanann tú le d’íocaíocht leasa shóisialaigh a fháil.

translation.en: If your social welfare payment is less than the rate of COVID19 enhanced Illness Benefit, you can apply for a top up payment from the Illness Benefit section see 'Apply online' below.
translation.ga: Má tá d’íocaíocht leasa shóisialaigh níos lú ná ráta an tSochair Breoiteachta fheabhsaithe COVID19, féadfaidh tú iarratas a dhéanamh ar íocaíocht breisithe ón rannán an tSochair Bhreoiteachta féach ‘Déan iarratas ar líne’ thíos.

translation.en: You must meet the criteria for COVID19 enhanced Illness Benefit to qualify.
translation.ga: Caithfidh tú na critéir a chomhlíonadh chun go gcáileoidh tú do Shochar Breoiteachta feabhsaithe COVID19.

translation.en: This top up payment will not affect any other social welfare payments that you may be getting from the DSP.
translation.ga: Ní bheidh aon tionchar ag an íocaíocht bhreise seo ar aon íocaíochtaí leasa shóisialaigh eile a d’fhéadfá a bheith á fáil ón DSP.

translation.en: Rate of COVID19 enhanced Illness Benefit
translation.ga: Ráta an tSochair Breoiteachta fheabhsaithe COVID19

translation.en: The personal rate of enhanced Illness Benefit is €350 per week.
translation.ga: Is é an ráta pearsanta den Sochar Breoiteachta feabhsaithe ná €350 in aghaidh na seachtaine.

translation.en: If you are married, in a civil partnership or cohabiting, you may get an increase in your payment for your spouse or partner.
translation.ga: Má tá tú pósta, i gcomhpháirtíocht shibhialta nó i ag comhchónaí le duine eile, d'fhéadfá méadú ar d’íocaíocht do do chéile nó do pháirtí a fháil.

translation.en: You may also get an increase in your payment for dependent children.
translation.ga: D’fhéadfá méadú a fháil ar d’íocaíocht do leanaí cleithiúnacha freisin.

translation.en: Apply online
translation.ga: Déan iarratas ar líne

translation.en: The DSP needs your application for Illness Benefit and your medical certificate to process your application.
translation.ga: Teastaíonn d’iarratas ar Sochar Breoiteachta agus do dheimhniú leighis ón DSP chun d’iarratas a phróiseáil.

translation.en: You should apply online for enhanced Illness Benefit.
translation.ga: Ba cheart duit iarratas a dhéanamh ar líne ar Shochar Breoiteachta feabhsaithe.

translation.en: This is the quickest and easiest way to apply.
translation.ga: Is é seo an bealach is tapa agus is éasca le hiarratas a dhéanamh.

translation.en: All you need to apply online is a basic MyGovID account.
translation.ga: Níl le déanamh agat ach cuntas bunúsach MyGovID a bheith agat..

translation.en: Medical certification
translation.ga: Deimhniú leighis

translation.en: Your doctor can complete a medical certificate on your behalf and send this directly to DSP.
translation.ga: Féadfaidh do dhochtúir deimhniú leighis a chomhlánú ar do shon agus é seo a sheoladh go díreach chuig DSP.

translation.en: If you have been identified during contact tracing as someone who has been in contact with a person with COVID19, you will get a text or a letter from the HSE with an instruction to you to selfisolate.
translation.ga: Má aithníodh tú le linn rianú teagmhála mar dhuine a bhí i dteagmháil le duine le COVID19, gheobhaidh tú téacs nó litir ó FSS ina dtugtar treoir duit féinaonrú a dhéanamh.

translation.en: You can email an image of this HSE document or text the image along with your name and PPS number to illnessenquiry@welfare.ie.
translation.ga: Is féidir leat íomhá den doiciméad FSS seo a sheoladh ar ríomhphost nó trí théacs in éineacht le d’ainm agus d’uimhir PSP chuig sickenquiry@welfare.ie.

translation.en: Illness Benefit contact centre
translation.ga: Ionad teagmhála um Shochar Breoiteachta

translation.en: COVID19 business supports
translation.ga: Tacaíochtaí gnó COVID19

translation.en: Financial supports
translation.ga: Tacaíochtaí airgeadais

translation.en: Loans, grants and vouchers
translation.ga: Iasachtaí, deontais agus dearbháin

translation.en: Rates waiver and tax measures
translation.ga: Tarscaoileadh rátaí agus bearta cánach

translation.en: Training and mentoring
translation.ga: Oiliúint agus meantóireacht

translation.en: A number of supports are available for business owners to help you during the COVID19 pandemic.
translation.ga: Tá roinnt tacaíochtaí ar fáil d’úinéirí gnó chun cabhrú leat le linn na paindéime COVID19.

translation.en: On this page we summarise the financial support schemes and other supports to help if your business is unable to operate, you have reduced revenue or you need financial support to help your business operate safely during COVID19.
translation.ga: Ar an leathanach seo déanaimid achoimre ar na scéimeanna tacaíochta airgeadais agus tacaíochtaí eile atá ar fáil mar chabhair mura bhfuil do ghnó in ann feidhmiú, nó más rud é go bhfuil ioncam laghdaithe agat nó má theastaíonn tacaíocht airgeadais uait chun cabhrú le do ghnó feidhmiú go slán le linn COVID19.

translation.en: You can also get advice from your accountant or use the advisory support from your Local Enterprise Office (LEO).
translation.ga: Féadfaidh tú comhairle a fháil freisin ó do chuntasóir nó an tacaíocht chomhairleach a úsáid atá ar fáil i d’ Oifig Fiontair Áitiúil (OFÁ) .

translation.en: Check if your insurance policy covers you for an interruption of your business, or a temporary business closure, caused by COVID19.
translation.ga: Seiceáil má chlúdaíonn do pholasaí árachais tú as cur isteach ar do ghnó, nó dúnadh sealadach gnó, de bharr COVID19.

translation.en: The Government supports and guidance continue to develop as the COVID19 situation changes.
translation.ga: Leantar le forbairt a dhéanamh ar thacaíochtaí agus treoir an Rialtais de réir mar a athraíonn staid COVID19.

translation.en: You can get up to date information from the Department of Enterprise, Trade and Employment.
translation.ga: Féadfaidh tú faisnéis cothrom le dáta a fháil ón Roinn Fiontar, Trádála agus Fostaíochta .

translation.en: Financial supports
translation.ga: Tacaíochtaí airgeadais

translation.en: The following financial supports are available to businesses and employees affected by the COVID19 pandemic.
translation.ga: Tá na tacaíochtaí airgeadais seo a leanas ar fáil do ghnóthaí agus d’fhostaithe a dtéann paindéim COVID19 i bhfeidhm orthu.

translation.en: Employment Wage Subsidy Scheme
translation.ga: Scéim Fóirdheontais Pá Fostaíochta

translation.en: Under the Employment Wage Subsidy Scheme (EWSS), you can get a flatrate subsidy per employee, if your turnover has fallen by 30%.
translation.ga: Faoin Scéim Fóirdheontais Pá Fostaíochta (EWSS) , féadfaidh tú fóirdheontas ar ráta comhréidh a fháil in aghaidh an fhostaí, má tháinig laghdú de 30% ar do láimhdeachas.

translation.en: COVID Restrictions Support Scheme
translation.ga: Scéim Tacaíochta Shriantaí COVID

translation.en: The COVID Restrictions Support Scheme (CRSS) gives qualifying businesses a cash payment of up to €5,000 a week.
translation.ga: Leis an Scéim Tacaíochta Shriantaí COVID (CRSS) tugtar íocaíocht airgid suas le €5,000 sa tseachtain do ghnóthaí cáilitheacha.

translation.en: The scheme applies when Level 3 or higher restrictions are in place in line with the Plan for Living with COVID19.
translation.ga: Bíonn feidhm ag an scéim nuair a bhíonn srianta Leibhéal 3 nó níos airde i bhfeidhm de réir an Phlean maidir le Maireachtáil le COVID19.

translation.en: You can apply to Revenue if your business premises are either closed to customers or substantially restricted in operating due to COVID19 restrictions.
translation.ga: Féadfaidh tú iarratas a dhéanamh ar na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim má tá d’áitreabh gnó dúnta do chustaiméirí nó má tá srian mór air feidhmiú mar gheall ar shrianta COVID19.

translation.en: Loans, grants and vouchers
translation.ga: Iasachtaí, deontais agus dearbháin

translation.en: A range of other supports for businesses affected by COVID19 are available.
translation.ga: Tá raon tacaíochtaí eile ar fáil do ghnóthaí a bhfuil tionchar ag na srianta COVID19 orthu.

translation.en: COVID19 Credit Guarantee Scheme
translation.ga: Scéim Ráthaíochta Creidmheasa COVID19

translation.en: The COVID19 Credit Guarantee Scheme provides loans from €10,000 and €1 million for terms up to five and a half years.
translation.ga: Cuireann an Scéim Ráthaíochta Creidmheasa COVID19 iasachtaí idir €10,000 agus €1 milliún ar feadh téarmaí suas le cúig bliana go leith.

translation.en: The size of the loan is linked to business turnover (25% of 2019 turnover) or wage costs (double annual wage bill in 2019).
translation.ga: Tá méid na hiasachta nasctha le láimhdeachas gnó (25% de láimhdeachas 2019) nó costais pá (bille pá bliantúil in 2019 faoi dhó).

translation.en: The Scheme is operated by the Strategic Banking Corporation of Ireland (SBCI) through participating lenders.
translation.ga: Is í Corparáid Baincéireachta Straitéiseach na hÉireann (SBCI) a oibríonn an Scéim trí bhíthin iasachtóirí rannpháirteacha.

translation.en: COVID19 Business Aid Scheme
translation.ga: Scéim Cúnaimh Ghnó COVID19
