translation.en: Revenue will engage with any viable business that experiences temporary cashflow difficulties, including difficulties arising from exceptional circumstances such as the COVID19 (Coronavirus) outbreak.” Revenue
translation.ga: Rachaidh na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim i gcaidreamh le haon ghnólacht inmharthana a mbíonn deacrachtaí sealadacha acu le sreabhadh airgid, lena náirítear deacrachtaí ag éirí as cúinsí eisceachtúla amhail an ráig COVID19 (Coróinvíreas).” Na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim.

translation.en: It is vitally important that businesses affected by the pandemic and unable to pay tax liabilities as they fall due, continue to file their tax returns on time so that they may take advantage of these forbearance measures.
translation.ga: Tá sé ríthábhachtach, maidir le gnólachtaí atá thíos leis an bpaindéim agus nach bhfuil ábalta dliteanais chánach a íoc de réir mar a bhíonn siad dlite, go leanfaidh siad dá dtuairisceáin chánach a chur isteach in am sa chaoi is go mbeidh siad ábalta leas a bhaint as na bearta foighne sin.

translation.en: Revenue has also posted advice for businesses experiencing trading difficulties as a result of COVID 19.
translation.ga: Tá comhairle foilsithe ag na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim freisin do ghnólachtaí a bhfuil deacrachtaí trádála acu mar thoradh ar COVID19.

translation.en: This includes information on tax returns, the application of late payment interest, debt enforcement, tax clearance and customs.
translation.ga: Airítear leis seo eolas maidir le tuairisceáin chánach, cur i bhfeidhm úis ar íocaíochtaí déanacha, forfheidhmiú fiach, imréiteach cánach agus custaim.

translation.en: For more information, visit Revenue’s COVID19 information and advice for taxpayers and agents and Revenue measures to assist SMEs experiencing cashflow difficulties as a result of COVID19
translation.ga: Le haghaidh tuilleadh eolais, tabhair cuairt ar Eolas agus comhairle ó na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim i dtaca le COVID19 d’íocóirí cánach agus gníomhairí agusbearta de chuid na gCoimisinéirí Ioncaim chun cuidiú le FBManna a bhfuil deacrachtaí acu le sreabhadh airgid mar thoradh ar COVID19

translation.en: The Employment Wage Subsidy Scheme (EWSS), provides a flatrate subsidy to qualifying employers based on the numbers of eligible employees on the employer’s payroll.
translation.ga: Leis an Sceim Fóirdheontais Pá Fostaíochta (EWSS) tugtar fóirdheontas bonnráta d’fhostóirí incháilithe bunaithe ar líon na bhfostaithe incháilithe ar phárolla an fhostóra.

translation.en: The EWSS, operated by Revenue, has replaced the Temporary Wage Subsidy Scheme and is expected to run until 30 June 2021.
translation.ga: Tháinig an EWSS, á riar ag na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim, san ionad ar an Scéim Fóirdheontais Pá Sealadaigh agus meastar go mbeidh sé ag feidhmiú go dtí an 30 Mheitheamh 2021.

translation.en: COVID Restrictions Support Scheme (CRSS)
translation.ga: Scéim Tacaíochta Srianta COVID (CRSS)

translation.en: The COVID Restrictions Support Scheme (CRSS) offers support to businesses forced to close or trade at significantly reduced levels as a result of restrictions imposed on them in response to COVID19.
translation.ga: Sa Scéim Tacaíochta Srianta COVID (CRSS) cuirtear tacaíocht ar fáil do ghnólachtaí a raibh orthu dúnadh nó trádáil ar leibhéil a bhí laghdaithe go suntasach mar thoradh ar shrianta a chuireadh orthu mar fhreagra ar COVID19.

translation.en: Eligible businesses can make a claim to Revenue for a payment known as an Advance Credit for Trading Expenses (ACTE).
translation.ga: Is féidir le gnólachtaí incháilithe éileamh a dhéanamh leis na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim ar íocaíocht ar a dtugtar Réamhchreidiúint as Speansais Trádála (ACTE).

translation.en: An ACTE is payable for each week a business is affected by the restrictions.
translation.ga: Tá ACTE iníoctha as gach seachtain a mbíonn gnólacht thíos leis na srianta.

translation.en: The ACTE is equal to 10% of the average weekly turnover of the business in 2019 up to €20,000, plus 5% on turnover over €20,000.
translation.ga: Tá an ACTE cothrom le 10% de mheánláimhdeachas seachtainiúil an ghnólachta in 2019 suas le €20,000, móide 5% ar láimhdeachas os cionn €20,000.

translation.en: In the case of new businesses, the turnover is based on the average actual weekly turnover in 2020.
translation.ga: I gcás gnólachtaí nua, tá an láimhdeachas bunaithe ar an bhfíor mheánláimhdeachas seachtainiúil in 2020.

translation.en: The ACTE is subject to a maximum weekly payment of €5,000.
translation.ga: Tá an ACTE faoi réir ag íocaíocht sheachtainiúil uasta €5,000.

translation.en: Revenue ‘Warehousing’ of COVID19 related tax debt for businesses
translation.ga: ‘Trádstóráil’ de chuid na gCoimisinéirí Ioncaim d’fhiachas cánach a bhaineann le COVID19 do ghnólachtaí

translation.en: Businesses that have had to close or have been significantly impacted by the restrictions will not be able to enter into arrangements to clear the COVIDrelated tax debt, pay their normal trade and other nonRevenue creditors, make any necessary restructuring to deal with the new trading arrangements in the context of social distancing, build up their stock, etc.
translation.ga: Maidir le gnólachtaí a raibh orthu dúnadh nó a ndeachaigh na srianta i gcion go mór go suntasach orthu, ní bheidh siad ábalta socruithe a dhéanamh chun na fiacha cánach a bhaineann le COVID a ghlanadh, a ngnáthchreidiúnaithe trádála agus creidiúnaithe eile nach iad na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim a íoc, aon athstruchtúrú riachtanach a dhéanamh chun déileáil leis na socruithe trádála nua i gcomhthéacs scaradh sóisialta, a stoc a thógáil suas, etc.

translation.en: In that context, Revenue will Warehouse Deferred Tax Liabilities associated with the COVID19 crisis.
translation.ga: Sa chomhthéacs sin, déanfaidh na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim Trádstóráil ar Dhliteanais Chánach Iarchurtha a bhaineann leis an ngéarchéim COVID19.

translation.en: This will represent a direct support for affected businesses where a commitment to a phased payment arrangement is not possible.
translation.ga: Is ionann é seo agus tacaíocht dhíreach do ghnólachtaí a mbaineann sé leo nuair nach bhfuil gealltanas de shocrúchán d’íocaíocht chéimneach indéanta.

translation.en: Arrangements will be put in place to allow debt that cannot be paid during the COVIDrelated period, to be warehoused interestfree for a year from recommencement of trading, during which time there will be no debt enforcement action taken by Revenue in respect of the debt.
translation.ga: Cuirfear socruithe ar bun ionas gur féidir fiachas nach féidir a aisíoc le linn na tréimhse a bhaineann le COVID a thrádstóráil saor ó ús ar feadh bliana ón atosú trádála, agus le linn an am sin ní dhéanfaidh na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim gníomh i dtaca leis an bhfiachas.

translation.en: Prior to the expiry of the warehousing period, the business will be expected to engage with Revenue to reach an agreement on an exit strategy more suited to the specific business needs and the need for continued viability.
translation.ga: Sula rachaidh an tréimhse trádstórála in éag, beifear ag súil leis go rachaidh an ghnólacht i gcaidreamh leis na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim chun teacht ar chomhaontú ar straitéis éalaithe atá níos mó in oiriúint do na riachtanais ghnó shainiúla agus don riachtanas d’inmharthanacht leanúnach.

translation.en: The scheme will apply to businesses in all sectors of the economy who have been negatively impacted by COVID19.
translation.ga: Beidh an scéim i bhfeidhm do na gnólachtaí uile i ngach earnáil den gheilleagar a raibh droch thionchar ag COVID19 orthu.

translation.en: For further details please visit Revenue: Warehousing of VAT and PAYE (Employer) Debts
translation.ga: Le haghaidh tuilleadh sonraí, tabhair cuairt ar Na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim: Trádstóráil do ghnólachtaí ar fhiachas chánach a bhaineann le COVID19.

translation.en: Reduction of VAT Rates
translation.ga: Laghdú sna Rátaí CBL

translation.en: VAT rate reduction from 13.5% to 9%
translation.ga: Laghdú ráta CBL ó 13.5% go 9%

translation.en: A VAT rate reduction from 13.5% to 9% applies from 1 November 2020 in recognition of the unprecedented challenges facing the hospitality and tourism sector.
translation.ga: Tá laghdú sa ráta CBL ó 13.5% go 9% i bhfeidhm ón 1 Samhain 2020 mar aitheantas ar na dúshláin gan fasach atá roimh an earnáil fáilteachais agus turasóireachta

translation.en: For more information, please visit Revenue: Reduction in the standard rate of VAT
translation.ga: Le haghaidh tuilleadh eolais, tabhair cuairt ar Na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim: Laghdú sa ráta caighdeánach CBL

translation.en: Supports from the Department of Social Protection
translation.ga: Tacaí ón Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí

translation.en: COVID19 Pandemic Unemployment Payment
translation.ga: Íocaíocht Dífhostaíochta Phaindéimeach COVID19

translation.en: The Pandemic Unemployment Payment is available to all employees and the selfemployed who have lost their job due to the COVID19 pandemic.
translation.ga: Tá an Íocaíocht Dífhostaíochta Phaindéimeach ar fáil do fhostaithe agus lucht féinfhostaithe go léir a chaill a bpost mar thoradh ar an bpaindéim COVID19.

translation.en: Enterprise Support Grant
translation.ga: Deontas Tacaíochta Fiontar

translation.en: The Enterprise Support Grant for businesses impacted by COVID19 is available for eligible self employed people who close their COVID19 Pandemic Unemployment Payment on or 18 May 2020.
translation.ga: Tá an Deontas Tacaíochta Fiontar do ghnólachtaí a ndeachaigh COVID19 i gcion orthu ar fáil do dhaoine féinfhostaithe incháilithe a dhúnann a nÍocaíocht Dífhostaíochta Phaindéimeach COVID19 ar 18 Bealtaine 2020 nó ina dhiaidh.

translation.en: This will provide business owners with a onceoff grant of up to €1,000 to restart their business which was closed due to the COVID19 pandemic.
translation.ga: Cuirfidh sé seo deontas aonuaire suas le €1,000 d’úinéirí gnólachtaí le cuidiú leo a nglólachta a bhí dúnta mar thoradh ar an bpaindéim COVID

translation.en: ShortTime Work Support
translation.ga: Tacaíocht Oibre GearrAma

translation.en: ShortTime Work Support is a form of Jobseeker's Benefit and is a nontaxable income support payment for people who have been temporarily placed on a shorter working week by their employer.
translation.ga: Is cineál Sochair Cuardaitheora Poist an Tacaíocht Oibre GearrAma agus is íocaíocht tacaíochta ioncaim neamhinchánach atá ann do dhaoine a cuireadh go sealadach ar sheachtain oibre níos giorra ag a bhfostóir.

translation.en: Employees of businesses that need to reduce hours or days worked can avail of the Department Social Protection ShortTime Work Support.
translation.ga: Fostaithe ag gnólachtaí nach mór uaireanta nó laethanta oibre a laghdú, is féidir leo leas a bhaint as an Tacaíocht Oibre GearrAma ón Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí.

translation.en: For more information, please visit the Department of Social Protection
translation.ga: Le haghaidh tuilleadh eolais, tabhair cuairt ar an Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí

translation.en: Business Supports – Loans, Grants, Vouchers, Training & Mentoring
translation.ga: Tacaí Gnó – Iasachtaí, Deontais, Dearbháin, Oiliúint & Meantóireacht

translation.en: New €5m COVID19 Online Retail Scheme
translation.ga: Scéim Miondíola Ar Líne COVID19:

translation.en: The new €5 million COVID19 Online Retail Scheme is open to eligible Irishowned retail enterprises that had 10 or more employees on or before 29 February 2020 (or have grown to this level since then) and have the potential to sustain or create jobs, generate growth in online transactions and with an ambition to internationalise their business in the future.
translation.ga: Tá an scéim nua €5 mhilliún, Scéim Miondíola Ar Líne COVID19 ar oscailt d’fhiontair mhiondíola incháilithe i seilbh Éireannach a raibh 10 bhfostaí nó níos mó acu ar an 29 Feabhra 2020 nó roimhe sin (nó a d’fhás chuig an leibhéal sin ó shin) agus a bhfuil sé de chumas acu poist a choinneáil nó a chruthú, fás a ghiniúint in idirbhearta ar líne agus a bhfuil uaillmhian acu a ngnólacht a chur ar bhonn idirnáisiúnta amach anseo.

translation.en: Successful applicants will receive a grant ranging from €10,000 to a maximum of €40,000 covering up to 80% of project costs.
translation.ga: Gheobhaidh iarrthóirí rathúla sa réimse ó €10,000 go huasmhéid €40,000 – ag clúdach suas le 80% de chostais an tionscadail.

translation.en: €450m Strategic Banking Corporation Ireland (SBCI) COVID19 Working Capital Scheme
translation.ga: Scéim Caipitil Oibre €450m COVID19 Chorparáid Baincéireachta Straitéisí na hÉireann (SBCI)

translation.en: Working capital is a measure of the shortterm liquidity of a business and finances the day to day running of a business.
translation.ga: Tomhas is ea caipiteal oibre ar leachtacht ghearrthéarma gnólachta agus is é a mhaoiníonn rith gnólachta ó lá go lá.

translation.en: This includes cashflow for operational purposes.
translation.ga: Áirítear leis seo sreabhadh airgid do chúiseanna oibríochtúla.

translation.en: Eligibility applications for the COVID19 Working Capital Scheme are accepted through the SBCI website.
translation.ga: Tá iarratais incháilitheachta ar an Scéim Caipitil Oibre COVID19 á nglacadh anois trí shuíomh gréasáin SBCI ag SBCI.

translation.en: Viable and eligible businesses (including sole traders) with up to 499 employees who are exposed to the impacts of COVID19.
translation.ga: Gnólachtaí inmharthana agus incháilithe (lena náirítear trádálaithe aonair) a bhfuil suas le 499 fostaí acu atá nochta do thionchair COVID19.

translation.en: Qualify for the COVID19 Working Capital Scheme
translation.ga: Cáiliú don Scéim Caipitil Oibre COVID19

translation.en: To qualify for eligibility to the scheme, businesses need to meet one criterion related to the impact of COVID19 on their business and one criterion related to innovation.
translation.ga: Le cáiliú don scéim, ní mór do ghnólachtaí critéar amháin a shásamh a bhaineann le tionchar COVID 19 ar a ngnólacht agus critéar amháin a bhaineann le nuálaíocht.

translation.en: The details of the criteria can be found at SBCI.
translation.ga: Is féidir sonraí na gcritéar a fháil ar SBCI.

translation.en: loans from €25,000 up to €1.5 million
translation.ga: iasachtaí ó €25,000 suas le €1.5 milliún

translation.en: loan period of up to 3 years
translation.ga: tréimhse iasacht suas le 3 bliana

translation.en: no security required for loans of up to €500,000
translation.ga: gan aon urrús de dhíth d’iasachtaí suas le €500,000

translation.en: competitively priced loans (maximum interest rate of 4%)
translation.ga: iasachtaí ar phraghas iomaíoch (uasráta úis 4%)

translation.en: you may be able to avail of a 3 month interest only payment period
translation.ga: b’fhéidir go mbeidh tú ábalta leas a bhaint as tréimhse íocaíochta 3 mhí le hús amháin.

translation.en: For more information, see DETE Government Supports for COVID19 and SBCI
translation.ga: Le haghaidh tuilleadh eolais, féach Tacaí Rialtais DETE do COVID19 agus SBCI

translation.en: Additional €500m COVID19 Funding for Future Growth Loan Scheme for SME’s, Farmers and Fishing
translation.ga: Maoiniú Breise COVID19 €500m don Scéim Iasachta d’Fhás sa Todhchaí do FBManna, Feirmeoirí agus Iascaireacht

translation.en: The Strategic Banking Corporation of Ireland (SBCI) administers this Scheme.
translation.ga: Corparáid Baincéireachta Straitéisí na hÉireann (SBCI) a riarann an Scéim seo.

translation.en: Eligibility applications for the Future Growth Loan Scheme are accepted through the SBCI website.
translation.ga: Táthar ag glacadh faoi láthair le hiarratais ar incháilitheacht don Scéim Iasachta d’Fhás sa Todhchaí COVID19 trí shuíomh gréasáin SBCI.

translation.en: This Scheme provides longer term loans to COVID19 impacted businesses.
translation.ga: Cuireann an Scéim seo iasachtaí ar fáil do théarmaí níos faide do ghnólachtaí a ndeachaigh COVID 19 i gcion orthu.

translation.en: Information on the release of lending under this Scheme can be monitored through the SBCI website.
translation.ga: Is féidir monatóireacht a dhéanamh ar eolas maidir le scaoileadh iasachtaí faoin Scéim seo trí shuíomh gréasáin SBCI.

translation.en: loans from €25,000 to a maximum of €3,000,000
translation.ga: iasachtaí ó €25,000 go huasmhéid €3,000,000

translation.en: loan terms ranging from 7 to 10 years
translation.ga: téarmaí iasachta ó 7 mbliana go 10 mbliana

translation.en: no security required for loans of up to €500,000
translation.ga: gan aon urrús de dhíth d’iasachtaí suas le €500,000

translation.en: competitively priced loans (maximum interest rate of 4.5%)
translation.ga: iasachtaí ar phraghas iomaíoch (uasráta úis 4.5%)

translation.en: you may be able to avail of interestonly repayments at the start of the loan
translation.ga: b’fhéidir go mbeidh tú ábalta leas a bhaint as íocaíochtaí le hús amháin ag tús na hiasachta

translation.en: For more information, see DETE Government Supports for COVID19 and SBCI.
translation.ga: Le haghaidh tuilleadh eolais, féach Tacaí Rialtais DETE do COVID19 agus SBCI

translation.en: €2 billion COVID19 Credit Guarantee Scheme
translation.ga: Scéim Ráthaíochta Creidmheasa €2 bhilliún COVID19

translation.en: The COVID19 Credit Guarantee Scheme is provided by the Government of Ireland to facilitate lending to Micro, Small and Mediumsized Enterprises, and Small MidCaps adversely impacted by COVID19.
translation.ga: Cuireann Rialtas na hÉireann an Scéim Ráthaíochta Creidmheasa COVID19 ar fáil chun cuidiú le hiasachtú le Micrithionscadail, Fiontair Bheaga agus Mheánmhéide, agus Comhlachtaí Beaga Meanchaipitlithe a raibh drochthionchar ag COVID19 orthu.

translation.en: This includes Primary Producers – Agriculture/Fishing.
translation.ga: Áirítear leo seo Buntáirgeoirí – Talmhaíocht/Iascaireacht.

translation.en: The COVID19 Credit Guarantee Scheme facilitates the provision of liquidity and working capital to businesses with an initial focus on term and working capital loans.
translation.ga: Cuidíonn an Scéim Ráthaíochta Creidmheasa COVID19 le leachtacht agus caipiteal obre a sholáthar do ghnólachtaí le fócas tosaigh ar iasachtaí téarma agus iasachtaí do chaipiteal oibre.

translation.en: The Scheme enables a borrower impacted by COVID19 to access credit.
translation.ga: Cuireann an Scéim ar chumas iasachtaí a ndeachaigh COVID19 i gcion air teacht ar chreidmheas.

translation.en: The borrower contributes to the cost of the Scheme by paying a guarantee premium on the credit advanced.
translation.ga: Cuidíonn an tiasachtaí le costas na Scéime trí phréimh ráthaíochta a íoc ar an gcreidmheas atá tugtha.

translation.en: This premium is separate from and is in addition to the cost of the credit advanced.
translation.ga: Tá an phréimh seo scartha agus de bhreis ar chostas an chreidmheasa a thugtar.

translation.en: loans from €10,000 up to €1 million are available for SMEs who would not otherwise be able to access bank loans
translation.ga: tá iasachtaí ó €10,000 suas le €1 mhilliún ar fáil do FBManna nach mbeadh iasachtaí bainc a fháil murach sin

translation.en: loan period of between 3 months to 5.5 years
translation.ga: tréimhse iasachta idir 3 mhí agus 5.5 bliana

translation.en: interest rates will be below market rate
translation.ga: beidh na rátaí úis faoi bhun ráta an mhargaidh

translation.en: up to 12 months interest / or capital moratoria are possible
translation.ga: is féidir moratóirí suas le 12 mhí a bheith ann ar ús nó ar chaipiteal

translation.en: Loan Amounts =<€250,000 will be unsecured (unless it is a requirement of the product feature e.g. asset finance, invoice discount facilities).
translation.ga: beidh suimeanna iasachta =<€250,000 neamhurraithe (ach amháin más riachtanas é de ghné an táirge e.g. maoiniú sócmhainní, áiseanna lascaine sonrasc).

translation.en: Microfinance Ireland: COVID19 Business Loan
translation.ga: Microfinance Ireland: Iasacht Ghnó COVID19

translation.en: The COVID19 Business Loan from Microfinance Ireland is a government initiative to support micro enterprises, through the current period of uncertainty, who are or may be impacted by the coronavirus in Ireland.
translation.ga: Tionscnamh rialtais is ea an Iasacht Ghnó COVID19 ó Microfinance Ireland chun tacú le micrithionscadail, tríd an dtréimhse éiginnteachta reatha, atá thíos, nó a d’fhéadfadh a bheith thíos, leis an gcoróinvíreas in Éirinn.

translation.en: Microenterprises (including sole traders, partnerships or limited companies) employing less than 10 full time employees and with a turnover of less than €2 million per annum, who are finding it difficult to access finance through banks and other commercial lenders and experiencing a negative impact on their business from COVID19 that equates to a minimum of 15% of actual or projected turnover or profit in the business.
translation.ga: Microthionscadail (lena náirítear trádálaithe aonair, comhpháirtíochtaí nó cuideachtaí teoranta) a fhostaíonn níos lú ná 10 fostaí lánaimseartha agus le láimhdeachas níos lú ná €2 mhilliún in aghaidh na bliana, a bhfuil sé deacair orthu teacht ar airgeadas trí bhainc agus iasachtóirí tráchtála eile agus a bhfuil tionchar diúltach á fhulaingt acu ar a ngnólacht ó COVID19 is ionann agus 15% ar a laghad d’fhíorláimhdeachas nó de láimhdeachas tuartha nó de bhrabús sa ghnó.

translation.en: business loans between €5,000 and €25,000 for eligible microenterprises
translation.ga: iasachtaí gnó idir €5,000 agus €25,000 do mhicrithionscadail incháilithe

translation.en: loans may be used for working capital and required business changes as a result of COVID19
translation.ga: is féidir iasachtaí a úsáid do chaipiteal oibre agus athruithe gnó riachtanacha mar thoradh ar COVID19

translation.en: loan terms up to 3 years (shorter if appropriate)
translation.ga: téarmaí iasachta suas le 3 bliana (níos giorra más cuí)

translation.en: the terms include a six months interest free and repayment free moratorium, with the loan to then be repaid over the remaining 30 months of the 36month loan period.
translation.ga: áirítear sna téarmaí 6 mhí saor ó ús agus moratóir saor ó aisíocaíochtaí, agus an iasacht le haisíoc ansin thar na 30 mí atá fágtha sa tréimhse iasachta 36 mhí.

translation.en: interest rate of 4.5% if an application is submitted through a Local Enterprise Office.
translation.ga: ráta úis 4.5% ná chuirtear iarratas isteach trí Oifig Fiontair Áitiúil.

translation.en: 5.5% if submitted directly to Microfinance Ireland
translation.ga: 5.5% má chuirtear isteach go díreach é chuig Microfinance Ireland

translation.en: no fees and/or hidden costs with fixed repayments and with no penalty for early repayment
translation.ga: gan táillí agus/nó costais fholaithe le haisíocaíochtaí socraithe agus gan aon phionós ar aisíocaíocht luath

translation.en: For more information, please visit DETE Government Supports for COVID19, and Microfinance Ireland
translation.ga: Le haghaidh tuilleadh eolais, féach Tacaí Rialtais DETE do COVID19 agus Microfinance Ireland

translation.en: €2 billion Pandemic Stabilisation and Recovery Fund (PSRF)
translation.ga: Ciste Cobhsaithe agus Téarnaimh Paindéime €2 bhilliún (PSRF)

translation.en: The Ireland Strategic Investment Fund (ISIF) will make available a €2 billion fund to support medium and large enterprises in Ireland affected by COVID19.
translation.ga: Cuirfidh Ciste Infheistíochta Straitéisí na hÉireann (ISIF) ciste nua de €2 bhilliún ar fáil chun tacú le fiontair mheánacha agus mhóra in Éirinn a ndeachaigh COVID19 i gcion orthu.

translation.en: This fund, to be known as the Pandemic Stabilisation and Recovery Fund (PSRF), will have €2 billion in total capital and will be made available through a subportfolio within ISIF.
translation.ga: Beidh caipiteal iomlán de €2 bhilliún ag an gciste nua, ar a dtabharfar an Ciste Cobhsaithe agus Téarnaimh Paindéime (PSRF), agus cuirfear ar fáil é trí fhophunann laistigh de ISIF.

translation.en: The PSRF will focus on investment in large and medium enterprises employing more than 250 employees or with annual turnover in excess of €50 million.
translation.ga: Díreoidh an PSRF ar infheistíocht i bhfiontair mheánacha agus mhóra a fhostaíonn níos mó ná 250 fostaí nó le láimhdeachas bliantúil de bhreis agus €50 milliún.

translation.en: ISIF may consider investing in enterprises below these levels if they are assessed to be of substantial scale and of significant importance at national or regional level.
translation.ga: Féadfaidh ISIF machnamh a dhéanamh ar infheistíocht i bhfiontair faoi bhun na leibhéal sin má mheastar go bhfuil scála substaintiúil acu agus go bhfuil tábhacht shuntasach acu ar leibhéal náisiúnta nó réigiúnach.

translation.en: the fund will act as an accelerator, investing on a commercial basis in businesses that can meet the investment requirements and can use ISIF investment to return to longterm viability.
translation.ga: feidhmeoidh an ciste mar luasaire, ag infheistiú ar bhonn tráchtála i ngnólachtaí atá ábalta na riachtanais infheistíochta a shásamh agus atá ábalta infheistíocht ISIF a úsáid chun filleadh ar inmharthanacht fhadtéarma.

translation.en: investments can be across the range of instruments from senior debt, hybrid instruments to equity, and can be tailored to take account of the particular circumstances of each investee.
translation.ga: is féidir le hinfheistíochtaí a bheith i raon d’ionstraimí ó fhiachas sinsearach, ionstraimí hibrideacha go cothromas, agus is féidir iad a oiriúnú chun na cúinsí ar leith a bhaineann le gach faighteoir infheistíochta a chur san áireamh.

translation.en: This will enable businesses to access the capital they need in the most appropriate form that best suits their individual needs.
translation.ga: Cuirfidh sé seo ar chumas gnólachtaí rochtain a fháil ar an gcaipiteal atá de dhíth orthu san fhoirm is oiriúnaí dá gcúinsí féin.

translation.en: in making investments, ISIF will seek to maximise the quantum of additional capital that the investee business can access from its existing shareholders and banks, from potential new co investors and from European sources (such as the European Investment Bank), thereby minimising the amount of ISIF capital that may be needed.
translation.ga: agus infheistíochtaí á dhéanamh acu, beidh ISIF ag iarraidh méadú ar mhéid an chaipitil bhreise is féidir leis an ngnó atá ag fáil na hinfheistíochta a fháil óna scarshealbhóirí agus bainc féin, ó chomhinfheisteoirí ionchasacha nua agus ó fhoinsí Eorpacha (amhail an Banc Eorpach Infheistíochta), agus ar an gcaoi sin laghdú ar an líon caipitil ISIF a bheadh ag teastáil.

translation.en: For more information, please visit Pandemic Stabilisation and Recovery Fund
translation.ga: Le haghaidh tuilleadh eolais, tabhair cuairt ar Ciste Cobhsaíochta agus Téarnaimh Paindéime

translation.en: Enterprise Ireland Supports
translation.ga: Tacaí ó Fiontraíocht Éireann

translation.en: €180m Sustaining Enterprise Fund
translation.ga: Ciste Cothabhála Fiontair €180m

translation.en: An EU approved €180 million Sustaining Enterprise Fund in line with EU State Aid rules, has been established to provide financial support to Irish companies affected by the coronavirus outbreak.
translation.ga: Tá Ciste Cothabhála Fiontair €180m, a cheadaigh an AE i gcomhréir le rialacha AE i dtaca le cúnamh stáit, bunaithe chun tacaíocht airgeadais a chur ar fáil do chuideachtaí Éireannacha a ndeachaigh ráig an choróinvíris i gcion orthu.

translation.en: The fund will be administered by Enterprise Ireland as part of a suite of emergency supports to help Irish companies that are seriously and adversely affected by the COVID19 pandemic.
translation.ga: Beidh an ciste á riar ag Fiontraíocht Éireann mar chuid de chnuasach de thacaí éigeandála chun cabhrú le cuideachtaí Éireannacha atá thíos go mór leis an bpaindéim COVID19.

translation.en: This support is available to assist companies with 10 or more employees to access the necessary liquidity and funding to sustain their businesses in the short to medium term.
translation.ga: Beidh an tacaíocht seo ar fáil chun chabhrú le cuideachtaí le 10 bhfostaí nó níos mó rochtain a fháil ar an leachtacht agus maoiniú riachtanach chun a ngnólachtaí a chothabháil sa ghearrthéarma go meántéarma.

translation.en: The Scheme operates as an additional support to the Strategic Banking Corporation of Ireland (SBCI) COVID19 Working Capital Scheme and supports available from banks and other financial providers.
translation.ga: Feidhmeoidh an Scéim mar thaca breise le Scéim Caipitil Oibre COVID19 Chorparáid Baincéireachta Straitéisí na hÉireann (SBCI) agus na tacaí atá ar fáil ó bhainc agus soláthraithe airgeadais eile.

translation.en: The Sustaining Enterprise Fund of up to €180m is open to eligible companies that:
translation.ga: Tá an Ciste Cothabhála Fiontair nua de suas le €180m ar oscailt do chuideachtaí incháilithe a shásaíonn na coinníollacha seo a leanas:

translation.en: employ 10 or more fulltime employees
translation.ga: fostaíonn siad 10 nó níos mó fostaí lánaimseartha

translation.en: are operating in the manufacturing and internationally traded services sectors
translation.ga: tá siad ag feidhmiú in earnálacha na déantúsaíochta agus na seirbhísí a thrádáiltear go hidirnáisiúnta

translation.en: for SMEs have applied for funding from a financial institution, including, where appropriate, through the SBCI COVID19 Working Capital Loan Scheme
translation.ga: maidir le FBManna – tá iarratas déanta acu ar mhaoiniú ó institiúidí airgeadais, lena náirítear, más cuí, trí Scéim Caipitil Oibre COVID19 SBCI

translation.en: for large companies – have completed a formal application process for funding with an appropriate financial institution.
translation.ga: maidir le cuideachtaí móra – tá próiseas iarratais foirmiúil déanta acu do mhaoiniú le hinstitiúid airgeadais cuí.

translation.en: a nonrepayable grant of up to 50% of a funding package (up to €200,000) is available now
translation.ga: tá deontas neamhinaisíoctha suas le 50% de phacáiste maoinithe (suas le €200,000) ar fáil anois

translation.en: funding of between €100,000 and €800,000 available
translation.ga: maoiniú idir €100,000 agus €800,000 ar fáil

translation.en: no repayments for the first 3 years
translation.ga: gan aon aisíocaíochtaí don chéad 3 bliana

translation.en: businesses qualifying under this EU supported scheme will be offered a Repayable Advance of up to €800,000
translation.ga: gnólachtaí a cháilíonn faoin scéim seo atá á thacú ag AE, tairgfear Réamhíocaíocht Inaisíoctha suas le €800,000 dóibh.

translation.en: The Sustaining Enterprise Fund will be used to support the implementation of a Business Sustainment Project Plan which must be provided by the company outlining the eventual stabilisation of the business and a return to viability.
translation.ga: bainfear úsáid as an gCiste Cothabhála Fiontair chun tacú le cur i bhfeidhm Phlean Tionscadail Cothabhála Gnó, nach mór don chuideachta a sholáthar, ina dtabharfar cur síos ar chobhsú an ghnólachta as deireadh thiar thall, agus filleadh ar inmharthanacht.

translation.en: the funding is open to all Enterprise Ireland, IDA and Údarás na Gaeltachta clients and other companies employing 10 or more in the manufacturing and internationally traded services sector.
translation.ga: tá an maoiniú ar oscailt do chliaint uile de chuid Fiontar Éireann, IDA agus Údarás na Gaeltachta agus do chuideachtaí eile a fhostaíonn 10 nó níos mó in earnálacha na déantúsaíochta agus na seirbhísí a thrádáiltear go hidirnáisiúnta.

translation.en: the first port of call for liquidity support will continue to be the SBCI/banks.
translation.ga: is iad SBCI/bainc fós an chéad dream ba chóir dul i dteagmháil leo do thacaíocht leachtachta.

translation.en: The Sustaining Enterprise Fund will be a distinct offer of funding support via a repayable advance which would only be provided where all SBCI/bank options have been fully exhausted.
translation.ga: Beidh an Ciste Cothabhála Fiontair nua seo ina thairiscint ar leith de thacaíocht maoinithe trí réamhíocaíocht inaisíoctha nach gcuirfí ar fáil ach amháin nuair a bheadh na roghanna SBCI/bainc ar fad ídithe.

translation.en: For more information, please visit Enterprise Ireland
translation.ga: Le haghaidh tuilleadh eolais, féach Fiontar Éireann

translation.en: COVID19 Business Financial Planning Grant
translation.ga: Deontas do Phleanáil Airgeadais Gnó COVID19

translation.en: The COVID19 Business Financial Planning Grant, worth up to €5,000, is a support for all Enterprise Ireland clients.
translation.ga: Taca is ea an Deontas do Phleanáil Airgeadais Gnó COVID19, a bhfuil luach suas le €5,000 air, do chliaint uile Fiontar Éireann.

translation.en: It is also targeted at those manufacturing or internationally traded services companies that employ 10 or more fulltime employees.
translation.ga: Tá sé dírithe freisin ar na cuideachtaí déantúsaíochta nó na cuideachtaí seirbhísí a thrádáiltear go hidirnáisiúnta a fhostaíonn 10 bhfostaí lánaimseartha nó níos mó.

translation.en: The grant is designed to help companies to develop a Business Sustainment Project plan.
translation.ga: Tá an deontas ceaptha le cabhrú le cuideachtaí plean Tionscadail Coimeád Gnó a fhorbairt.

translation.en: This is a robust financial plan, including the preparation of documentation required to support applications for external finance from banks and/or other finance providers (including Enterprise Ireland).
translation.ga: Plean docht airgeadais is ea é seo, lena náirítear cáipéisí a ullmhú chun tacú le hiarratais ar mhaoiniú seachtrach ó bhainc agus/nó soláthraithe airgeadais eile (lena náirítear Fiontar Éireann).

translation.en: This grant will enable companies to engage the services of an approved Financial Consultant to develop this plan for use when applying for bank or investor funding and when developing their own mediumterm financial strategy.
translation.ga: Cuirfidh an deontas seo ar chumas cuideachtaí seirbhísí a cheannach ó Chomhairleoir Airgeadais ceadaithe chun an plean seo a fhorbairt le húsáid agus iarratas á dhéanamh ar mhaoiniú ó bhanc nó ó infheisteoir agus nuair atá forbairt á dhéanamh acu ar a straitéis airgeadais mheántéarma féin.

translation.en: Enterprise Ireland will work with these companies on a onetoone basis to support the implementation of the plan.
translation.ga: Oibreoidh Fiontar Éireann leis na cuideachtaí sin ar bhonn aonair chun tacú le cur i bhfeidhm an phlean.

translation.en: 100% funding of up to €5,000 to access an approved financial consultant help the company to understand its immediate financial position, secure the finance it requires to survive and provide a framework to sustain the business
translation.ga: maoiniú 100% suas le €5,000 chun rochtain a fháil ar chomhairleoir airgeadais ceadaithe cabhrú leis an gcuideachta a staid airgeadais láithreach a thuiscint, an tairgeadas atá de dhíth air a fháil le maireachtáil agus creat a sholáthar chun an gnólacht a chothabháil

translation.en: open to all Enterprise Ireland clients and companies employing 10 or more in the manufacturing and internationally traded sector
translation.ga: ar oscailt do chliaint uile Fiontar Éireann agus cuideachtaí a fhostaíonn 10 nó níos mó sna hearnálacha déantúsaíochta agus trádála idirnáisiúnta

translation.en: For more information, see COVID19 Business Financial Planning Grant
translation.ga: Le haghaidh tuilleadh eolais, féach Deontas do Phleanáil Airgeadais Gnó COVID19

translation.en: Enterprise Ireland's eiLearn is an online learning resource where you can access over 400 pieces of customised content designed for Irish SMEs.
translation.ga: Acmhainn foghlama ar líne is ea eiLearn ó Fiontar Éireann ina bhfuil tú ábalta rochtain a fháil ar bhreis agus 400 phíosa d’ábhar saincheaptha atá deartha do FBManna na hÉireann.

translation.en: Local Enterprise Office Support
translation.ga: Tacaíocht ón Oifig Fiontair Áitiúil

translation.en: The Local Enterprise Office network stands ready to assist businesses to address the critical challenges presented by the COVID19 virus pandemic.
translation.ga: Tá líonra na nOifigí Fiontair Áitiúla réidh le cuidiú le gnólachtaí aghaidh a thabhairt ar na dúshláin chriticiúla atá ann mar thoradh ag an bpaindéim COVID19.

translation.en: Businesses which are seeking support to assist with business continuity and preparedness connected to the COVID19 outbreak, may apply for a COVID19 Business Loan subject to certain conditions and criteria.
translation.ga: Gnólachtaí atá ag lorg tacaíochta chun cuidiú le leanúnachas gnó agus le hullmhacht a bhaineann leis an ráig COVID19, is féidir leo iarratas a dhéanamh ar Iasacht Ghnó COVID19 faoi réir ag coinníollacha agus critéir áirithe.

translation.en: This offer is in addition to the current range of business supports for microenterprises.
translation.ga: Déantar an tairiscint seo de bhreis ar an raon reatha de thacaí gnó do mhicreaghnólachtaí.

translation.en: Local Enterprise Offices can offer supports that can help your business respond.
translation.ga: Is féidir le hOifigí Fiontair Áitiúla tacaí a thairiscint a d’fhéadfadh cuidiú le do ghnólacht freagairt.

translation.en: Trading Online Voucher Scheme
translation.ga: Scéim Dearbháin do Thrádáil Ar Líne

translation.en: An initiative under the Government’s National Digital Strategy, the expanded Trading Online Voucher Scheme helps small businesses with up to 10 employees to trade more online, boost their sales and reach new markets.
translation.ga: Tionscnamh faoi Straitéis Náisiúnta Digiteach an Rialtais, tugann an Scéim Dearbháin do Thrádáil Ar Líne, atá leathnaithe, cabhair do ghnólachtaí beaga le suas le 10 bhfostaí níos mó trádála a dhéanamh ar líne, a ndíolacháin a mhéadú agus margaí nua a shroicheadh.

translation.en: There is up to €2,500 available through the Local enterprise Offices, with cofunding of 50% from the business.
translation.ga: Tá suas le €2,500 ar fáil trí na hOifigí Fiontair Áitiúla, le comhmhaoiniú 10% ón ngnólacht.

translation.en: Funding can be used towards adding payment facilities or booking systems to your website or developing new apps for your customers.
translation.ga: Is féidir maoiniú a úsáid chun áiseanna íocaíochta nó córais áirithinte a chur le do shuíomh gréasáin nó aipeanna nua a fhorbairt dod’ chustaiméirí.

translation.en: The voucher can also be used towards subscriptions to low cost online retail platform solutions to help companies quickly establish a retailing presence online.
translation.ga: Is féidir an dearbhán a úsáid freisin do shíntiúis ar réitigh miondíola ar chostas íseal chun cabhrú le cuideachtaí láthair miondíola a bhunú ar líne go tapa.

translation.en: Flexibilities to the Trading Online Voucher scheme are now in place allowing businesses apply for a second voucher where they have successfully utilised their first one.
translation.ga: Tá solúbthachtaí ar bun anois sa scéim Dearbháin do Thrádáil Ar Líne a ligeann do ghnólachtaí iarratas a dhéanamh ar an dara dearbhán má tá úsáid rathúil bainte acu as a gcéad cheann.

translation.en: To qualify for the scheme, businesses must have:
translation.ga: Le bheith incháilithe ar an scéim, ní mór do ghnólachtaí:

translation.en: limited or no ecommerce presence
translation.ga: gan láithreacht ríomhthráchtála nó gan ach láithreacht theoranta ríomhthráchtála acu

translation.en: no more than 10 employees;
translation.ga: gan níos mó ná 10 bhfostaí acu;

translation.en: less than €2m in turnover;
translation.ga: níos lú ná €2m de láimhdeachas acu;

translation.en: be trading for at least 6 months and
translation.ga: a bheith ag trádáil ar feadh 6 mhí ar a laghad agus

translation.en: be located in the region of the local enterprise office to whom they are applying
translation.ga: a bheith lonnaithe i réigiún na hoifige fiontar áitiúla lena bhfuil iarratas á dhéanamh acu

translation.en: For more information, visit your Local Enterprise Office online at LEO
translation.ga: Le haghaidh tuilleadh eolais, tabhair cuairt ar d’Oifig Fiontair Áitiúil ar líne ag LEO

translation.en: COVID19 Business Loan
translation.ga: Iasacht Ghnó COVID19

translation.en: The COVID19 Business Loan from Microfinance Ireland (MFI), in partnership with Local Enterprise Offices, is a Government funded initiative to support small businesses through the current period of uncertainty.
translation.ga: Tionscnamh maoinithe ag an rialtas is ea an Iasacht Ghnó COVID19 ó Microfinance Ireland (MFI), i gcomhpháirtíocht le hOifigí Fiontair Áitiúla, chun tacú le gnólachtaí beaga tríd an tréimhse reatha éiginnteachta.

translation.en: It is designed for microenterprises that are:
translation.ga: Tá sé ceaptha do mhicreaghnólachtaí:

translation.en: having difficulty accessing bank finance and
translation.ga: a bhfuil deacrachtaí acu rochtain a fháil ar airgeadas bainc agus

translation.en: impacted, or may be impacted negatively, by COVID19 resulting in a reduction of 15% or more in turnover or profit
translation.ga: a ndeachaigh COVID19 i gcion orthu, nó a d’fhéadfadh a bheith thíos le COVID19 agus laghdú 15% nó níos mó sa láimhdeachas nó brabús dá bharr

translation.en: Local Enterprise Office Financial Supports
translation.ga: Tacaí Airgeadais ón Oifig Fiontair Áitiúil

translation.en: For existing companies and potential startups that meet eligibility criteria (such as employing 10 or fewer people with the potential for growth and job creation), Local Enterprise Offices can also offer financial supports to help manage current market challenges:
translation.ga: Do chuideachtaí atá ann cheana agus gnólachtaí féideartha nuathionscanta a shásaíonn critéir incháilitheachta (amhail 10 nó níos lú a fhostú leis an gcumas d’fhás agus cruthú jabanna) is féidir le hOifigí Fiontair Áitiúla tacaí airgeadais a thairiscint freisin chun cabhrú le dúshláin reatha sa mhargadh a bhainistiú:

translation.en: Priming Grants
translation.ga: Deontais Prímeála

translation.en: Business Expansion Grants
translation.ga: Deontais do Leathnú Gnó

translation.en: Feasibility Study Grants
translation.ga: Deontais do Staidéir Féidearthachta

translation.en: Technical Assistance for MicroExporters Grant
translation.ga: Cúnamh Teicniúil do Dheontas MicreaOnnmhaireoirí

translation.en: For more information, visit your Local Enterprise Office online at LEO
translation.ga: Le haghaidh tuilleadh eolais, tabhair cuairt ar d’Oifig Fiontair Áitiúil ar líne ag LEO

translation.en: LEAN for Micro is available to LEO clients to help build resilience within small companies.
translation.ga: Tá Lean for Micro ar fáil do chliaint LEO chun cuidiú le hathléimneacht a fhorbairt laistigh de chuideachtaí beaga.

translation.en: Under this programme, clients can avail of consultancy support with a LEAN Expert (a qualified practitioner), who will work with the company to introduce lean principles, undertake a specific cost savings project and assist the company in benchmarking its performance.
translation.ga: Faoin gclár seo, is féidir le cliaint leas a bhaint as tacaíocht comhairleoireachta le Saineolaí LEAN (cleachtóir cáilithe), a oibreoidh leis an gcuideachta chun prionsabail barainneachta a fhorbairt, tionscadal i dtaca le coigiltis ar chostais a dhéanamh agus cuidiú leis an gcuideachta a cuid feidhmíochta a thagarmharcáil.

translation.en: LEAN for Micro can also be used to help implement new remote working and physical distancing guidelines.
translation.ga: Is féidir úsáid a bhaint as LEAN for Micro freisin chun cuidiú le treoirlínte nua a chur i bhfeidhm i dtaca le cianobair agus scaradh sóisialta.

translation.en: For more information, visit your Local Enterprise Office online at LEO
translation.ga: Le haghaidh tuilleadh eolais, tabhair cuairt ar d’Oifig Fiontair Áitiúil ar líne ag LEO

translation.en: A free of charge service under the Local Enterprise Office Mentor Programme, clients work with an experienced mentor to identify solutions to areas of exposure within their business.
translation.ga: Seirbhís atá saor in aisce faoi Chlár Meantóireachta na nOifigí Fiontair Áitiúla, oibríonn cliaint le meantóir le taithí chun réitigh a aimsiú ar réimsí contúirte laistigh dá ngnólacht.

translation.en: With advice and guidance from their mentor, clients develop strategies that are more robust, which address issues and maximise potential opportunities around COVID19 challenges.
translation.ga: Le comhairle agus treoir óna meantóir, forbraíonn cliaint straitéisí atá níos láidre, a théann i ngleic le fadhbanna agus a bhaineann an tairbhe is mó as deiseanna féideartha i dtaca le dúshláin COVID19.

translation.en: For more information, visit your Local Enterprise Office online at LEO
translation.ga: Le haghaidh tuilleadh eolais, tabhair cuairt ar d’Oifig Fiontair Áitiúil ar líne ag LEO

translation.en: Training and Webinars
translation.ga: Oiliúint agus Seimineáir Gréasáin

translation.en: Local Enterprise Offices have moved training programmes, workshops and networking meetups online, covering areas such as:
translation.ga: Tá na hOifigí Fiontair Áitiúla i ndiaidh cláir oiliúna, ceardlanna agus cruinnithe líonraí a bhogadh ar líne, a chlúdaíonn réimsí ar nós

translation.en: cash management in a crisis
translation.ga: bainistiú airgid i ngéarchéim,

translation.en: leading your business through COVID19
translation.ga: do ghnólacht a stiúradh trí COVID19

translation.en: advice for employers impacted by the crisis
translation.ga: comhairle d’fhostóirí a ndeachaidh an ghéarchéim i gcion orthu.

translation.en: Most training programmes are free of charge
translation.ga: Tá cláir oiliúna saoir in aisce

translation.en: Other Government Supports in Place
translation.ga: Tacaí Rialtais eile atá ar bun

translation.en: COVID19 Hub
translation.ga: Mol COVID19

translation.en: Bord Iascaigh Mhara is providing COVID19 business support to the seafood sector.
translation.ga: Tá Bord Iascaigh Mhara ag soláthar tacaíochta gnó COVID19 d’earnáil an bhia mara.

translation.en: Code of Conduct for commercial rents:
translation.ga: Cód Iompair do chíosanna tráchtála:

translation.en: A voluntary Code of Conduct between landlords and tenants for commercial rents has been developed based on examples from other jurisdictions and with input from other Departments, State agencies and key stakeholders.
translation.ga: Tá cód deonach, Cód Iompair idir tiranaí talún agus toinóntaithe do chíosanna tráchtála forbartha bunaithe ar shamplaí ó dhlínsí eile agus le hionchur ó Ranna eile, gníomhaireachtaí Stáit agus príomhpháirtithe leasmhara.

translation.en: The aim of the Code is to facilitate discussions between landlords and tenants impacted by COVID19.
translation.ga: Is é aidhm an Chóis cuidiú le cainteanna idir tiarnaí talún agus tionóntaithe atá thíos le COVID19.

translation.en: Commercial Rates:
translation.ga: Rátaí Tráchtála:

translation.en: Commercial Rates Waiver
translation.ga: Tarscaoileadh Rátaí Tráchtála

translation.en: With limited exceptions, all businesses were granted a ninemonth commercial rates waiver
translation.ga: Seachas eisceachtaí teoranta, bronnadh tarscaoileadh rátaí tráchtála naoi mí

translation.en: Further commercial rates relief for affected sectors has been extended to 30 June 2021.
translation.ga: Tá tuilleadh faoisimh ó rátaí tráchtála d’earnálacha lena mbaineann sínte go dtí 30 Meitheamh 2021.

translation.en: The Companies Registration Office (CRO) has extended current Annual Returns Arrangement for companies.
translation.ga: Rinne an Oifig um Chlárú Cuideachtaí Office (CRO) leathnú ar an Socrú reatha i dtaca le Tuairiscí Bliantúla do chuideachtaí.

translation.en: Crossborder companies:
translation.ga: Cuideachtaí trasteorainn:

translation.en: InterTradeIreland’s Emergency Business Solutions offers professional advice, to the value of €2,250, to address key business challenges related to COVID19.
translation.ga: Cuireann Réitigh Éigeandála Gnó de chuid nterTradeIreland comhairle ghairmiúil ar fáil, ar luach €2,250, chu aghaidh a thabhairt ar phríomhdhúshláin ghnó a bhaineann le COVID19.

translation.en: The EMerge programme provides €2,800 consultancy support to help crossborder businesses develop online sales and eCommerce solutions.
translation.ga: Sa chlár eMerge cuirtear tacaíochta comhairliúcháin €2,800 ar fáil chun cuidiú le gnólachtaí trasteorann díolacháin ar líne agus réitigh ríomhthráchtála a fhorbairt.

translation.en: Department of Children, Equality, Disability, Integration and Youth €75 million funding for reopening Early Learning and Childcare Services.
translation.ga: An Roinn Leanaí, Comhionannais, Míchumais, Lánpháirtíochta agus Óige Maoiniú €75 milliún chun Seirbhísí Luathfhoghlama agus Cúraim Leanaí a athoscailt.

translation.en: The Department of Children, Equality, Disability, Integration and Youth has announced a funding package of €75 million for reopening early learning and childcare services.
translation.ga: D’fhógair an Roinn Leanaí, Comhionannais, Míchumais, Lánpháirtíochta agus Óige pacáiste maoinithe €75 milliún chun seirbhísí luathfhoghlama agus cúraim leanaí a athoscailt.

translation.en: The grants will help with additional costs associated with reopening after COVID19.
translation.ga: Cuideoidh na deontais le costais bhreise a bhaineann le hathoscailt i ndiaidh COVID19.

translation.en: The Design & Craft Council Ireland delivers a range of support and development programmes, including webinars and FAQs in response to COVID19.
translation.ga: Cuireann Comhairle Dearaidh & Ceardaíochta na hÉireann raon de chláir tacaíochta agus forbartha ar fáil, lena náirítear seimineáir gréasáin agus Ceisteanna Coitianta mar fhreagra ar COVID19.

translation.en: Employment Permits:
translation.ga: Ceadanna Fostaíochta:

translation.en: Employment Permits System Contingency Arrangements
translation.ga: Socruithe Teagmhasachta don Chóras Ceadanna Fostaíochta

translation.en: The Department of Enterprise, Trade and Employment (DETE) has implemented a contingency plan to ensure that the Employment Permits system will continue to operate in all scenarios, see COVID 19 Employment Permits System Contingency Arrangements.
translation.ga: Tá plean teagmhasach curtha i bhfeidhm ag an Roinn Fiontar, Trádála agus Fostaíochta (DETE) lena chinntiú go leanfaidh an córas do Cheadanna Fostaíochta ag feidhmiú i ngach cás, féach Socruithe Teagmhasacha don Chóras Ceadanna Fostaíochta COVID19

translation.en: The new €55 million Tourism Business Continuity Scheme will support those tourism businesses that were not eligible for the COVID Restrictions Support Scheme (CRSS) payment or previous Fáilte Ireland continuity grant schemes.
translation.ga: Mar fhreagra ar an ngéarchéim COVID19 agus an tionchar ar earnáil na turasóireachta, tá Mol Tacaí Gnó COVID19 Fáilte Ireland ag díriú a thacaí chun freagairt ar na dúshláin agus na bagairtí is práinní atá roimh gnólachtaí turasóireachta anois.

translation.en: In response to the COVID19 crisis and the impact on the tourism sector, the Fáilte Ireland COVID 19 Business Support Hub is targeting its supports to respond to the most urgent challenges and threats tourism businesses are now facing.
translation.ga: D’fhoilsigh Fáilte Ireland treoirlínte oibriúcháin a bhaineann go sainiúil leis an earnáil do thionscal na turasóireachta lena chinntiú go nathosclófar gnólachtaí turasóireachta go sábháilte.

translation.en: The full range of Enterprise Ireland, IDA Ireland, Local Enterprise Office and Údarás na Gaeltachta grant supports will be available to firms to help with strategies to innovate, diversify markets and supply chains and to improve competitiveness.
translation.ga: Beidh raon iomlán na dtacaí deontais ó Fiontar Éireann, IDA Ireland, Oifig Fiontair Áitiúil agus Údarás na Gaeltachta ar fáil do chuideachtaí chun cuidiú le straitéisí le nuáil, margaí agus slabhraí soláthair a athrú agus feabhas a chur ar iomaíochas.

translation.en: The National Standards Authority of Ireland (NSAI) has compiled a number of resources in response to COVID19.
translation.ga: Tá roinnt acmhainní curtha le chéile ag an Údarás um Chaighdeáin Náisiúnta na hÉireann (NSAI) mar fhreagra ar COVID19.

translation.en: To access any or all of the resources below, please visit NSAI updates and resources in response to COVID19.
translation.ga: Chun rochtain a fháil ar cheann ar bith de na hacmhainní thíos nó orthu go léir, tabhair cuairt ar nuashonruithe agus acmhainní NSAI mar fhreagra ar COVID19.

translation.en: COVID19 Guide for the Retail Sector
translation.ga: Treoir COVID19 d’Earnáil an Mhiondíola

translation.en: The NSAI has published a COVID19 Retail Protection and Improvement Guide to help retailers manage business continuity during the COVID19 emergency.
translation.ga: D’fhoilsigh NSAI Treoir um Chosaint agus Feabhsú Miondíola COVID19 chun cuidiú le miondíoltóirí leanúnachas gnó a bhainistiú le linn na héigeandála COVID19.

translation.en: It addresses risks to both workers and the public.
translation.ga: Tugtar aghaidh ann ar rioscaí d’oibrithe agus don phobal freisin.

translation.en: Shopping Centre Recovery and Protection Guide
translation.ga: Treoir d’Athshlánú agus Cosaint d’Ionaid Siopadóireachta

translation.en: The NSAI has published guidelines for shopping centres restoring business operations following a disruption or closure due to the COVID19 pandemic.
translation.ga: D’fhoilsigh NSAI treoirlínte d’ionaid siopadóireachta ag athshlánú oibríochtaí gnó i ndiaidh cur isteach nó dúnadh mar gheall ar an bpaindéim COVID19.

translation.en: Standards for medical supplies made freely available
translation.ga: Caighdeáin do sholáthairtí leighis curtha ar fáil go forleathan

translation.en: The NSAI and SAI Global have developed the COVID19 Response Package which will provide free access to Standards for medical devices and personal protective equipment.
translation.ga: D’fhorbair NSAI agus SAI Global an Pacáiste Freagartha COVID19 a sholáthróidh rochtain saor in aisce ar chaighdeáin do ghléasanna leighis agus trealamh cosanta pearsanta.

translation.en: Workplace Protection and Improvement
translation.ga: Cosaint agus Feabhas ar an Ionad Oibre

translation.en: The NSAI has published a Workplace Protection and Improvement Guide outlining preventative measures businesses can take to prevent the spread of COVID19.
translation.ga: D’fhoilsigh NSAI Treoir i dtaca le Cosaint agus Feabhas ar an Ionad Oibre ina léirítear bearta cosanta is féidir le gnólachtaí a dhéanamh chun leathnú COVID19 a chosc.

translation.en: Barrier masks for consumers
translation.ga: Maisc bhacainne do thomhaltóirí

translation.en: NSAI has developed a Specification Written in Fast Track (SWiFT) to address an urgent need for a consensusbased specification for nonmedical and nonPPE masks (barrier masks) for the general public.
translation.ga: Tá sonrúchán gasta (SWiFT) scríofa ag NSAI chun aghaidh a thabhairt ar riachtanas práinneach ar sonrúchán bunaithe ar chomhaontú do mhaisc neamhleighis agus neamhPPE (maisc bhacainne) don phobal i gcoitinne.

translation.en: Manufacturing and Importing
translation.ga: Déantúsaíocht agus Ollmharú

translation.en: The NSAI has produced a Quick Guide to manufacturing and importing PPE and Medical Devices to ensure compliance.
translation.ga: D’fhoilsigh NSAI Treoir Thapa ar dhéantúsaíocht agus ar iompórtáil PPE agus Gléasanna Leighis chun comhlíonadh a dheimhniú.

translation.en: Online Collaboration:
translation.ga: Comhoibriú Ar Líne:

translation.en: Online COVID19 platform to help firms collaborate
translation.ga: Ardán Ar Líne COVID19 chun cuidiú le cuideachtaí comhoibriú

translation.en: Companies aiming to help healthcare responses to the COVID19 crisis can now collaborate via a new online COVID19 platform.
translation.ga: Cuideachtaí atá ag iarraidh le cuidiú le freagraí chúram sláinte ar an ngéarchéim COVID19, is féidir leo comhoibriú anois trí ardán nua COVID19 ar líne.

translation.en: Spearheaded by InterTradeIreland and TechIreland, the crossborder platform allows businesses to see quickly, in and beyond their region, who they can work with to combat the many supply chain and manufacturing challenges generated by the pandemic and meet pressing public needs.
translation.ga: Á stiúradh ag InterTradeIreland agus TechIreland, cuireann an tardán trasteorann ar chumas gnólachtaí a fheiceáil go tapa, ina réigiún agus lasmuigh dá réigiún, cé leo is féidir leo obair chun troid i gcoinne an iliomad dúshláin sa slabhra soláthair agus sa déantúsaíocht a ghintear ag an bpaindéim agus freastal ar riachtanas práinneach poiblí.

translation.en: Posters & Signs:
translation.ga: Póstaeir & Comharthaí:

translation.en: Posters and signs for your premises
translation.ga: Póstaeir agus comharthaí do d’fhoirgnimh

translation.en: The Department of Health has issued a range of COVID19 posters and graphics including new stay safe guidelines for work, home, public transport, outdoors and shopping.
translation.ga: D’fhoilsigh an Roinn Sláinte raon de phóstaeir agus grafaicí COVID19 lena náirítear treoirlínte nua i dtaca le fanacht sábháilte don obair, don teaghlach, d’iompar poiblí, don taobh amuigh agus don tsiopadóireacht.

translation.en: Posters, leaflets and other resources for use in workplaces and communities are also available on the HSE website at COVID19 posters and resources and the HSA website at hsa.ie/covid19.
translation.ga: Tá póstaeir, bileoga agus acmhainní eile le húsáid in ionaid oibre agus i bpobail ar fáil freisin ar shuíomh gréasáin FSS ar póstaeir agus acmhainní COVID19 agus suíomh gréasáin an Údaráis Sláinte agus Sábháilteachta ag hsa.ie/covid19.

translation.en: Restaurants to operate as takeaways
translation.ga: Bialanna le feidhmiú mar bhialanna beir leat

translation.en: Amendments to Planning and Development Regulations temporarily allow restaurants to operate as takeaways whereby members of the public can order food for collection for consumption offpremises or have food delivered for consumption offpremises without being required to obtain change of use planning permission to operate as takeaways.
translation.ga: Ligeann leasuithe ar Rialacháin Pleanála agus Forbartha do bhialanna go sealadach feidhmiú mar bhialanna beir leat – inar féidir le baill den phobal bia a ordú le bailiú le hithe ar shiúl ón áitreabh nó bia a bheith seachadta le hithe ar shiúl ón áitreabh – gan iallach a bheith orthu athrú sa chead pleanála a fháil le feidhmiú mar bhialanna beir leat.

translation.en: Skillnet Ireland:
translation.ga: Skillnet Ireland:

translation.en: The ReBound Initiative
translation.ga: An Tionscnamh ReBound

translation.en: The Skillnet Ireland ReBound initiative offers guidance to SME owners and managers on implementing the Return to Work Safely Protocol.
translation.ga: Tugann an Tionscnamh ReBound ó Skillnet Ireland treoir d’úinéirí agus bainisteoirí FBManna maidir leis an Prótacal um Fhilleadh ar an Obair go Sábháilte a chur i bhfeidhm.

translation.en: Supply Chain:
translation.ga: Slabhra Soláthair:

translation.en: Supply Chain Workers
translation.ga: Oibrithe sa Slabhra Soláthair

translation.en: The Department of Transport has prepared COVID19 guidance for supply chain workers.
translation.ga: Tá treoir COVID19 ullmhaithe ag an Roinn Sláinte (DoH) d’oibrithe sa slabhra soláthair.

translation.en: The guidance document is part of the crossgovernment response to COVID19 and is available to download on gov.ie: COVID19 guidance for supply chain workers.
translation.ga: Tá an cháipéis treorach mar chuid den fhreagra trasrialtais ar COVID19 agus tá sé ar fáil le híoslódáil ar gov.ie: treoir COVID19 d’oibrithe sa slabhra soláthair

translation.en: How business can help with supplies and services to respond to COVID19
translation.ga: Conas is féidir le gnólachtaí cuidiú le soláthairtí agus seirbhísí le freagairt ar COVID19

translation.en: From the Office of Government Procurement (OGP) webpage for information on how to supply or donate the goods or services of your business please go to how business can help.
translation.ga: Le haghaidh eolais ón shuíomh gréasáin na hOifige um Sholáthar Rialtais (OGP) maidir le conas earraí nó seirbhísí do ghnólachtaí a sholáthar nó a bhronnadh, téigh chuig conas is féidir le gnó cuidiú.

translation.en: Teagasc is available to provide support on issues facing farm businesses in light of COVID19.
translation.ga: Tá Teagasc ar fáil chun tacaíocht a sholáthar maidir le saincheisteanna a bhaineann le gnólachtaí feirme i bhfianaise COVID19.

translation.en: Tourism, arts, culture and sports sectoral guidance:
translation.ga: Treoir earnála don turasóireacht, na healaíona, cultúr agus spórt:

translation.en: The COVID19 sectoral guidance from the Department of Tourism, Culture, Arts, Gaeltacht, Sport and Media provides targeted information for the sectors it supports.
translation.ga: Sa Treoir Earnála COVID19 ón Roinn Turasóireachta, Cultúir, Ealaíon, Gaeltachta, Spóirt agus Meán tigtar faisnéis spriocdhírithe do na hearnálacha a dtugann sé tacaíocht dóibh.

translation.en: Reopening Society and Business
translation.ga: Sochaí agus Gnó a Athoscailt

translation.en: This section highlights the 5 Level Framework for Restrictive Measures, the Return to Work Safely Protocol and the Health and Safety Authority COVID19 Template and Checklists.
translation.ga: Sa roinn seo aibhsítear an Creat 5 Leibhéal do Bhearta Sriantacha, an Prótacal um Fhilleadh ar an Obair go Sábháilte agus Teimpléad agus Seicliostaí COVID19 ón Údarás Sláinte agus Sábháilteachta.

translation.en: Resilience and Recovery 20202021: Plan for Living with COVID19
translation.ga: Teacht Aniar agus Athshlánú 20202021: Plean do Mhaireachtáil le COVID19

translation.en: On September 15 2020 the Government published the Resilience and Recovery 20202021: Plan for Living with COVID19.
translation.ga: An 15 Meán Fómhair 2020 d’fhoilsigh an Rialtas Teacht Aniar agus Athshlánú 20202021: Plean do Mhaireachtáil le COVID19.

translation.en: Ireland is moving from a shortterm emergency response approach to a mediumterm approach to managing risk and repairing the damage that COVID19 has inflicted on society.
translation.ga: Tá Éire ag bogadh ó chur chuige éigeandála gearrthéarma go cur chuige meántéarma i dtaca le bainistiú riosca agus leigheas ar an damáiste atá déanta ag COVID19 ar an tsochaí.

translation.en: The Framework for Restrictive Measures will help us to go about our daily lives as much as possible, while managing the behaviour of the virus.
translation.ga: Cuideoidh an Creat do Bhearta Sriantacha linn dul i mbun an tsaoil ó lá go lá oiread agus is féidir, agus iompraíocht an víris á bhainistiú.

translation.en: The Framework consists of 5 Levels.
translation.ga: Tá 5 Leibhéal sa Chreat.

translation.en: The lower Levels will be activated when there is low incidence of the disease, with isolated outbreaks, low community transmission.
translation.ga: Cuirfear na Leibhéil ísle i bhfeidhm nuair a bheidh minicíocht íseal den ghalar ann, le ráigeanna aonair ann agus trasseoladh íseal sa phobal.

translation.en: The higher Levels will be used to deal with higher incidences of the disease.
translation.ga: Bainfear úsáid as na Leibhéil arda le déileáil le minicíochtaí níos airde den ghalar.

translation.en: It will be possible for different regions and counties to be at a different Level to the National Level, depending on the incidence of the virus in that particular region or county.
translation.ga: Féadfaidh réigiúin agus contaetha éagsúla a bheith ag Leibhéal leis an Leibhéal Náisiúnta, ag brath ar mhinicíocht an víris sa réigiún nó contae ar leith sin.

translation.en: The 5 Level Framework can be viewed online: Resilience and Recovery 20202021: Plan for Living with COVID19.
translation.ga: Is féidir an Creat 5 Leibhéal a fheiceáil ar líne: Teacht Aniar agus Athshlánú 20202021: Plean do Mhaireachtáil le COVID19.

translation.en: The Work Safely Protocol
translation.ga: An Prótacal um Obair go Sábháilte

translation.en: The Work Safely Protocol is a revision of the Return to Work Safely Protocol published in May 2020.
translation.ga: Athchóiriú is ea an Prótacal um Obair go Sábháilte ar an bPrótacal um Fhilleadh ar an Obair go Sábháilte a foilsíodh i mBealtaine 2020.

translation.en: The revised Protocol incorporates the current advice on the Public Health measures needed to reduce the spread of COVID19 in the community and workplaces as issued by the National Public Health Emergency Team (NPHET), the Department of Health and Government.
translation.ga: Áirítear sa Phrótacal leasaithe an chomhairle reatha maidir le beartais Sláinte Poiblí atá de dhíth chun laghdú a dhéanamh ar leathnú COVID19 sa phobal agus sna hionaid oibre mar a d’eisigh an Fhoireann Náisiúnta Éigeandála Sláinte Poiblí (NPHET), an Roinn Sláinte agus an Rialtas.

translation.en: The Protocol is a general document applicable to all sectors.
translation.ga: Doiciméad ginearálta is ea an Prótacal a bhaineann leis na hearnálacha go léir.

translation.en: It sets out the minimum measures required in every place of work to prevent the spread of COVID19 and to facilitate the reopening of workplaces following temporary closures and the ongoing safe operation of those workplace.
translation.ga: Leagtar amach ann na bearta íosta atá de dhíth i ngach áit oibre le cosc a chur ar leathnú COVID19 agus le cuidiú le hathoscailt na nionad oibre i ndiaidh dúnta sealadacha agus oibriú sábháilte leanúnach na nionad oibre seo.

translation.en: The HSA (Health and Safety Authority) will be the lead agency in terms of overseeing compliance with the Protocol in the workplace.
translation.ga: Is é HSA (An tÚdarás Sláinte agus Sábháilteachta) a bheidh mar ghníomhaireacht ceannais i dtéarmaí osradhairc ar chomhlíonadh an Phrótacail san ionad oibre.

translation.en: If employers or employees need further guidance on the Protocol, the HSA Helpline can be contacted at
translation.ga: Má tá tuilleadh oibre de dhíth ar fhostóirí nó fostaithe i dtaca leis an bPrótacal, is féidir dul i dteagmháil le Líne Chabhrach HSA ar

translation.en: The Protocol is available online at Return to Work Safely Protocol
translation.ga: Tá an Prótacal ar fáil ar líne ar Prótacal um Fhilleadh ar an Obair go Sábháilte

translation.en: Data Protection: Return to Work Safely Protocol
translation.ga: Cosaint Sonraí: Prótacal um Fhilleadh ar an Obair go Sábháilte

translation.en: The Data Protection guidance document has been prepared to assist in providing the necessary clarification to employers (and their representatives) where the measures set out in the Return to Work Safely Protocol may result in the processing of personal data.
translation.ga: Ullmhaíodh an doiciméad treorach um Chosaint Sonraí chun cuidiú leis an soiléiriú riachtanach a sholáthar d’fhostóirí (agus dá nionadaithe) más rud é go mbeidh próiseáil ar shonraí pearsanta ann mar thoradh ar na bearta a leagtar amach sa Phrótacal um Fhilleadh ar an Obair go Sábháilte.

translation.en: The Data Protection protocol is available online at Data Protection Return to Work Safely Protocol
translation.ga: Tá an prótacal maidir le Cosaint Sonraí ar fáil ar líne ar Cosaint Sonraí: Prótacal um Fhilleadh ar an Obair go Sábháilte

translation.en: Health and Safety Authority (HSA): COVID19 Templates and Checklists
translation.ga: An tÚdarás Sláinte agus Sábháilteachta (HSA): Teimpléid agus Seicliostaí COVID19

translation.en: The HSA checklists and templates have been prepared to help employers, business owners and managers to get their business up and running again and to inform workers about what they need to do to help prevent the spread of Covid19 in the workplace.
translation.ga: Ullmhaíodh seicliostaí agus teimpléid HSA chun cuidiú le fostóirí, úinéirí gnó agus bainisteoirí a ngnólachtaí a chur ag obair arís agus chun oibrithe a chur ar an eolas faoinar gá dóibh a dhéanamh le cosc a chur ar leathnú Covid19 san ionad oibre.

translation.en: They have been drafted based on the Government’s Return to Work Safely Protocol and should be read in conjunction with the Return to Work Safety Protocol.
translation.ga: Rinneadh iad a dhréachtadh bunaithe ar phrótacal an Rialtais, an Prótacal um Fhilleadh ar an Obair go Sábháilte agus ba chóir iad a léamh i gcomhair leis an bPrótacal um Fhilleadh ar an Obair go Sábháilte.

translation.en: Employers and workers must work together to keep workplaces safe.
translation.ga: Ní mór d’fhostóirí agus oibrithe obair le chéile chun ionaid oibre a choimeád sábháilte.

translation.en: These checklists will help you to do that.
translation.ga: Cuideoidh na seicliostaí sin leat é sin a dhéanamh.

translation.en: To view or download the templates and checklists, please see HSA: COVID19 Templates and Checklists
translation.ga: Chun na teimpléid agus seicliostaí a fheiceáil nó a íoslódáil, féach HSA: Teimpléid agus Seicliostaí COVID19

translation.en: HSA Return to Work Safely Online Course
translation.ga: Cúrsa Ar Líne HSA um Fhilleadh ar an Obair go Sábháilte

translation.en: The course has been developed by the HSA to help you to understand the Return to Work Safely (RTWS) Protocol requirements for returning to work.
translation.ga: Tá an cúrsa forbartha ag HSA chun cuidiú leat tiuiscint a fháil ar na riachtanais sa Phrótacal um Fhilleadh ar an Obair go Sábháilte (RTWS) le filleadh ar an obair.

translation.en: The Return to Work Safely Induction course will take approximately 20 minutes to complete, and a certificate is available on completion.
translation.ga: Glacfaidh an cúrsa ionduchtaithe um Fhilleadh ar an Obair go Sábháilte thart ar 20 nóinéad le déanamh, agus tá teastas ar fáil nuair a chríochnófar é.

translation.en: The course is available at Return to Work Safely Online Course
translation.ga: Tá an cúrsa ar fáil ar Cúrsa Ar Líne um Fhilleadh ar an Obair go Sábháilte

translation.en: Guidance on Working from Home
translation.ga: Treoir maidir le hOibriú ón mBaile

translation.en: The Guidance on Working from Home Guide will enable employers and employees to understand the requirements when working from home.
translation.ga: Cuideoidh an Treoir maidir le hOIbriú ón mBaile le fostóirí agus fostaithe tuiscint a fháil ar na riachtanais agus iad ag oibriú ón mbaile.

translation.en: The guide is broken into 12 sections.
translation.ga: Bristear an treoir síos ina 12 roinn.

translation.en: To view or download the guide, please visit HSA: Guidance on Working from Home
translation.ga: Chun an treoir a fheiceáil nó a íoslódáil, tabhair cuairt ar HSA: Treoir maidir le hOibriú ón mBaile

translation.en: As the situation around COVID19 continues to develop, so too do the Government supports available.
translation.ga: De réir mar a leanann an staid i dtaca le COVID19 ag forbairt, is amhlaidh a bheidh an scéal i dtaca leis na tacaí Rialtais atá ar fáil.

translation.en: For uptodate information on the range of Government supports available to address COVID19related challenges, please visit:
translation.ga: Chun eolas cothrom le dáta a fháil ar an raon de thacaí rialtais atá ar fáil chun aghaidh a thabhairt ar dhúshláin a bhaineann le COVID19, tabhair cuairt ar:

translation.en: Department of Enterprise, Trade and Employment – COVID19
translation.ga: Roinn Gnó, Fiontar agus Nuálaíochta – COVID19

translation.en: Call Centre & Helplines
translation.ga: Lárionad Glaonna & Línte Cabhracha

translation.en: DETE Enterprise Information Centre
translation.ga: Lárionad Faisnéise Fiontar DETE

translation.en: The Department of Enterprise, Trade and Employment (DETE) has established an Enterprise Information Centre for information on the government supports available to businesses and enterprises affected by COVID19.
translation.ga: Tá Lárionad Faisnéise Fiontar bunaithe ag an Roinn Fiontar, Trádála agus Fostaíochta (DETE) d’eolas maidir leis na tacaí rialtais atá ar fáil do ghnólachtaí agus fiontair a ndeachaigh COVID19 i gcion orthu.

translation.en: Occupational Health and Safety Helpline
translation.ga: Líne Chabhrach Sláinte Cheirde agus Sábháilteachta

translation.en: For information on workplace health and safety please contact the Occupational Health and Safety Helpline.
translation.ga: Chun eolas a fháil ar shláinte agus sábháilteacht san ionad oibre déan teagmháil leis an Líne Chabhrach Sláinte Cheirde agus Sábháilteachta.

translation.en: COVID19 related prevention and recovery measures in the workplace
translation.ga: Bearta um chosc agus athshlánú ó COVID19 san ionad oibre

translation.en: For support in relation to improving your COVID19 related prevention and recovery measures in the workplace, contact the NSAI COVID19 helpline.
translation.ga: Chun tacaíocht a fháil i dtaca le feabhas a chur ar do bhearta um chosc agus athshlánú ó COVID19 san ionad oibre, déan teagmháil le líne chabhrach COVID19 de chuid NSAI.

translation.en: For more information, advice and guidelines from across government visit gov.ie/covid19
translation.ga: Le haghaidh tuilleadh eolais, comhairle agus treoirlínte ó ar fud an rialtais, tabhair cuairt ar gov.ie/covid19

translation.en: Resilience and Recovery 20202021: Plan for Living with COVID19
translation.ga: Teacht Aniar agus Athshlánú 20202021: Plean do Mhaireachtáil le COVID19

translation.en: Central Bank COVID19 information hub for consumers and businesses
translation.ga: Mol Eolais COVID19 an Bhainc Lárnaigh do thomhaltóirí agus gnólachtaí

translation.en: Competition and Consumer Protection Commission (CCPC)
translation.ga: An Coimisiún um Iomaíocht agus Cosaint Tomhaltóirí (CCPC)

translation.en: COVID19 Information Hub CCPC
translation.ga: Mol Eolais COVID19 CCPC

translation.en: Guidance for Business: COVID19 Face Masks
translation.ga: Treoir don Ghnó: Maisc Aghaidhe COVID19

translation.en: Department of Social Protection – Pandemic Unemployment Payment
translation.ga: An Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí – Íocaíocht Dífhostaíochta Phaindéimeach

translation.en: Department of Foreign Affairs (DFA) Travel Advice
translation.ga: An Roinn Gnóthaí Eachtracha (DFA) – Comhairle Taistil

translation.en: Department of Health – Updates
translation.ga: An Roinn Sláinte – Nuashonruithe

translation.en: EU Export Controls for Personal Protection Equipment
translation.ga: Rialuithe Easpórtála AE do Threalamh Cosanta Pearsanta

translation.en: Food Safety Authority of Ireland (FSAI)– COVID19
translation.ga: Údarás Sábháilteachta Bia na hÉireann (FSAI)– COVID19

translation.en: Government of Ireland – July Jobs Stimulus Package
translation.ga: Rialtas na hÉireann – Pacáiste Spreagtha Post Iúil

translation.en: Health Protection Surveillance Centre (HPSC) – Advice and Guidance
translation.ga: Lárionad Faire um Chosaint Sláinte (HPSC) – Comhairle agus Treoir

translation.en: National Standards Authority of Ireland (NSAI)
translation.ga: An tÚdarás um Chaighdeáin Náisiúnta na hÉireann (NSAI)

translation.en: Barrier Masks for Consumers: Requirements
translation.ga: Maisc Bhacainne do Thomhaltóirí: Riachtanais

translation.en: Local Enterprise Office – COVID19 Pandemic: Business Response
translation.ga: Oifig Fiontair Áitiúil – Paindéim COVID19: Freagairt Ghnó

translation.en: Appendix 1 – COVID19 Business Continuity Checklist
translation.ga: Aguisín 1 – Seicliosta Leanúnachais Gnó COVID19

translation.en: The following is a checklist of some of the key risks to the continuity of your business activities during the outbreak of COVID19 and of preparatory actions that can be taken to respond.
translation.ga: Seo a leanas seicliosta de chuid de na príomhrioscaí do leanúnachas do ghníomhaíochtaí gnó le linn na ráige COVID19 agus de na gníomhartha ullmhúcháin is féidir a dhéanamh mar fhreagra.

translation.en: Many of the actions are the same as you would have prepared during any type of similar threat such as preparations for influenza pandemics.
translation.ga: Tá neart de na gníomhartha mar an gcéanna leis na cinn a bheadh ullmhaithe agat le linn aon chineál de bhagairt chosúil ar nós ullmhúcháin do phaindéimí fliú.

translation.en: Your organisation should consider appointing a planning coordinator and/or team with defined responsibilities and budget for planning and for preparedness.
translation.ga: Ba chóir go ndéanfadh d’eagraíocht machnamh ar chomhordaitheoir agus/nó foireann pleanála le freagrachtaí sainithe agus buiséad do phleanáil agus d’ullmhacht.

translation.en: A deputy should also be appointed.
translation.ga: Ba chóir tánaiste a cheapadh freisin.

translation.en: If your organisation already has a business continuity planning process, you should consider addressing COVID19 within that process.
translation.ga: Má tá próiseas pleanála do leanúnachas gnó ag d’eagraíocht cheana, ba chóir duit smaoineamh ar aghaidh a thabhairt ar COVID19 laistigh den phróiseas sin.

translation.en: In relation to COVID19, it is particularly important that your organisation uses the national resources, posters and guidance that are available and updated on a regular basis to reflect the rapidly emerging situation.
translation.ga: I dtaca le COVID19, tá sé tábhachtach go háirithe go mbainfidh d’eagraíocht úsáid as na hacmhainní, póstaeir agus treoir náisiúnta atá ar fáil agus a nuashonraítear ar bhonn rialta mar fhreagra ar an staid atá ag teacht chun cinn go tapa.

translation.en: The links to COVID19 resources are available here:
translation.ga: Tá na naisc le hacmhainní COVID19 ar fáil anseo:

translation.en: Assign responsibility for planning and preparedness to a senior executive and a deputy
translation.ga: Freagracht as pleanáil agus ullmhacht a shannadh le feidhmeannach sinsearach agus tánaiste

translation.en: Obtain information on COVID19
translation.ga: Eolas a fháil ar COVID19

translation.en: Consult within the company, with workers and worker representatives
translation.ga: Comhairliúchán a dhéanamh laistigh den chuideachta, le oibrithe agus ionadaithe oibrithe

translation.en: Consult with suppliers on measures they are taking and on potential disruptions to supply chains
translation.ga: Comhairliúchán a dhéanamh le soláthraithe maidir le bearta atá á dhéanamh acu agus maidir le cur isteach a d’fhéadfadh tarlú ar shlabhraí soláthair

translation.en: Assess ‘high level’ impact on your business and attach appropriate priority to the planning process
translation.ga: Measúnú a dhéanamh ar thionchar ‘ardleibhéil’ ar do ghnólacht agus tosaíocht chuí a chur ar an bpróiseas pleanála

translation.en: Develop a business continuity plan
translation.ga: Plean leanúnachais gnó a fhorbairt

translation.en: Establish authorities, triggers and procedures for implementing plan
translation.ga: Údaráis, cúiseanna agus nósanna imeachta a bhunú chun an plean a chur i bhfeidhm

translation.en: Test the plan in exercises
translation.ga: An plean a thástáil i gcleachtaí

translation.en: Share best practice with other businesses
translation.ga: Deachleachtas a chomhroinnt le gnólachtaí eile

translation.en: Revisit plan periodically
translation.ga: Athchuairt a thabhairt ar an bplean ó am go ham

translation.en: Identify critical activities and the employees and inputs required to maintain them
translation.ga: Gníomhaíochtaí criticiúla a shainaithint agus na fostaithe agus na hionchuir atá de dhíth chun iad a choinneáil

translation.en: Consider the possible impact of employee absences
translation.ga: Smaoineamh ar thionchar féideartha neamhláithreachtaí fostaithe

translation.en: Consider the possible impact of disruption to the supply of inputs from suppliers in Ireland and overseas suppliers
translation.ga: Smaoineamh ar thionchar féideartha ar chur isteach ar sholáthar ionchur ó sholáthraithe in Éirinn agus thar lear

translation.en: Examine the likely impact of COVID19 on your market and on your customers’ requirements
